channel.title: Iron Radio
channel.description: An audio library and podcast site for bodybuilding, sports nutrition, powerlifting, athletes and coaches.
channel.itunes:author: Stevens, Nelson
channel.itunes:summary: Iron Radio is a science-based talk show and podcast about the nutrition, training, coaching, health, and psychology of strength sports like bodybuilding and powerlifting. Each week we interview experts and discuss a topic. Look for our Podcast in the iTunes Music Store
channel.itunes:subtitle: A talk show about nutrition, bodybuilding, powerlifting, coaching and strength sports

item.title: Episode 677 IronRadio - Topic NFL Training Camp, Powerlifting Records
item.description: On this week's Iron Radio, the guys talk a bit about NFL training camp, new powerlifting records set this past weekend, and much more.

item.title: Episode 679 IronRadio - Topic Sheep, Weightlifting Injuries, Crossfit Drug Testing
item.description: Phil is on the road again this week at a Best Western picking up sheep. Jerell catches us up on weightlifting injuries to Team USA and possibly losing our first world record holder in quite some time. Msssive amount of drug test failures in Crossfit since testing changed. Theft in books and content in the fitness industry. Are powerlifters the best athletes or is powerlifting great to make the best athletes?

item.title: Episode 678 IronRadio - Topic Facility Shutdown, Special Forces Experience
item.description: This week on Iron Radio: Mike, Jerell, and Phil talk about Phil shutting down his facility to the public, stepping away from having an open facility, and going back to mainly distance coaching. Then we delve into the course that Mike took part in, giving us some insight into "The Special Forces Experience", and then we talk about brief periods of extreme stressors and whether they are beneficial.

item.title: Episode 677 IronRadio - Topic SWIS Conference, Trade Portal and College Sports
item.description: On this week's show Jerell and Phil shoot the shit on the SWIS conference coming to Columbus Ohio. Then the trade portal and NIL money and how it will affect college sports, for better and worse. Strength sports and the environment, now vs then.

item.title: Episode 676 IronRadio - Topic Granite Games, HRV, Larry Wheels' Return to Strongman
item.description: On this week's show the guys talk about the Granite Games. Lonnie pops over a study about HRV and overreaching. Larry Wheels going to strongman again. The guys explore strongman training, the when and why.

item.title: Episode 675 IronRadio - Topic WSM Finals Results, Granite Games
item.description: On this week's show the guys talk about the World's Strongest Man results, Crossfit/Granite Games, strength endurance vs strength and more.

item.title: Episode 674 IronRadio - Topic WSM Finals Preview, the Strongman GOAT
item.description: On this week's Iron Radio the guys talk about the upcoming World's Strongest Man finals and delve into that. Who has won the most WSM titles; who is the best ever strongman? How do you narrow down who is the GOAT in a sport? Do you adjust that for the time they lived?

item.title: Episode 673 IronRadio - Topic SWIS Conference, Shaw Classic, Youth Sports Culture
item.description: On this week's episode we talk about new, the SWIS conference, the Shaw Classic, and more. Then we take on a listener question about deloading for beginners, then we go down the rabbit hole of physical culture and youth sports and how fucked up it is.

item.title: Episode 672 IronRadio - Topic Atrial Fibrillation, Maximal vs Submaximal Training
item.description: Strength training and atrial fibrillation: does it cause harm? Submaximal and maximal training defined. What are the benefits and drawbacks of maximal training vs submaximal?

item.title: Episode 671 IronRadio - Topic Kim Kardashian, Crash Diets
item.description: For the first time ever we talk about Kim Kardashian on Iron Radio as a main topic. Then we segue into crash diets: when they are useful and when they are not.

item.title: Episode 670 IronRadio - Topic Masters' Nationals, Poorly Run Meets
item.description: Jerell talks about Masters' Nationals. Phil chimes in on other poorly run meets, strongman, and how people can relate to it better if meet directors choose to let them, and more.

item.title: Episode 669 IronRadio - Topic Mike's Special Forces Experience Camp
item.description: Mike is back from a special forces experience camp. We talk about extreme tests, when and how to use them.

item.title: Episode 668 IronRadio - Topic Phil's Highland Games, StrongFirst Programming, Bodybuilder Dieting
item.description: Phil's highland games. Jerell's StrongFirst programming cert review, bodybuilder dieing, crossfit and much more.

item.title: Episode 667 IronRadio - Topic Testicular Sunbathing!
item.description: On this week's Iron Radio, by listener request we talk about sunning your balls!!! And a lot more...

item.title: Episode 666 IronRadio - Topic Phil's Highland Games Prep, Weightlifters and Drug Use, Masters' Weightlifting
item.description: Phil finds out he's old as he gears up to throw in his first highland games in a few years. More weightlifters are popped for drug use. Jerell starts a weekly tirade about how messed up masters' weightlifting is. Grip training, dealift, and more.

item.title: Episode 665 IronRadio - Topic Louie Simmons, Trans Athletes
item.description: On this week's show, we talk about the passing of two people in the world of strength, including legend Louie Simmons. Then we delve into probably the most controversial topic we ever have, trans athletes in sports.

item.title: Episode 664 IronRadio - Topic Hafthor-Hall, Brittney Griner, Crossfit Open
item.description: On this week's episode, Phil, Dr. Mike and Jerell talk about the Hafthor and Hall fight, world issues with WNBA star Brittney Griner held in Russia, the Crossfit Open, and much more.

item.title: Episode 663 IronRadio - Topic Lonnie's Return and the Arnold
item.description: On this weeks episode Lonnie joins us on the show. We talk about the Arnold and results from that as well as the events. Then we catch up with Lonnie on what he's been doing and much more.

item.title: Episode 662 IronRadio - Topic Running a Gym, Strength and Muscle Mass, Crossfit Open
item.description: On this weeks episode with Phil tied up at the Arnold, Jerell and Dr. Mike talk about running a gym, strength and muscle mass and their effect on sports performance, the Crossfit Open, and more.

item.title: Episode 661 IronRadio - Topic USMO Podcast and Matt Vincent, the Arnold, the Olympics
item.description: On this weeks episode, the guys talk about Phil being on the UMSO podcast with Matt Vincent, the Arnold, the lackluster viewership of the Olympic Games, and much more.

item.title: Episode 660 IronRadio - Topic Drugs in the Olympics, Hall vs. Hafthor, Crossfit
item.description: On this week's episode of Iron Radio, the guys talk about the Olympics and drugs, Hall vs Hafthor, Crossfit, and more.

item.title: Episode 659 IronRadio - Topic Winter Olympics, Fitness in Strength Sports
item.description: On this week's episode of Iron Radio, the guys talk about the Winter Olympics, being fit as it relates to strength sports, and tests for fitness level.

item.title: Episode 658 IronRadio - Topic Coaching and Running a Gym
item.description: On this episode of Iron Radio the guys talk about coaching and running a gym in today's world and expand from there.

item.title: Episode 657 IronRadio - Topic Quarantine, Licking Frogs, and the Olympics
item.description: On Iron Radio this week we cover forced quarantine, licking poisonous frogs, an "all the drugs" Olympics and much more.

item.title: Episode 656 IronRadio - Topic Jerell and Phil
item.description: On this episode of Iron Radio, Jerell and Phil take the helm while Mike is out licking frogs. The guys catch up on the upcoming Arnold, weightlifting updates, crossfit drama and much more.

item.title: Episode 655 IronRadio - Topic Resolutions, Goals, and Hot Topics for 2022
item.description: On this episode of Iron Radio, Phil and Dr. Mike cover New Year's resolutions, goals and what's going to be hot in 2022.

item.title: Episode 654 IronRadio - Topic Olympic Weightlifting and Special Kinds of People
item.description: On this week's episode Dr. Mike and Phil talk about weightlifting and boxing potentially being out of the Olympics. Then they fall down the rabbit hole on that topic and talk about the special person it takes to concentrate for 10 years on two lifts, training alone and more.

item.title: Episode 653 IronRadio - Topic Patent Infringement, American Open and Worlds, Supplements
item.description: On this week's episode the guys talk about patent infringement. The American Open finals and weightlifting Worlds. Phil training 6 days a week. Deer antler velvet and other "supplements backed by studies". What are the staple supplements to take?

item.title: Episode 652 IronRadio - Topic Dave Draper, Coaches, Therapies and Placebo Effect
item.description: On this week's episode of Iron Radio the guys talk about the loss in the strength world of Dave Draper. Coaches being open to growth or closed down. Cold therapy, contrast, placebo effect, and much more.

item.title: Episode 651 IronRadio - Topic Strength Guild Games Announcement, Effects of Plastics, Volume vs Intensity
item.description: On this episode the guys shoot the shit after post holiday eating. Phil announces the Strength Guild Games are coming back this year. The Pan Am Games. Plastics and their effect on your body. Volume vs intensity and more.

item.title: Episode 650 IronRadio - Topic Phil's Meet, Proteing and DNA, Holiday Training and Eating
item.description: Phil's meet recap. Protein intake and DNA damage. Dealing with training and eating during the holidays.

item.title: Episode 649 IronRadio - Topic Rogue Invitational Finals, Weightlifting Pan Ams, Phil's Meet Prep
item.description: Coach J and Phil talk about the Rogue Invitational finals and weightlifting Pan Ams. Talk about Phil's upcoming meet, how he prepped for it, and more.

item.title: Episode 648 IronRadio - Topic Special Olympics, The Triad, Rogue Invitational Strongman, Protein
item.description: On this week's episode Dr. Mike, Coach J, and Phil talk a little about a recap of the Special Olympics meet Phil coached at. The Triad, a meet Phil was introduced to by Matt Vincent. Protein intake does not reduce muscle loss when immobilized. A peek into the Rogue Invitational adding in strongman and the possibility of other events coming like this.

item.title: Episode 647 IronRadio - Topic Pros and Cons of Licensing
item.description: This week the guys hit some news and then talk shop on the benefits and negatives to training professions being a licensed practice, not that they ever will.

item.title: Episode 646 IronRadio - Topic Strongman Corp Nationals, Big Names, and Meals
item.description: This week the guys talk a bit about Strongman Corp Nationals. The problems with Big Names and saying they got all their gainz from this or that product. Then we flesh out a bit more the constant argument on how many meals and how big they should be.

item.title: Episode 645 IronRadio - Topic Overeating Protein, Lifting 800 Pounds, PRs and Training Maturity
item.description: The guys talk about overeating protein and its conversion to fat. Lifting 800lbs, Maturity in training. When to go for PRâ€™s. When to walk away.

item.title: Episode 644 IronRadio - Topic Arnold Classic 2021, Home Training vs Gym Training
item.description: The first real week of Iron Radio unplugged and unedited. The guys talk about the Arnold Classic results. NAC potentially being banned. The 2021 show down meet and all the ATWR broken. The differences of training at a facility vs at home and more...

item.title: Episode 643 IronRadio
Episode 642 IronRadio
Episode 641 IronRadio
Episode 640 IronRadio - Topic Warm-ups and Cool-downs Revisited
item.description: After discussing some muscle industry news, the guys revisit the topics of whole-body vs. body part-specific warm ups - and cool downs to enhance recovery from intense sessions. Note that Dr. Lowery's involvement with the podcast ends this month (8/2021) but his YouTube channel will continue to host the legacy material through episode 640. (Watch for different YouTube links to the newer, likely more raw version of the show!)

item.title: Episode 639 IronRadio - Topic Favorite Videos, Phil Q-and-A
item.description: Caution, this one is almost certainly not for kids after the break, in the Coach Stevens portion. The guys first touch on science news news connecting personality and food choices, then discuss favorite videos, TV, and movies related to muscle sports. After the the break, there's an on-site recorded question-and-answer session on powerlifting and bodybuilding that Coach Stevens held in Montana. The usual warning about language likely holds here, as it was recorded with a live audience of lifters. Lastly, remember to watch the existing You Tube channel and www.IronRadio.org for ways to continue following Iron Radio as Phil and Mike modernize it and keep it going strong!

item.title: Episode 638 IronRadio - Topic Telling Kids About Muscle Sports
item.description: As the crew winds down the current, old version of IronRadio and prep for Dr. Lowery's imminent departure in August, they discuss news on various types of chrono-nutrition and how they've experimented with it. After the break, the guys discuss how they'd explain muscle and strength sports to a child. How would YOU do it? Also, please wait for next week to hear Phil's seminar in Montana! Lastly, remember to watch the existing You Tube channel and www.IronRadio.org for ways to continue following Iron Radio as Phil and Mike modernize it and keep it going strong!

item.title: Episode 637 IronRadio - Topic Ma and Pa Gyms
item.description: After covering some news on the sunsetting of the old version of IronRadio and Dr. Lowery's absence after August 2021, the guys cover listener mail and talk about the pros and cons of Ma and Pa gyms. Do you prefer multiple outlets, plentiful funding and amenities, or a smaller team atmosphere? The intreprid trio also discuss online aspects of training. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 636 IronRadio - Guest Andrew Heffernan Topic Writing for the General Population
item.description: After the usual health science news, Dr. Nelson heads-up a chat with writer, editor, and trainer Andrew Heffernan. Everyone discusses health-fitness-nutrition journalism in the lay press. The talk ranges from click-bait to balancing business realities with evidence-based educational content. Warning - Phil is salty about this stuff, although Lonnie's sunshine-and-rainbows perspective provides some balance. Mike and Andrew, meanwhile, manage to keep the topic on the rails. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 635 IronRadio - Guest Guillermo Escalante Topic What It Takes to be a Pro Bodybuilder
item.description: In this mega-episode, the guys first cover science news on new carb-monitoring tech and how carbs affect aging. What does it all mean for lifters? After the mid-show break, Dr. Nelson interviews top bodybuilder Dr. Guillermo Escalante about what it takes to break into the pros. It's a long episode for those into extra content! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 634 IronRadio - Topic All Aboard the Q and A Train
item.description: Early episode coming down the tracks! This replaces, in advance, the coming weekend's usual episode. With Dr. Lowery hurtling across the Midwest on a train, Coach Stevens and Dr. Nelson offer question-and-answer sessions with topics ranging from training partners, to super-high-volume reps in the squat over 12-hour periods, to ways of programming and keeping track of recovery. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 633 IronRadio - Topic Lifting and Self Confidence
item.description: After a fun discussion on the week's science news, ranging from personal trainers' appearance, to carbs in paleo diets, to food and mood, the guys share thoughts about how the progressive nature of lifting builds self-confidence. Lastly, mighty thanks to our strong supporters like Joel Tony, Kara, and the Steak-n-Hoagie shop. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 632 IronRadio - Topic The Show Must Go On
item.description: With Dr. Lowery working this weekend, the guys offer individual recordings because the show must go on! Dr. L shares science news on which music leads to the biggest bench, how sex affects response to ketogenic dieting, and whether fish oils can help your carb metabolism. Phil ranges from sandwich meats, to travel, to summer training, and Dr. Nelson does a great summary of the recent ISSN annual meeting. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 631 IronRadio - Topic Sleeping and Napping
item.description: After covering listener mail and science news on recovering from tendon ruptures and on new compression shorts with sensors embedded, the guys revisit sleeping and napping, with new insights, suggestions, and evidence. Also, hearty thanks to Fred, Joel, Robert, and Thomas for their strong support. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 630 IronRadio - Topic Individual Takes
item.description: A technical glitch, combined with travel, leaves the guys offering some individual blurbs. Lonnie gives an update on how coffee may help nervous system recovery, Phil drops knowledge bombs during a Q-and-A, and Dr. Nelson gives actionable tips on physiologic flexibility. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 629 IronRadio - Topic The Science of Hard Gainers
item.description: After mail and news covering a portable metabolism-measuring device, using heavy negatives, and what happens to fast-gainers during detraining, the guys talk about hard gainers - to what extent they exist and what to do with them. Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Joe, Joseph, John, and Tony. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 628 IronRadio - Topic Recent Buys and Whys
item.description: After analyzing some nutrition science news on nitrate and iron, and how they relate to exercise, the guys talk about recent purchases of training and food equipment and why they bought them. Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Neil, Tyler, Steven, and the Outdoor Alliance Company. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 627 IronRadio - Guest Wendi Irlbeck Topic Nutrition and Body Composition
item.description: With Phil off in the wilderness, Mike and Lonnie nerd out with nutritionist Wendi Irlbeck on topics like high-protein intakes, how to increase veggies in the diet, and the methods and benefits of obtaining and carrying high muscle mass. Special note regarding the power of digestion - reportedly just 20 percent of the unchewed swallowed shrew's bones made it into the subject's poo... tune in to the second half for that weird discussion! Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Marek, Monique, Joe, and Travis. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 626 IronRadio - Guest David Barr Topic Recovery
item.description: After offering some news on vitamin D and COVID-19, and on gene therapy's ramifications for lifters, the intrepid trio chat with industry insider, author, and scientist David Barr. The topic is recovery and it comes with real gold nuggets about both neural and muscular "returns to baseline". Come on in! Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Douglas, Jacob1, Isaac, and Cale. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 625 IronRadio - Topic Annual Graduation Patchwork Episode
item.description: With Dr. L off at his annual medieval ceremony, each cohost individually shares news and views. Topics range from the immune system and muscle growth, to big competitive lifts, to cold water immersion. Come on in! Note that introductory comments about real jobs are NOT a slight against legitimate online fitness professionals! Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Korey, Matthew, Chris, Jon, and John. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 624 IronRadio - Topic Costs of Aggressive Bulking
item.description: Ever go all-in on massive weight gain? Ever wonder what is was doing to your body aside from the muscular gains? Join in for a discussion on the less healthy aspects of the war of the knife and fork, including exclusive chat about what Rutgers researchers saw in Phil's intestinal microbiota! Lastly, thank you to strong supporters Kurt, Steven, Ryan, Jill, and Prasan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 623 IronRadio - Topic Lifting Career Stages, Advice
item.description: Have you ever reflected on the stage you presently hold in your lifting career? Or how your training philosophy may have evolved? Tune in for a discussion on how the cohosts view necessary life phases and how they get addressed by coaches. Also check out the chat about how COVID-19 has altered the fitness landscape, maybe forever. Lastly, mighty thanks to new supporter, Robert. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 622 IronRadio - Topic Nutrition for Self Care Top Three
item.description: Do you eat like an adult? Join the intrepid trio as they offer top tips for nutritional self-care. Sometimes it's not about performance, but rather giving a little thought to career longevity and well-being. Also tune in for science news on blueberries, antioxidant vitamins, and coffee! Lastly, big thanks to strong supporters Fred, Jacob2, Isaac, Cory, and Rey. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 621 IronRadio - Topic Social Gym Irritations
item.description: Gyms continue to reopen more broadly and despite the advantages, that means a return to dealing with certain... irritations. Tune in as the guys talk about their experiences with annoyingly bad behaviors, from poor hygiene to wasteful chit-chat, to camping out on a piece of equipment, to unwanted advances, tough guys and more. Also check out the news on the upper limit of exercise, unusal testosterone risks, and things you may not know about the mineral magnesium. Lastly, big thanks to strong supporters Wyatt, Michael, Joseph, and Tom. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 620 IronRadio - Topic Photobiology, Testosterone Therapy and Lifters
item.description: Listener mail leads to analysis of a few existing studies, lay journalism, and subjective observations regarding light therapy and hormone replacement in general. What should a young or old male or female expect from various approaches? Also, huge thanks to recent major donor Anthony as well as strong regular supporters Tony, Austin, Nicholas, and Kara. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 619 IronRadio - Topic Hormone, Food, and Muscle News
item.description: Dr. L and Coach Stevens discuss breaking science news on androgens and COVID-19, the Dirty Dozen foods list, and a few new papers on the best choices of sets and reps to max-out size versus strength. At the end, Dr. Nelson is back on the road - this time covering a cool neural conference. Check it out! Lastly, huge thanks to strong supporters Tyler, Neil, Steven, Kurt, and Stephen. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 618 IronRadio - Topic Which Body Shape is Strongest
item.description: First, Phil shares a good story about his powerlifting meet! Then, a listener question ignites a brief lit review and in-the-trenches discussion of which body shapes and features do best in various lifts. Weight-for-height, mesomorphy, percent fat, and various limb lengths all contribute to varying degrees. Of course, no single feature dictates how well you'll perform. Pull up a bench and get in on this! Lastly, huge thanks to strong supporters Joe, David, Monique, Nathan, and Marsh. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 617 IronRadio - Guest Trisha VanDusseldorp Topic Professional Memberships
item.description: After a follow-up regarding the nutritional details of plant-based meats hitting the big time, Drs. Nelson and Lowery chat with Dr. Trisha VanDusseldorp, ISSN President, about the best memberships for science-loving lifters. Apologies for the poor Skype connection in this one. Also, huge thanks to strong supporters Christopher, Rey, Andrew, Philip, and Douglas. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 616 IronRadio - Guest Sam Pogue Topic Ways to Overload
item.description: Some brief news on plant-based meats entering the fast food world is followed by a discussion with businessman, trainer, and entrepreneur Sam Pogue. The discussion is on all things overload. How does one do it wisely? What are the options? Get in on the conversation!

item.title: Episode 615 IronRadio - Guest Nate Hadd Topic Military Fitness Requirements
item.description: After discussing a bit of science news on whether female powerlifters or Olympic lifters have the densest bones, the guys talk with military careerist Nate Hadd to get the inside scoop on what special forces and other military groups expect of their soldiers. Can one be too muscular? Could YOU pass the entry tests? Find out! Also, huge thanks to strong supporters Joe, Steven, Ryan, Jill, and Kara. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 614 IronRadio - Guest Jen Bates Topic Transitioning Powerlifting to Strongman
item.description: Join the guys as they converse with strongman competitor Jen Bates on topics ranging from women in strength sports to advantages and disadvantages of moving from powerlifting to strongman. Caution, potty-mouth lifters at work in this episode. Also, huge thanks to strong supporters Joe, Nathan, Travis, Thomas, Joel, and Marsh. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 613 IronRadio - Topic Speed Kills Redux
item.description: Starting with listener questions about inconvenient truths in professional journals, and moving on to some scientific literature concerning last week's sodium intake question, the guys then get to the concept of rep speed. When is it bad and when is it good to go fast? Pull up a bench and find out! Lastly, huge thanks to solid supporters Matt, Jacob, Jacob 2, Cory, Isaac, and Christopher. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 612 IronRadio - Topic The Riddle of Steel
item.description: After covering listener mail on plant proteins, adaptogens, and sodium - plus some new science on muscle inflammation - the intrepid trio explores the Riddle of Steel. Why are muscle sports a calling for some? Does the call differ from the way in which team sports draw-in people? Pull up a bench and get in on some of this wisdom. THIS you can trust.

item.title: Episode 611 IronRadio - Topic News, New IronRadio Forums
item.description: After sharing fitness news on a bizarre way to potentially enhance muscle mass and recovery, and on the fat-but-fit controversy, Phil and Lonnie talk shop about the brand new IronRadio forums! They're called TheIronForum.com and will provide a better way to interact with the podcast. Also, sincere thanks to Coach Hite's Corner, Tyler, Neil, and Steven. You will get perks in upcoming activities!

item.title: Episode 610 IronRadio - Topic Muscle Mass, Evolution, and Sex
item.description: A listener question opens a discussion and mini-scientific literature review. Is muscle hypertrophy just a side effect compared to other, clearly advantageous training adaptations? Or could it play a valuable role in human evolution? Also, sincere thanks to Matt for his recent donation as well as strong monthly supporters like Ryan, Marek, David1, David2, and Monique. You will get perks in upcoming activities!

item.title: Episode 609 IronRadio - Guest Ashleigh VanHouton Topic Female Bodybuilding, Organ Meats
item.description: Join the guys in a discussion with female bodybuilder and author Ashleigh VanHouton as they discuss women's bodybuilding, competitive mindsets, and nutrition issues including Ashleigh's interest in organ meats. Also tune in for news on a toxic metal that may worsen flu severity and may be in your health food lineup as well as Britain's attempts to control unhealthy foods and more! Lastly, sincere thanks to Joe for his recent donation as well as strong monthly supporters like Michael, Jacob, Jacob2, Isaac, and new supporter Rey. You will get perks in upcoming activities!

item.title: Episode 608 IronRadio - Topic What's in YOUR Fridge
item.description: What's in YOUR fridge? After covering some health science news including the new 2020-2025 Dietary Guidelines for Americans, the guys spot check their own refrigerators for compliance or lack thereof. Also, sincere thanks to strong monthly supporters like the Steak-n-Hoagie Shop, John, Jon, Cale, and Joseph. You will get perks in upcoming activities!

item.title: Episode 607 IronRadio - Topic Must-See Fitness Places 2021
item.description: With hopes for society slowly starting to resemble something like normal in mid-2021, the guys offer their top three fitness places or events to go see. Powerlifting, bodybuilding, and sports nutrition locations all get attention. Each of these will inform and inspire regarding the muscle-sport landscape! Also, sincere thanks to generous funds drive donor Sean as well as strong monthly supporters like Nicholas, Austin, Kara,and Kelsey. You will get perks in upcoming activities! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 606 IronRadio - Topic Past Predictions for 2020 - Were We Right
item.description: After covering some health science news on curcumin supplements for muscle strength and for anti-catabolic and recovery effects, Drs. Nelson and Lowery look back on past 2020 predictions for the fitness industry and assess whether they were right. There's also some brief Mr. Olympia talk. Come on in! Also, sincere thanks to strong monthly supporters like Neil, Tyler, Steven, Kurt, and Ryan. You will get perks in upcoming activities! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 605 IronRadio - Topic Carb Connections, Christmas
item.description: Ever heard of dietary advanced glycation end products - AGEs? Depending partly on your blood sugar levels and sex, they're yet another dietary concern linked to poor carb handling, body fat, cognitive decline, and even cartilage damage in the spine. Tune in for a list of high-AGE foods with tips on which are best to avoid, because not all are feasible omissions. In other news, listen-in for food-sleep connections and how women may again differ. Lastly, what do the guys want for Christmas and how does their wish list compare to your own? It's a fun December topic! Come on in! Also, sincere thanks to strong monthly supporters like David, Joe, Travis, Joel, and Marsh. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 604 IronRadio - Guest Heather MacDonald Topic Egghead-Meathead
item.description: Join a discussion with university professor, strongwoman competitor and Highland Games athlete Heather MacDonald! Topics range from being an elite or pro female in these sports to post-college strength training for competition, to work-life balance especially in academia. Also, sincere thanks to strong monthly supporters like Joseph, Michael, Cale, and Korey. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 603 IronRadio - Topic MEAT
item.description: Health science news on vitamin D and on safer meat cookery leads to a discussion on all things carnivorous. Join Tyrannosaur Phil Stevens, Lonnie Lowery, and Mike T Nelson for their favorite types of meat, recipes, cooking skills, nutrients, tips, and tons more. Also, sincere thanks to Fall Funds Drive donor Robert, and of course to strong monthly supporters like Tony, Kara, the Steak-n-Hoagie Shop, Austin, and Joel. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 602 IronRadio - Topic Muscle Publications What to Look For
item.description: After some discussion on salt taxes and prescription vegetables, the intrepid trio again reflects on the evolution of muscle magazines and powerlifting publications, including what to look for. Also, sincere thanks to strong monthly supporters like Kurt, Jill, Steven, Marek, and Prasan. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall and Holiday Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 601 IronRadio - Topic Work Exhaustion vs Training
item.description: Health science news covers a new strength and conditioning book, body characteristics of elite strongmen, and problems with omega-6 vegetable oils. Then the guys address how they handle stressed and exhausted clients who need to perform in the gym. Also, sincere thanks to Fall Funds Drive contibutor Fred, as well as strong monthly supporters like Thomas, Travis, Nathan, and Joe. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 600 IronRadio - Topic Then and Now
item.description: It's episode 600 - After covering a backlog of mail, reviews, and news, the intrepid triumvirate look back at how the show has changed over the years. Science topics include strength maintenance whilst dieting, nuts and weight gain, keto supplements, and problems with excessive fructose intake. After the mid-show break, a retrospective covers competitive and ideological changes for each co-host over the years, an unwavering mission of qualified, weekly information, and tons more. Come on in! Also, sincere thanks to strong supporters like Jacob, Cory, Isaac, Christopher, and Doug. You are appreciated! Finally, check out https://www.ironradio.org to participate in the Fall Funds Drive yourself!

item.title: Episode 599 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Listener Questions
item.description: After sharing science news on top fitness food trends, vitamin C as a possible anti-catabolic agent, and sleep apnea, the guys cover a host of listener questions on topics ranging from uncoupling agents and beta-agonists, to super-totals, to dealing with arthritis and tons more. And last but not least, thanks go out to recent donor Sean and new subscriber Peter, as well as regulars like these who help bring you the show - Austin, Kara, Peter, Nicholas, Jon, and Andrew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 545 IronRadio - Guest Lacie Mackey Topic Coffee in the Sports Nutrition Business
item.description: Lacie Mackey, fitness professional in the film industry and CEO of her own coffee company, joins the guys to talk about her caffeinated, hard-training world. The episode covers topics from the coffee-fitness connection to medium chain triglyceride products and even gout. Also, the Fall Funds Drive is underway as well as a new contest! Last but not least, THANK YOU to donor Anthony, and regulars like these who help bring you the show - Kurt, Neil, Travis, Alan, and Steven. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 544 IronRadio - Topic Broad Physical Functionality
item.description: After news covering a record breaking performance and the pros and cons of processed foods, the intrepid trio talks shop. How well can bodybuilders and powerlifters run, jump, climb, fight, throw, and do other physical tasks? Get insights! Also, the Fall Funds Drive is starting as well as a new contest! Lastly, huge thanks go out to strong regulars like these who helped bring you this episode - Joe, Thomas, Robert, Joel, and Marsh. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 543 IronRadio - Topic Getting Huge, Now vs Then
item.description: Do you train, eat, supplement, or recover differently from 10 years ago? After the guys cover news ranging from record breakers to testosterone to GMO foods, the discussion examines just that. In fact, acquisition of raw size is the focus. Also tune in for improved audio, new Iron Radio graphics, and an ongoing t-shirt ad from Phil. Plus, the Fall Funds Drive is starting as well as a new contest! Lastly, THANK YOU to strong regulars like these who already help bring you the show - Cory, Jacob, Christopher, Douglas, and Cale. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 542 IronRadio - Topic Fitness and Nutrition Mail and News
item.description: Listener questions and news seem to build up these days. The first half of this episode is dedicated to questions regarding general fitness versus muscle sports, and cycling caffeine and other stimulants. After the mid show break - and surprise celebrity ad - the guys cover news including the Mr. Olympia, more good press for red meat, mind-boosting nootropic drugs and supplements, and plenty more. Also check out our improved audio, new Iron Radio graphics, and a t-shirt ad from Phil! Lastly, thanks go out to new supporter, Nick as well as strong regulars like these who help bring you the show - Kara, Jon, Andrew, and Austin. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 541 IronRadio - Topic Podcaster Media Fest
item.description: In a patchwork episode, the guys share clips and experiences - on site - from the Spartan Media Fest in Lake Tahoe. What was it like to be a strength and size-oriented trio, pilgrimaging in the land of general fitness and obstacle course racers? Find out! Also tune in for the usual listener mail on topics like best practices in HRV monitoring, creatine cycling, and more. Finally, much gratitude goes out to people like these, whose strong support helps bring you IronRadio - Tyler, Neil, Steven, Alan, and of special note this time, David. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 540 IronRadio - Topic Muscle Athlete Citizenship
item.description: Are you a good muscle-sport citizen? Feeling a sense of identity and membership in a community, online or in-person, brings rewards - and requirements. Check in as the guys get philosophical, examining the concept of citizenship and what it entails. Also tune in for news on the plant-versus-meat controversy. Finally, much gratitude goes out to people like these, whose strong support helps bring you IronRadio - Marek, Ryan, David, and Prasan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 539 IronRadio - Topic News and Questions from the Gym
item.description: This week Dr. Lowery is down but not out with the flu, and Dr. Nelson is globe trotting, so a slightly briefer episode of news and questions gets provided separately by Lonnie and Phil. Topics include coffee research, insect protein, a new faster type of whey protein, weight gain basics, the best heart rate for cardio, and tons more. Lastly, much gratitude goes out to people like these, whose strong support helps bring you IronRadio - Michael, Eliazar, Cory, Jacob, and Douglas. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 538 IronRadio - Topic Muscle Nerds
item.description: With Phil away, Drs. Lowery and Nelson nerd-out. Indeed, after sharing science news defining which types of meat and fruit are most healthful, the guys cover the topic of muscle nerds. From who they are, to what motivates them, to how many exist, plenty gets discussed. Also, thank you to supporters like these whose strong support helped bring you this episode of Iron Radio - Chris, Matthew, Rory, Korey, and Frederick. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 537 IronRadio - Guest Jim McDonald Topic Social Media and Lifters
item.description: After Dr. L remotely offers some mail and science news, Coach Stevens and Dr. Nelson sit down with Jim McDonald to discuss the impact of social media on lifters. Have web sites, blogs, YouTube and other online developments affected you as a lifter? Get insights! Also, much gratitude goes out to supporters like these whose strong support helped bring you this episode of Iron Radio - Jon, Andrew, Tyler, Steven, and Jonathan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 536 IronRadio - Guest Nick Clayton Topic Virtual Events
item.description: Phil, Mike, and Lonnie - the latter by phone - chat with professional strength event coordinator Nick Clayton, of the National Strength and Conditioning Association and other notable groups. Discussion ranges from content to cost to equivalency of online versus in-person workshops and seminars. Also tune in for new science on melatonin and fat loss. Finally, thanks go out to supporters like these who helped bring you this episode of Iron Radio - Alan, Neil, Jill, Kurt, Marek, Ryan, and the Outdoor Alliance Company. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 535 IronRadio - Topic Alternatives to Heavy and When
item.description: Dr. L starts picking up the pieces of an audio meltdown while he and Phil share news, mail, and a discussion on the timing of less-than-heavy training. When is it okay to go lighter? How is it done without wasting time? Find out! Also, tune in for topics like taste changes in heavy-set people, protein and kidney health, and plenty more. Finally, thanks go out to supporters like these who faithfully back Iron Radio - Joel, Robert, Fred, Michael, Eliazar, Jacob, and Cory. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 534 IronRadio - Guest Chris Lockwood Topic Supplements and Consumers
item.description: Despite technical issues, Dr. Nelson and Coach Stevens check in with Dr. Chris Lockwood to learn about the dietary supplement industry and what consumers should know. Learn key terms and how the laws have evolved to make your own better decisions. Also, thanks go out to supporters like these who faithfully back Iron Radio - Frederick, Ruvim, Jonathan, Douglas, Christopher, Philip, Joseph, Michael, Cale, Wyatt, and Jarrett. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 533 IronRadio - Guest David Whitley Topic Minimalist Training
item.description: After some food industry news that further confuses the plant versus meat debate, Phil and Lonnie talk with strongman performer David Whitley. From definitions inherent to density training to its novel stimulus and other applications, Dave shares his recent passion - and a single dumbbell challenge. Lastly, thanks go out to supporters who helped make this episode possible - Austin, Steak-n-Hoagie Shop, Kara, Jon, and Andrew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 532 IronRadio - Topic Superfoods
item.description: With Phil at a meet, Drs. Lowery and Nelson discuss the concept of super foods. Specific nutrients and phytochemicals, functional benefits for bodybuilders and powerlifters, and food sources get attention. Also, of course, thanks go out to supporters who helped make this episode possible - Neil, Tyler, Steven, Alan, Jill and Kurt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 531 IronRadio - Guest Sara Campbell Topic Gut and Performance
item.description: Returning to a topic of growing popularity, the guys check in with exercise physiologist and gut microbiome researcher Dr. Sara Campbell. From types of gut microbes, to foods listeners should consider, to time frames and expectations, plenty gets covered from a lifter's perspective. Also, a huge thank you goes out to supporters who helped make this episode possible - Britney, Shannon, Thomas, Travis, Nathan, David, Michael, and Joe. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 530 IronRadio - Topic Summer Mail and News
item.description: Listener mail and news are again building up, this time with some controversy. Topics range from training on a low-calorie diet, to new dietary guidelines, the best artifical sweetener for weight loss, a new TV series on feats of strength, ketogenic diets, and tons more. Lastly, thank you to supporters who help make IronRadio possible - Eliazar, Jacob, Cory, Jonathan, Christopher, Douglas, Philip, and Ruvim. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 529 IronRadio - Topic What Are You Good At
item.description: What are you good at? Not so good at? And how do you know? Coach Stevens and Dr. Lowery prompt listeners to think about these things using themselves as examples. Categories of self-assessment range from physique to performance and more. Also tune in for listener mail on caffeine tolerance, and science news on optimal fish oil dose and sodium restriction. Lastly, a big thank you goes out to supporters Rory, Stephen, Korey, Matthew, Chris, and Zafer. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 528 IronRadio - Topic Summer Training Update
item.description: Coming off and intense period of professional travel, the guys look forward to some mid-summer downtime with changed-up training, eating and sleeping. The episode begins with Dr. L sharing some science and market news on potential CBD risks and meat-plant hybrid foods, then joins each co-host individually for commentary on how their summer lifting differs. Also of course, weekly gratitude is extended, this time to supporters Steven, Damon, Alan, Andrew, Neil, Tyler, and Michael. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 527 IronRadio - Topic Phil's Travels
item.description: After the weekly mail and news, Phil talks shop with Lonnie and Mike about Jim Wendler's visit for the competition he hosted and other summer travels. Also tune in for discussion on demonized dietary supplements, processed foods' relationship to food allergies, tart cherry extracts for joint and muscle pain, and more. Lastly, thanks go out to Jill, Kurt, Marek, the Outdoor Alliance Company, Ryan, and David. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 526 IronRadio - Topic ISSN Conference Recap
item.description: In a special episode, Drs. Lowery and Nelson share highlights - on site - from this year's International Society of Sports Nutrition conference in Las Vegas.

item.title: Episode 525 IronRadio - Guest Michelle Blakely Topic Fitness Business Money Matters
item.description: Ever wanted to make serious money as a trainer? Fitness business coach Michelle Blakely joins the guys for a conversation on how to do it right. Topics range from professionalism to client on-boarding to marketing, pricing, and more. Also tune in for talk on strength-vs-endurance gains and sex differences during ketogenic dieting. Finally, thank you to the following members for their strong support - Kara, Austin, Jon, Korey, Rory, Chris, and Matthew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 524 IronRadio - Guest Dal Gains Topic Mail, News, Firefighter Training
item.description: Powerlifter and firefighter Dal Gains returns to share insights on strength and size development for his profession. Also tune in for mail and news on trying a strongman competition, ketogenic diets, and the science of sleep. Lastly, gratitude goes out to the following members for their strong support - Jon, Andrew, Neil, Tyler, Steven, and Alan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 523 IronRadio - Topic Mail and News
item.description: With listener mail and news backing up, it's time to share. In fact, there's more in a pile than can even be handled! In any case, topics getting attention include a new Westside Barbell documentary, cold water immersion, use of weird localized light frequencies to stimulate mitochondria, a minor super power exhibited by habituated coffee consumers, processed foods, scary bodybuilding supplements, and hormonal effects of rye fiber that may benefit carb tolerance. Lastly, huge thanks go out to new supporter David as well as to the usual crew who keep the lights on, for example - Steven, Alan, Neil, Damon, Jill, Kurt, and the Outdoor Alliance Company. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 522 IronRadio - Topic Neurological Issues in Training
item.description: In an unusual patchwork episode, Dr. Lowery shares some mail and news, then talks a bit about weird neurological issues that lifters may confront. Dr. Nelson adds his commentary after the mid-show break. Across the episode, topics range from joint health, to over-feeding, to nutrients that affect the nervous system, to hands-on soft tissue work and visual issues. Gratitude is also extended to Travis, Britney, Nathan, Joel, Marsh, and Robert for their support of the show. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 521 IronRadio - Topic Accessory Lifts Revisited
item.description: This week the guys revisit assistance work meant to support the big three lifts in powerlifting. Movements, equipment, and weakpoints get attention. Also tune in for listener Q and A on distance coaching, the history of Iron Radio, and why you might prefer bitter versus sweet beverages. Lastly, supporters like the following are never forgotten - Jacob, Cory, Douglas, Cale, Tom, and Wyatt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 520 IronRadio - Topic Quick-fire Bodybuilding Questions
item.description: For the indisputable 10-year landmark episode, Lonnie and Phil keep it light with rapid-response, this-or-that opinions on various bodybuilding-specific topics. Also tune in for listener questions on pork as a protein source and how to keep track of periodized training programs. And supporters like the following are never forgotten - John, Steak and Hoagie Shop, Kara, Austin, Jon, and Andrew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 519 IronRadio - Guest Arthur Lynch Topic Strength-Fitness Podcasting
item.description: Powerlifter, grad student, podcaster, and Irishman, Arthur Lynch joins the discussion this week. Topics range from dietary supplement regulation to de-stressing in nature, to the state of podcasting in the powerlifting community. Many thanks go out to those who helped make this episode possible - Kurt, Jill, Marek, Ryan, Prasan, David, Joe, and the Outdoor Alliance Company. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 518 IronRadio - Topic Kitchen Skills and Hacks
item.description: After some mail and news, mostly on the controversial nature of cholesterol, the guys head into the kitchen to talk shop in a different sort of way. From farm-raised to fast-prep and from fresh to frozen, plenty gets discussed. Also gratitude goes out to those who helped make this episode possible. Guys like Prasan, David, Joe, Michael, and Thomas. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 517 IronRadio - Topic Gym Culture Definitions Part II
item.description: There's more gym talk this week. Mike, Lonnie and Phil continue to offer their perspectives on what is meant by common gym terms like lean, out of shape, old school, big eats, and more. Also tune in for news on mushroom nutrition, posing music, and physiologic flexibility. Lastly, thanks go out to new IronRadio supporter Jonathan, and to Cory, Eliazar, Jacob, Christopher, Philip, and Douglas. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 516 IronRadio - Topic Gym Culture Definitions
item.description: It's time for some gym talk. After offering some news on a new diet analysis tool, beta agonists, and a new fish oil-derived drug, the guys talk shop. From the guys' perspectives, what is meant by adjectives like strong, over-fat, and large mammal? Find out! Also, thanks go out to IronRadio supporters Zafer, John, Steak-n-Hoagie Shop, Austin, and Kara. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 515 IronRadio - Topic Behind the Scenes Event Prep
item.description: How does a strength sport or scientific event come to be? And what's its worth? Mike, Phil, and Lonnie discuss it after handling some mail and news. Topics range from costs to time frames to partnerships to the unglamorous parts that actually form the basis of such events. Also tune in for a discussion on weight training and osteoporosis as well as information on trends in grain-based foods. Lastly but importantly, gratitude goes out for the strong support of guys and gals who make Iron Radio possible - like Andrew, Tyler, Neil, Steven, Alan, Jill, and Kurt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 514 IronRadio - Guest Karin Layton Topic Women in Science and Powerlifting
item.description: IronRadio podcast listeners participate in a variety of ways. Some, especially nerdy, even submit research news. Karin Layton is one such long-time listener. Bringing a background in biology, engineering, and a passion for powerlifting, it was high time she verbally joined the discussion. Topics range from peer support, to the qualities of a good scientist and how they serve a lifter, to women granting themselves permission to get big and strong. Also, special appreciation goes out to Scott and to Damon, Neil, Jill, Kurt, and Ryan for their ongoing strong support of the show!

item.title: Episode 513 IronRadio - Topic Training and Nutrition Minimums
item.description: After sharing some listener mail and news, Lonnie and Phil discuss minimum necessary doses of various factors related to training - sets, reps, percentages, grams, milligrams, you name it. There's also a brief discussion on breakfast skipping, the value of scientific evidence, and Phil's upcoming event with Jim Wendler. Lastly, gratitude goes out to Joel, Marsh, Robert, Fred, Eliazar, and Michael, who helped make the episode possible. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 512 IronRadio - Topic Getting Quality Repetitions
item.description: What makes a quality rep or contraction? After tackling some mail and news, Dr. Lowery and Coach Stevens offer definitions, tips and tricks from both a bodybuilder's and a powerlifter's perspective. Also tune in for news on the Arnold Classic, curcumin as a nootropic agent, making your own Highland Games implements, and more. Finally, huge thanks go out to Iron Radio supporters who helped make the episode possible - Jeff, Tom, Cale, Michael, Wyatt, and Jarrett. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 511 IronRadio - Guests Hartsel and Gains Topic Arnold Fitness Weekend Pre-Event
item.description: After the usual mail and news, it's time to squeeze into the car with Phil, Dal, and Bryan, who are driving to the Arnold Fitness Weekend and Sports Festival. Car chat ranges from training weak points, to nutrition, to Arnold event predictions and tons more. Also tune in for topics like maximal daily calorie expenditure in humans and manipulating rep speed to max-out power production versus hypertrophy. Lastly, check out Jim Wendler's web site this weekend for a discount! Use WEEKENDNACHOS, in all caps.

item.title: Episode 510 IronRadio - Topic Advice from Enhanced Coaches
item.description: In a Web 2.0 era, social media has brought a new sense of celebrity to very large and unnaturally-strong coaching gurus. But does their eating or training advice apply to lifters who may not be in the same pharmaceutically-enhanced state? Join the discussion on how these coaches are perceived for good or ill, and how a consumer might judge which strength coach is right for him or her. Also tune in for listener-driven news on protein feeding patterns and a heroic powerlifter in Michigan. This episode is brought to you in part by contributions from Karin, Neil, Damon, Kurt, Jill, Prasan, and Marek. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 509 IronRadio - Guest Bryan Hartsel Topic Training Too Heavy
item.description: How heavy do you really need to train? Big Bryan Hartsel has some tips. Garnering white lights recently with squat and deadlift performances over 900 pounds in the same meet, he certainly knows a thing or two about the subject. Also tune in for a multi-part listener question that ranges from fat loss for big men, to coffee and green tea, to artificial sweeteners. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 508 IronRadio - Topic What have You Eaten this Week
item.description: What have you eaten or supplemented this week? And why? The intrepid trio get introspective and invite you to do the same. The discussion ranges from intermittent fasting to post-bulking diets to nootropics to joint support. Also tune in for mail and news on muscle memory, low-glycogen fat burning, and sleep debt while over-eating. Finally, props go out to those listeners who stepped forward to help bring this episode to everyone - Rory, Cale, Joseph, Tom, Michael, and Jeff. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 507 IronRadio - Topic Elephant in the Room
item.description: This week Coach Stevens and Dr. Lowery cover news and mail, then re-visit a loaded topic, pharmaceutical ergogenic aids in sports. Why do elite strength athletes rarely discuss their polypharmacy openly, even when asked? Does it only serve to reinforce stereotypes? What are the ethical dilemmas? Also, are open competitions a good idea or a bad one? Get answers. Other topics include new research on how coffee helps both the nervous system and muscle hypertrophy, realities of competing with an artificial hip, plus information on restless legs syndrome. Lastly, thanks guys for making this episode possible - Allan, Austin, Jon, Andrew, Neil, and Tyler. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 506 IronRadio - Topic News on Food, Fitness, and Pharma
item.description: With Phil at a power meet going for his big squat, and Mike on a plane, Lonnie runs solo, offering news of interest to the clever lifters who follow IronRadio. Topics covered with commentary include intermittent fasting, 2019 food trends, Dr. L's current coffee research and presentations, the dose of exercise necessary to induce body comp changes, a novel way to get cells to manufacture their own therapeutic proteins, and new tissue engineering for bad backs. Also, Iron Radio thanks the following folks for their strong support - Neil, Tyler, Alan, Damon, Jill, Kurt, Ryan, and the Outdoor Alliance Company. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 505 IronRadio - Topic Weekly Habits of Fitness Business Owners
item.description: Coach Stevens and Dr. Nelson both run successful fitness businesses. Yet they differ. Tune in to hear what weekly practices each undertakes to not only keep the lights on, but to put clients first and keep everyone growing in every sense. Also tune in for discussion on real-versus-perceived food allergies, heavy squats on a hip replacement, and an update on Dr. Lowery's coffee tasting project. Finally, hearty thanks go out to supporters Michael, Joe, Britney, Nathan, Joel, and Robert. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 504 IronRadio - Guest Jose Antonio Topic Recent Research, ISSN
item.description: This week Dr. Jose Antonio, founder of the International Society of Sports Nutrition, returns to talk recent research and June's ISSN meeting in Las Vegas. Topics range from genes that make you a successful or poor dieter, to a newly-discovered benefit from eating eggs, to animal versus human studies, to the importance of actually collecting data, to what makes a scientific meeting fun. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 503 IronRadio - Guest Mike Ormsbee Topic Nutritional Chronobiology
item.description: What's the latest research on the timing of meals? From bedtime snacks, to gut rest, to the recommended number of meals each day and night, Dr. Mike Ormsbee shares his knowledge. The focus stays on fat loss and muscle gain. Also tune in for news and discussion on menu calorie counts, the myco-supplement cordyceps sinensis, and more. Finally, particular gratitude goes out to Kara for supporting our community in the holiday funds drive, as well as to Zafer, John, Pete, Austin and Kurt. Happy New Year!

item.title: Episode 502 IronRadio - Topic Did 2018 Predictions Come True
item.description: About 50 episodes ago, the IronRadio crew made some predictions on what the fitness and health science worlds would see in 2018. Did those prognostications pan out? Find out! Also tune in for listener topics like knee wraps, deadlifts, leucine and tons more. Lastly, special thanks go out to Tyler for his strong support in the holiday funds drive, as well as to Neil, Steven, Thomas, Damon, and Kurt. Happy New Year!

item.title: Episode 501 IronRadio - Topic Yuletide Mail and News
item.description: With holiday downtime upon us all, Lonnie and Mike take a relaxed approach to listener mail and news. Topics discussed include powerlifting seminars and competing at Strength Guild, foot placement in the sumo deadlift, acquiring a taste for healthy foods, exercise before bed, and plenty more. Gratitude goes out this week to supporters like David, John, Kurt, Jill, and Ryan. Merry Christmas and thank you!

item.title: Episode 500 IronRadio - Episode 500 Time Travel Retrospective
item.description: In a special episode this week, the guys set aside the usual format to travel back in time. Each host brings up some of their favorite topics, guests, and laughs - often with a flashback audio clip to emphasize it! THANK YOU EVERYONE for a decade of exploring some of the best - and worst - aspects of bodybuilding, powerlifting, and other strength and muscle sports!

item.title: Episode 499 IronRadio - Guest Kyle Dobbs Topic Warm-ups for the Big Lifts
item.description: This week the guys speak with Kyle Dobbs about more advanced issues surrounding warm-ups for the big three movements in powerlifting. From movement capacity to specificity to how-to suggestions, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for mail and science talk on dietary supplements ranging from leucine to purportedly special amino acid patterns in proteins, to swallowing ATP capsules straight - can you even do that? Finally, Iron Brothers like the following get special notice from the crew this time of year - Jason, Jim, Chuck, Paul, Wyatt, and Jarrett... hopefully you know your support of the community is really working! And remember, iTunes reviews also strongly support the cause!

item.title: Episode 498 IronRadio - Topic Add 20lb to Your Deadlift in a Day
item.description: After everyone covers the usual news, Coach Stevens offers a tutorial on potentially adding twenty pounds to your deadlift in a single day. From body type assessment to setup to lever arms and more, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for breaking science news on coffee and protein, with commentary on how the studies relate to lifters. Finally, special thanks go out to Shannon as well as ongoing supporters Jon, Andrew, Neil, Steven, and Thomas... you are all appreciated!

item.title: Episode 497 IronRadio - Topic Holiday News and Mail
item.description: On this Thanksgiving weekend, news and listener mail are once again accumulating, so the intrepid trio talk shop about them. Topics include low carb diets as re-feeds, purple corn extracts to help carb metabolism, drug testing, powerlifting federation lawsuits, sleep and dehydration, and new medical uses for an old bodybuilding-related drug, tamoxifen. This week verbal gratitude also goes out to Jess, Michael, Marek, Jason, Jim, and Charles for their holiday funds drive contributions... Thank you!

item.title: Episode 496 IronRadio - Guest Mike Israetel Topic Programming for Hypertrophy
item.description: This week Dr. Mike Israetel, former professor and now businessman, shares insights on exercise and nutrition programs for muscle growth. From overload to specificity to accumulated fatigue, Dr. I offers practical tips. There's also tough but well-intended advice on patience for mid-career lifters who are overcoming health obstacles. Lastly, much gratitude goes out this Thanksgiving week to supporters Michael, Marek, Marsh, Robert, Fred, and Jess... You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 495 IronRadio - Guest Sean Casey Topic Supplement Company Startups
item.description: Ever wonder about starting your own dietary supplement company? You might be surprised how far gone are the old days of bottling up pills on a kitchen table! Drs. Lowery and Nelson get regulatory updates, business tips, label claim education, and product examples from a guy who's done it - sports nutritionist Sean Casey. Also, of course, huge thanks go out to those among the Iron Brotherhood who help bring this episode to you - Ruvim, Christopher, Philip, Douglas, Cale, and Tom. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 494 IronRadio - Topic Mail and News Catch-up
item.description: With listener mail and news building up, the guys hit the release valve and dive into it. Topics range from the oral microbiome and coffee, to training under sleep debt, to the debate over skipping breakfast. Also included are discussions on devices that continuously monitor health and training, and how much exercise is too much. Plus, a sincere offer of gratitude goes out to Alan, Lonnie, Austin, Jon, Andrew, David, and Neil, whose support brings this week's episode to your eardrums. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 493 IronRadio - Guest Rick Alexander Topic Comfort vs Happiness
item.description: Is comfort the point of modern life or has it quietly robbed us of something? And what does it have to do with lifters? Tune in as the guys discuss these questions with retired military professional Rick Alexander. Topics range from the freedom to specialize, to training principles like overload and specificity, to getting out of your comfort zone. Finally, with the Fall and Holiday funds drive approaching, extra thanks go out to existing supporters of the show like Neil, Steven, Thomas, Alan, Damon, Jill, and Kurt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 492 IronRadio - Guest Jerry Brainum Topic Champion Bodybuilders
item.description: This week long-time bodybuilding magazine writer and editor Jerry Brainum has a frank discussion with Dr. Lowery on behind-the-scenes issues surrounding competitive bodybuilders. Topics include training myths, famous bodybuilders throughout history, his own background training around Arnold Schwarzenegger and other legends at Venice Beach, anabolic steroids and other drugs, natural bodybuilders, and the public's perception of bodybuilding over the decades. Lastly, much gratitude goes out to IronRadio listeners whose strong support keeps the community going strong - Bradley, Britney, Marsh, Joel, Robert and Fred. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 491 IronRadio - Topic Three Things Learned
item.description: With everyone on the road, Lonnie and Phil fight through technical glitches to bring you this episode. It includes commentary on three things the guys have learned, or been reminded of, in recent weeks. Topics include constant eating versus three-square-meals, an inventor's attitude, caution selling your fitness ideas, walking away from the gym when necessary, training percentages, and set failure. Apologies for the rough audio but the show must go on!

item.title: Episode 490 IronRadio - Guest Jeff Depatie Topic Training for the Unknown
item.description: Are you ready for anything that competition and life throw at you? After covering science news on vitamin D, insect protein, and using negatives to increase explosive power, the guys get tips from former special forces professional Jeff Depatie. Also, please prepare for the annual Fall and holiday season funds drive. Already your Iron Brothers like Matthew, Rory, Stephen and Chris keep the community going strong! Join the cause!

item.title: Episode 489 IronRadio - Topic How to Fail a Gym Startup
item.description: After the weekly mail and news, the guys offer tongue-in-cheek tips on how to maximize your chances of botching a gym or online fitness coaching business. From spending big out-of-the-gate on facility and equipment to fast-tracking to pose as the expert in all things, plenty gets discussed amid the suppressed laughter. The news covers caffeine, cannabis, and camu camu fruit. Lastly, please prepare for the annual Fall and holiday season funds drive. Your support keeps this listener-supported community going strong!

item.title: Episode 488 IronRadio - Guest Michelle Boland Topic Better Movement
item.description: Drs. Nelson and Lowery cover mail and science news, then get tips on how to move better from Dr. Michelle Boland. Do you have a weak link that you've been ignoring? Unsure about how to address a nagging injury? And could simple rehab-type exercises make your lifts feel great? Find out! Also tune in for topics such as boosting your overhead press and how women recover differently than men. Lastly, hearty thanks go out to Jill, Kurt, Marek, Ryan, Jerad, and David, all whom helped make this episode possible with their strong support. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 487 IronRadio - Guest Andy Galpin Topic Muscle Fiber Types
item.description: This week Dr. Nelson joins the guys from the road, interviewing Dr. Andy Galpin about muscle fiber types. Which compose most of YOUR muscle mass? How much do genetics matter? And should they affect how you train? Also tune in for a listener question on deadlift- versus squat-dominant competitors. Finally, hefty thanks go out to Sandra, Fred, Eliazar, Jacob, Cory, Christopher, and Douglas, all whom helped make this episode possible with their strong support. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 486 IronRadio - Guest Chris Shugart Topic Fitness Media
item.description: Which podcasts, videos and articles do you consume? How did you choose? This week writer, editor, and T-Nation Chief Content Officer Chris Shugart joins the guys to discuss it. Pros and cons of each media type get discussed from both a consumer and a producer perspective. Chris even discusses his podcasting plans with co-host and wife Dani. Also tune in for science news on how much coffee and tea drive your overall physical activity and what breakfast may mean to your leanness efforts. Finally, appreciation goes out to Wyatt, Jarrett, Jeff, Jon, Rory, Stephen and Chris, all whom helped make this episode possible with their strong support. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 485 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail and News
item.description: With listener mail and news coming fast, the guys simply keep up to date on this holiday weekend in the 'States. Mail involves a question on outside-the-gym eccentric microtrauma and DOMS as well as a serious question about treating a bad back. News covers Coach Stevens' travel to a big meet, then addresses a bevy of apparent negativity. Everything from coconut oil to ibuprofen to the occasional beer is under fire. Lastly, huge thanks go out to Jon, Andrew, Neil, and Thomas, who all keep the show rocking along with the other Iron Sisters and Brothers. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 484 IronRadio - Topic News, Podcasting Tips
item.description: Phil is back from organizing a large event, so the guys follow up on a listener question about behind-the-scenes podcasting. First, though, the guys discuss science news on the potential of Viagra and other vasodilators for muscle growth and how genetically-modified foods are being regulated. And of course we'll never forget our strong supporters in the Iron Brother- and Sisterhood, Thomas, Steven, Alan, Vicki, Marnie, Neil, Damon, Jill, and Kurt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 483 IronRadio - Guest MC Powers Topic Endurance-Strength Sport Transitions
item.description: This week, with Phil away running an event, Drs. Lowery and Nelson ask former collegiate- runner-turned-strength-coach MC Powers to sit in the Third Chair. After covering mail and science news, the trio explore what it was like - particularly as a woman - for MC to transition back and forth between extreme ends of the fitness spectrum. From injuries to social issues to maintaining an aerobic base, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for topics like protein dosing, abdominal fat, and smart toilet paper! Finally, thanks to the following Iron Brothers and Sisters who keep the show strong - Nathan, Bradley, Britney, Robert, Marsh, Joel, and Tony and Nina. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 482 IronRadio - Topic Response to Injuries
item.description: Injuries are especially traumatic to athletes whose very identity is wrapped up in their ability to perform. This week, after handling listener mail and news, the guys discuss their responses to serious injuries. From initial alarm and anger, to medical treatment, to a resolve to start the long rehab process and even how they went about it, the co-hosts share insights. Also tune in for talk on how pre-workout carbs affect post-exercise fat burning, target date diets and a potential risk in your probiotic supplement. Lastly, huge thanks go out to coffee project volunteers and Iron Brothers who keep the show going - Cory, Jacob, Chris, Steven, Douglas, Ruvim, Cale, and Philip. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 481 IronRadio - Topic Self-Monitoring Tips
item.description: How do you know you're getting stronger? Or sleeping well? Or eating properly? After addressing a backlog of listener mail, the guys discuss self-monitoring techniques. A battle-scarred Dr. L covers informal nutrition screening, Dr. Nelson looks at mobility assessments, and Phil tackles strength development and conditioning. Of course, everyone gets in on each subtopic. There's also discussion on intermittent fasting and the Carnivore Diet, among other weekly banter. Lastly, as a public radio-style podcast, this show is brought to you in part by a significant recent donation from Chris, as well as monthly support from Austin, Jon, David, and Andrew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 480 IronRadio - Topic Quick Fire Questions
item.description: With Phil away running a competition, Drs. Nelson and Lowery answer listener mail, then move on to lighter fare with quick fire questions. It's just 10 questions of banter, really, but with perhaps a few things you might learn. All things considered, topics this week include maintenance phases, overblown warm-ups, more on the fat-makes-you-fat news of last week, Dr. L's coffee tasting patent and project, and more. The quick fire questions range from favorite gym attire to ergonenic aids to recovery mistakes to recent training music. And that just scratches the surface. Lastly, huge gratitude goes out to new supporting member Steven as well as Damon, Neil, Thomas, Vicki, and Alan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 479 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail and News
item.description: After a brief crowd-sourcing announcement from Dr. L, the guys tackle a wide variety of listener mail and news topics such as collagen supplements, muscle protein synthesis timelines, unstable overhead exercises, effects of a high body mass index, muscle soreness, compression garments for recovery, and the cognitive effects of simply smelling coffee. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 478 IronRadio - Topic How and Why of Mass Gain Training
item.description: In the second of a two-part series on the how and why of mass gain, the guys turn their attention to training. From weekly volume to types of contractions, to movement choices and even motivation, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for news on the benefit of saturated fat in dairy foods, green tea, topical baking soda, a book recommendation, and a couple of new scientific papers Drs. Lowery and Nelson are publishing with colleagues. Finally, hearty thanks go out to Ben and Matt for science leads, and Eli, Jacob, Cory, and Douglas for their strong support of the podcast! You are all appreciated!

item.title: Episode 477 IronRadio - Topic How and Why of Mass Gain Eating and Recovery
item.description: With Phil on the road, Drs. Nelson and Lowery geek out in response to an iTunes request to revisit the how and why of gaining muscle mass from a nutrition and recovery perspective. By the end of the episode, Phil contributes as well. What results is an updated Iron Radio treatise on all the best ways to go about becoming a bigger man or woman - including many of the mechanisms, expectations, and behavioral tips behind making it work. Also, much gratitude goes out to Jon, Rory, Matthew, Stephen, and Arturo for their strong support of the Iron Brotherhood. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 476 IronRadio - Topic Adding 20 lb to Your Bench in a Day
item.description: Internet marketers and magazines boast of amazing, fast gains, but is there any truth to it? After science news on various mental aspects of training, the guys take a look at adding 20 pounds to your bench press in a single day. Is it possible? What techniques could get you there? And how might you set the stage for a new personal record? Come on in and find out!

item.title: Episode 475 IronRadio - Topic Navigating Strength-Fitness Social Media
item.description: Which social media communities do you browse for your fitness fix? Do you habitually stick to just one? After covering the weekly mail and news, the guys discuss several online outlets. Everything from credibility to trolls to paid forums gets attention. Also tune in for what to look for in a fish oil product, a new use for My Fitness Pal data, a recent testosterone controversy and plenty more. Lastly, much gratitude goes out to these strong supporters of IronRadio - Neil, Damon, Marnie, Jill, and Kurt. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 474 IronRadio - Guest Jim Wendler Topic Fatherhood
item.description: Upon his return from Ireland, Dr. L offers nutrition news, then after the break Phil shares his recent phone call with Jim Wendler. Nutrition topics include a mini-review of Irish foods and how similar they can be with dietary choices made by lifters. The Topic of the Day concerns fatherhood, giving back, teaching and coaching, and tangential issues as they relate to lifters. There's a clip from Wendler that survived the tech glitch during Phil's call and the guys discuss the entirty of the conversation. Pull up a bench and get in on this extra-long episode!

item.title: Episode 473 IronRadio - Guest Adam Glass Topic Perspectives on Intensity
item.description: In an extra long episode, Dr. Nelson interviews former combat veteran, grip competitor, and strongman Adam T. Glass. The Topic of the Day is intensity and there are many questions answered - what it is, how it is misunderstood, how it changes training frequency, what its implications are for body composition, and how it affects client compliance. Also tune in for discussion on journaling, safety, diet plans, coachability, specificity, and tons more. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 472 IronRadio - Topic Entrepreneurship in Fitness-Nutrition
item.description: This week Lonnie and Phil answer a question on protein quality, then move on to listener reviews before discussing the Topic of the Day. If you've ever wondered about how to start a new company, product, event, or even innovate toward social change, this discussion is for you. Toics include funding, boot-strapping, team building, crowd-sourcing, and plenty more. There's even an opportunity to lend YOUR expertise to an entrepreneurial project Dr. Lowery has in the works! And as always, much gratitude goes out for the strong support the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood provides. Peter, Austin, Jon, Alan, and Neil - you are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 471 IronRadio - Topic Lessons from Our Heroes
item.description: Once some listener mail is covered, Lonnie, Phil and Mike talk about their muscle sport heroes. Each co-host shares qualities they value or try to emulate, from innovation, to discipline, to mindfulness and more. Who do the guys emulate and how do their perceptions stack up to your own heroic lessons? Tune in and find out! Lastly, much gratitude goes out on this holiday weekend to those who share their strong support of the Iron Brother- and Sisterhood - Alan, Vicki, Thomas, Damon, Neil, and Marnie. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 470 IronRadio - Guest John Kilbourne Topic Late-stage Physique Prep
item.description: After responding to a number of listener mailings, Lonnie and Phil chat with first-time physique competitor John Kilbourne, just one week before his show. It's fun to talk to athletes this late in their 16-20-week contest preparation, so ripped and so close to go-time. The guys discuss dietary progression, training philosophy, and what's going through a competitor's mind when peaked like this. Lastly, great thanks to IronRadio sisters and brothers Britney, Bradley, Joe, Michael, and Nathan for their strong support of the show!
