item.title: Episode 469 IronRadio - Topic Phil's Meet, Dr. Nelson Travelogue
item.description: In a longer pre-recorded time warp episode, the guys share recent experiences, on the platform and on the road. Topics range from Phil's competitions with his synthetic hip, to trends in powerlifting, to uses for casein as a slow protein, to Mike's best lessons from his 2018 conference circuit. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 468 IronRadio - Topic Food Trends for Lifters
item.description: Food trends come and go, and athletes both influence them and are affected by them. Tune in as Drs. Lowery and Nelson discuss the demand for quick but healthy foods, top nutrients muscle athletes are adding to their diets, which food products are enjoying increased sales, and how bioactive ingredients are getting attention. Finally, much gratitude goes out to Zafer, Allan, ASF, Steven, and John for the various ways they support the show. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 467 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Michael Ruscio Topic Do-it-Yourself Gut Health
item.description: Do you have digestive problems or seemingly unrelated symptoms that affect your fitness lifestyle? Drs. Nelson and Lowery check in again with functional medicine physician Michael Ruscio about practical ways you might address a possible cause. Topics include evidence-based medicine, FODMAP diets, gluten, dairy, probiotics and more - all with lifters in mind. Dr. Ruscio also previews his eight step protocol toward relief. Plus, tune in for news on protein intake and muscle gain, and of course the usual chat. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 466 IronRadio - Guests Kirk Karwoski, Marty Gallagher Topic Powerlifting Then and Now
item.description: This week Phil and Lonnie interview powerlifting legends Captain Kirk Karwoski and Marty Gallagher. Tune in for origin stories, competitive memories, thoughts on gear, musings on whether or not performances are actually better nowadays, the loss of the renaissance lifter, and tons more. This episode is one for the record books - pun intended!

item.title: Episode 465 IronRadio - Topic Direct Arm Work
item.description: Do you do direct arm work? How much and why? As part of a long morning of recording, the guys discuss the benefits, best movements, and timing of working biceps, triceps and forearms. A variety of strength sports get attention. Also tune in for news on the stress hormone cortisol, energy drinks and mental health, legitimate online education for sports nutrition enthusiasts, and plenty more. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 464 IronRadio - Topic Mail and News
item.description: It's time to catch up on listener mail and news before heading into a few weeks of upcoming guests. Join in for a wide range of topics this week, from training periodization, to proper use of coffee for fat loss, to a new study on higher protein diets and testosterone injections for older guys. The intrepid trio also discuss how stepping away from Facebook might lower the stress hormone, cortisol. Plus, of course, there's the usual gym talk and banter. Lastly, a big thank you goes out to the strong support of these Iron Brothers - Austin, Rory, Matthew, Stephen, Zafer, and ASF. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 463 IronRadio - Topic Whole Body Workouts Revisited
item.description: After the weekly news and listener mail, Lonnie, Phil and Mike discuss the pros and cons of whole-body workouts, with special attention to what they've been doing themselves lately. Subtopics include powerlifting versus bodybuilding approaches, exercise movement choices, infrequent training - as low as one day per week - and tons more. Also in this episode, there's an IronRadio contest winner, coffee talk, yet another certification for Dr. Nelson, and other gym talk. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 462 IronRadio - Topic Micronutrition
item.description: Listener mail leads to the topic of micronutrients. From vitamins and minerals to phytochemicals and zoochemicals, what exactly are they and what can they do for lifters? Topics range from soft tissue repair to testosterone and strength enhancement to muscle relaxant properties to elevated metabolism and neural benefits. Note that the co-hosts take a select-topics approach to this very broad topic. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 461 IronRadio - Topic Gym Talk, News, Q and A
item.description: This week Phil and Lonnie catch up on some shop talk, listener mail, and news. The gym talk relates to squatting and deadlifting at different career stages, among other things. The mail concerns physique dieting limits and some Facebook Listeners' Page commentary on recent studies. The Facebook material drifts back and forth with news ranging from how researchers are zeroing-in on which gut bacteria help with carbohydrate metabolism, as well as food psychology, post-workout carbs, and much more. Lastly, thanks to newest Iron Brother, Marsh, as well as Fred, Robert, Joel, and Eli - your strong support is appreciated!

item.title: Episode 460 IronRadio - Topic Strength and Fitness Industry Report (Arnold)
item.description: After mail and news, and with Phil back from the Arnold Fitness Weekend, the guys talk shop about the broadening strength industry as a whole. Is bodybuilding still at center stage in Columbus? If not, is the growing number of additional events good for strength and muscle sports? How do huge events like this trickle down to local gyms? And what happened this year with that enormous expo? Pull up a bench and find out!

item.title: Episode 459 IronRadio - Topic Getting Unstuck (Progress Plateaus)
item.description: Phil is away at the Arnold Fitness Weekend, so Drs. Nelson and Lowery share mail and news, then discuss practical tips for breaking out of training ruts. The mail asks about bodybuilders backstage. The news covers a new way to look at the upcoming 2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans. Will they address athletes? News also touches on vegetarians and lab-grown meat. After the mid-show break, the good doctors take an over-under approach to getting out of progress plateaus. That is, many lifters get stuck due to over- or under-doing something. Tips range from creative monitoring, proper journaling, subtle overtraining symptoms, massive eating, the right number of reps, and more. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 458 IronRadio - Guest Dan Tennison Topic Highland Games
item.description: After some contest information and other community housekeeping, Phil and Lonnie check in with Highlander Dan Tennison. Plenty gets covered, from what it's like to be a Highland Games professional athlete to how Dan changes his training from off-season to in-season. There's even some fun discussion on the cameraderie that makes Highland Games so fun to watch! Lastly, thanks to the following Iron Brothers and Sisters whose strong support keeps the lights on - Colin, Alan, Vicki, Neil, Damon and Marnie, you are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 457 IronRadio - Guest Ryan Munsey Topic Mental Side of Training
item.description: This week the guys interview author and former physique model Ryan Munsey to get at the emotional and cognitive sides of training and recovery. From self doubt to heart rate variability to behavior change, plenty gets discussed. Ryan also offers practical tips for mental resiliency. Also tune in for new research on how curcumin might help lifters despite its poor absorption, behind-the-scenes coffee reasearch and more. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 456 IronRadio - Topic Making Stubborn Arms Grow
item.description: With other co-hosts away, Dr. L plays anchorman, sharing news and mail, and later, tips in the Topic of the Day. First, though, Coach Stevens checks in with a pre-recording from the road, on moving efficiently and building the ten-year athlete. News topics include a new study on curcumin for mental performance, the vitamin D-testosterone controversy, and steroidal substances in the grain, quinoa. The day's topic includes bodybuilding suggestions on exercise choices for big guns, rep cadence, volume requirements, and even sometimes-forgotten arm anatomy. Finally, hearty thanks to IronRadio brothers who keep the lights on - Nathan, Douglas, Ruvim, Philip, Christopher, Joe and Tom. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 455 IronRadio - Topic Eye-Rolling Fitness Journalism
item.description: After listener mail and news - with some remote commentary from Coach Stevens - the guys discuss fitness and nutrition journalism across the years. The opening segment has the guys discussing the explosion of podcasting, twice-weekly training programs, upcoming events, coffee, bogus invitations to supposedly collaborate, and misleading headlines. Indeed, some of what's been happening leads to the Topic of the Day. From fake consumer advocacy to excessive ghost writing to article headlines and lead-ins that appear less than genuine, plenty gets discussed. Although the podcast's no-hate policy is maintained, sometimes you've got to call out attention-grabbing and straight BS. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 454 IronRadio - Topic Mail and News Potpourri
item.description: Growth of the podcast once again has the guys covering listener mail and muscle-nutrition news. The range of topics is broad, including quad development, fat loss supplements for middle-aged women, myconutrients, coffee and muscle soreness, the case against juice, sauna and infrared for muscle blood flow, and the advantage that redheads have regarding vitamin D. Finally, sincere thanks to listeners who lend their strength to IronRadio via donations and more - Thomas, Honeyfund, Vicki, Colin, and Alan. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 453 IronRadio - Guests Scanlon and Ruffner Topic Science of the Cycle
item.description: A crazy weekend leads to a slightly altered format this week. After Drs. Nelson and Lowery tackle news, Dr. Kelsey Scanlon and grad student Kayla Ruffner discuss the menstrual cycle and performance. Plenty of questions get answered. How prevalent are women in sport at various levels? What do monthly hormone changes do to power output and reflexes? Do women on birth control manipulate such changes? And what does science say about mood changes across the month in women? Get answers! Also tune in for discussion on fat loss, inflammation, mushrooms and health, and the gut microbiome. Finally, sincere thanks to supporters Holly, Prasan, David, and Joe. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 452 IronRadio - Topic Plans and Predictions
item.description: As the new year gets underway, so do the IronRadio guys - with 2018 plans and predictions! First, however, in the news segment, topics like cheaper, safer regional drug delivery, the most anabolic way to consume eggs, and an increase in injuries from intense ballistic training get attention. After the mid-show break, everyone discusses trends and prognostications in food, science, medicine, and fitness. Even personal competitive and research plans for the coming year are shared. Get in on this!

item.title: Episode 451 IronRadio - Topic Listener Q and A
item.description: IronRadio is experiencing growth - no pun intended! With a backlog of listener mail this week, the guys answer questions and discuss comments. Several topics get attention in this slightly longer episode. Is vitamin D all it's cracked up to be, and do injections help or hurt? Are health coaching certificates worth anything as a career path? What's the deal with TRT for female lifters? Get answers on these issues and tons more! Lastly, much gratitude goes out to long time Iron Radio friend Korey, as well as Matthew, Stephen, Rory, Zafer, and and ASF for supporting the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood so strongly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 450 IronRadio - Topic T-replacement for Lifters
item.description: Happy New Year! And wow, 450 episodes logged! Rounding out 2017, the guys cover listener mail and news before getting to the topic of testosterone replacement therapy for lifters. The mail involves hip replacement expectations and the news delves into muscle metabolism during high-rep sets, as well as what Harvard is saying about scientific evidence in the media. After the mid-show break, the guys offer facts, opinions, and personal observations about hormone replacement therapy in men who need it. From signs and symptoms to expectations, plenty gets discussed! Lastly, sincere Holiday gratitude goes out to Marek, Alan, Robert, Neil, Jennifer, and Andrew for supporting the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood so strongly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 449 IronRadio - Topic The Holiday-sode 2017
item.description: It's an unusual weekend with Christmas immediately upon us, so this show differs a bit. Dr. L starts off with an email question followed by recipe tips for both bulking and leaning-down this time of year. After the mid-show break the guys engage in a silly roundtable discussion that's based on - wait for it - Festivus. From feasting to an airing of grievances, to feats of strength and miracles, the comical secular holiday gets connected to the fitness industry. Finally, much Holiday gratitude goes out to Marnie, Kurt, Jill, Ryan, and Holly for supporting the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood so strongly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 448 IronRadio - Topic The Post-Competition Period Revisited
item.description: With competitions in the rear view mirror, the intrepid trio cover the post-contest period from various perspectives. How long does one take off? To what extent? How does a smart lifter return to training? And how does seasonal weather come into play? Find out! Also tune in for career insights for strength coaches, cardiovascular risks that may befall the large mammal, and plenty more! Lastly, much Holiday gratitude goes out to Fred, Colin, Jacob, Cory, Phillip, and Christopher for supporting the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood so strongly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 447 IronRadio - Guest Danielle Cordaro Topic Producing Fitness Media II
item.description: The how-to series on producing your own fitness and nutrition media continues this week. Once Drs. Lowery and Nelson cover news on dietary supplement company buyouts and creatine, they return to Dr. Danielle Cordaro for insights into media production. With the quality bar set so low in these genres online, the good professor offers gold nuggets on how to bring your A-game. Also, huge appreciation goes out to Anthony, as well as Cale, Joseph, Tom, Michael, and Joe for supporting the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood so strongly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 446 IronRadio - Guest Ryan Soper Topic Paying Your Dues
item.description: After covering science news and industry happenings, the guys put in a call to powerlifter and fitness media producer Ryan Soper. Ryan not only shares his personal story, which involves his years in academia while making ends meet, but also insights into his proactive path toward working in his current role. If you've ever wondered about making a living in fitness, this episode will help! Lastly, thanks to IronRadio Fall funds drive donors and existing supporters Jason, Honeyfund, Jon, Neil, and Andrew. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 445 IronRadio - Guest Ben Clark Topic Launching Fitness Products
item.description: Ever have an idea for a product worth commercializing? This episode is for you. After mail and news on buffering muscle acidity during high-rep sets, the guys talk shop with entrepreneur Ben Clark. From concept sketch to applying for a patent, to evolving iterations in design, to marketing a final product, tons of topics get attention. Also, thanks to IronRadio Fall funds drive donors and existing supporters Alan, Vicki, Holly, Prasan, Ryan, and Marek. Your support doesn't go unnoticed!

item.title: Episode 444 IronRadio - Topic Powerlifting Meet Follow-up
item.description: After mail and news ranging from vitamins to vikings, the guys discuss the big meet in California, where Phil's crew at Strength Guild recently traveled to compete. Insights include dealing with famous judges, noting the prevalence of strong women in the sport, and competing after surgical repairs. Also tune in for upcoming food trends, news on FDA regulations, new types of protein products, mushrooms and health, and tons more. Lastly, thanks to IronRadio Fall funds drive donors and existing supporters Jennifer, Robert, Fred, and Cory. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 443 IronRadio - Topic Good Genetics
item.description: Bodybuilders and strength athletes often talk about good genes - but for what? Your blueprint underwrites a good portion of your success, but what do we mean when we say good genetics? Tune in as Drs. Lowery and Nelson discuss the various gene-driven structures and systems that help create champions. Also tune in for news on recent developments in ketone supplements, tart cherry usage for athletic recovery, and plenty more. Lastly, thanks to new IronRadio Fall funds drive supporters Steven, Sandy, Kurt and Stuart! Also thanks to existing supporters Christopher, Doug, Joe and Joseph. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 442 IronRadio - Topic Mail, News, Meet Talk
item.description: This week, after the mail and news, the guys all talk about Phil's upcoming powerlifting meet. They delve into his peaking philosophy, its evolution over the years, what goes through a veteran's mind, and how it differs from the thoughts of his novice clients. Also tune in for topics like dietary supplement regulations, soy and heart disease, blueberries and mental function, the skin's power to regulate blood flow itself, and tons more. Also, thanks to long-time Iron Brother David, as well as Sandy, Alan and Vicki - all whom help keep the lights on at IronRadio! You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 441 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Danielle Cordaro Topic Fitness Media- Writing
item.description: Have you ever considered producing your own writing or other media for strength enthusiasts? After the guys do listener mail and news, Dr. L interviews Danielle Cordaro, a writing professor, to get tips on breaking into fitness and nutrition writing. From story telling, to the role of editors, to resources to get you started, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for facts and talk on a tea that may help with inflammatory states, unusual red meats and tons more. Finally, thanks to new supporting members and donors Marek, Aaron, and Neil! Huge thanks also go out to Ryan, Jared, David, Prasan and Holly. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 440 IronRadio - Topic Dumbbell Use in Strength Sports
item.description: Coach Stevens and Drs. Nelson and Lowery tackle the listener mail and accompanying science, then move on to the Topic of the Day. Several questions get answered. What are the best three dumbbell movements? How do they get used differently in muscle sports? Do dumbbells often get used wrongly? And what's the least favorite dumbbell exercise among the co-hosts? Time to find out! Also, the Fall funds drive is underway. Thanks to new supporting members Nathan, Stuart, Eli and Matt! And we'll never forget existing Iron Brothers and Sisters like Prasan, Holly, Britney, and Bradley. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 439 IronRadio - Topic Coffee, Caffeine and Training Update
item.description: This week's special episode turns toward the health and culinary sides of sports nutrition. After some science news gets covered by Dr. Lowery, come onto the floor of a trade convention in New York City that's focused on coffee. From fancy brewing methods that capitalize on science, to newer trends like nitrogenated cold brew coffees, there's plenty to learn! Also tune in for research on how antioxidant foods like coffee and tea interact with gut bacteria, how coffee affects muscle mass, what Dr. Lowery's lab is finding related to adrenaline function, and more. Get in on this!

item.title: Episode 438 IronRadio - Topic Giving Back
item.description: Do lifters have unique abilities or traits that enable them to give back to the world in particularly strong ways? From physical characteristics to knowledge and skills, there are ways beyond money to support what matters most. After the mail and some talk on Achievements in Training, the guys discuss it. Also tune in for topics such as combined cardio and strength training, hormone replacement therapy for competitors, low-frequency training, and plenty more. Join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 437 IronRadio - Topic Mail and News for Lifters
item.description: The listener mail and news is backing up, so it's time to wade through all the cool stuff! Tune in for topics such as smelling salts, ketogenic diets, new devices for non-invasively measuring blood sugar continuously, Olympic lifting doping scandals, weird ways to manipulate caffeine effectiveness in the body, and tons more. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 436 IronRadio - Guest Dave Whitley Topic Strength and Recovery Techniques
item.description: This week the guys get performing strongman Dave Whitley back on the show to share insights on both feats of strength and unusual recovery techniques. From driving nails into boards with nothing but his hand, and blowing up hot water bottles to bursting, there are interesting stories. After the mid-show break, tune in for discussion on cold exposure and breathing methods that may surprise you. Also check-in for a spanking new study on how bodybuilding-style training is similar to Olympic-style training regarding recovery. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 435 IronRadio - Topic Bio-Psycho-Social Assessments for Lifters
item.description: Health screens and baseline performance assessments are common, but what about the full spectrum of strengths and weaknesses you possess? Join the guys as they take a biological, psychological, and social look at themselves and their students and clients. What makes a person geared toward powerlifting? What attributes draw someone to bodybuilding? And what pitfalls await a muscle athlete as he or she ponders a lifting career? Find out! Also tune in for listener commentary on evidence-based podcasts and news on a new role for creatine in physique development. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 434 IronRadio - Topic Turning the Mic on the Hosts, Moments and Advice
item.description: With every co-host traveling this week, this episode takes the form of a roundtable. Each co-host offers his worst moment, a-ha realization, best advice, personal habits, favorite Internet resource, and more. It's like an extended lightning round series of questions, and you'll hear input from everyone's unique perspective! As you listen, you may want to consider each of these questions for yourself! Join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 433 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Michael Ruscio Topic Gut Health for Lifters
item.description: After the mail and news, the guys chat with functional med physician Michael Ruscio. Topics include probiotics, unnecessary expensive testing, identifying the source of various signs and symptoms, risks particular to lifters, and tons more. If you deal with digestive tract issues, or just want to optimize health and gains, this episode is for you! Also tune in for talk on a new survey concerning who's responsible for your healthy diet and news on what the food industry plans to do with special carb molecules. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 432 IronRadio - Topic The Importance of Muscle Mass
item.description: Despite the chaos of travel, the guys manage to share breaking news and discuss the value of muscle tissue. The news ranges from fats and oils to cognition enhancers to the fat-but-fit controversy. The Topic of the Day expands on the news, with Drs. Lowery and Nelson discussing how muscle tissue is valuable metabolically and for general health. It's not just cosmetic! Pull up a bench and get in on the conversation!

item.title: Episode 431 IronRadio - Topic Protein Updates for Lifters
item.description: What's new in the use of protein foods for gains? This week the guys turn hyperbolic science journalism on protein into something worthwhile, using calm tactics and evidence. Subtopics like whey vs. casein, red meat, and scales of protein quality get attention. There's also news on coffee - both upcoming events and a special IronRadio-related project. Coach Stevens also gives insights into upcoming Strength Guild events. Lastly, fifty thanks to the iron brotherhood including Nathan, Matthew, Robert, and Fred. You keep the lights on here at IronRadio.org!

item.title: Episode 430 IronRadio - Topic Appetite Manipulation for Gain and Loss
item.description: The guys cover mail and news, then talk appetite control. A letter from Joe Schillero prompted discussion on mechanisms in the body for controlling metabolic rate and hunger. Subtopics include hormones and neuropeptides, purposeful blood sugar swings, overcoming your status quo, and plenty more. Other issues this week include affordable velocity-based training, cannibinoids in foods, and newly recognized risks for chronic ibuprofen users. Also, a huge thank you goes out to the iron brotherhood including Korey, Daniel, Cory, Jacob, Phillip, Christopher and Douglas. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 429 IronRadio - Guest Joe Schillero, Topic Lifters' Behavioral Health
item.description: What are some of the mental health issues that commonly confront lifters? Once the guys address a backlog of listener mail, they sit down with powerlifter and mental health proponent Joe Schillero to find out. Many questions get attention. Is a reliance on training as a way to self-treat negative emotions smart? What are some suggestions and cautions when it comes to logs and journals? And what has Joe seen in his work advocating for mental health among lifters? Pull up a bench and find out!

item.title: Episode 428 IronRadio - Guest Becky Chermok, Topic Female Powerlifting
item.description: After the usual mail and news, Phil, Lonnie and Jon talk shop with powerlifter Becky Chermok. The intro segment deals with regional powerlifting gyms, questionable food documentaries, and the purportedly addictive nature of cheese and casein peptides. During the Topic of the Day, Becky and the guys discuss the rarity of big lifts like hers, gender differences in attitude, weight classes, and female strength potential. Lastly, a big thanks goes out to supporting members Andrew, Neil, Alan, Jill, and Rob. You are hugely appreciated!

item.title: Episode 427 IronRadio - Guests DiStefano and Schafer, Topic The State of Fitness
item.description: In an extra-long episode, the guys get in a conference call with Sal Di Stefano and Adam Schafer from the popular MindPump podcast. First, though, Drs. Lowery and Nelson answer mail about intermittent fasting and post-competition re-feeds. There's also a bit of news on a Testosterone.com breakfast article to which Lonnie and Mike contributed. Then in the Topic of the Day, everyone's attention turns to the state of general fitness in the U.S. From guru ignorance to social media to science and conflict of interest, plenty gets attention. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 426 IronRadio - Topic Grey-Area Performance Enhancement
item.description: The mail this week is about deadlifts and health-versus-gains. Then Phil and Lonnie discuss controversial performance-enhancing drugs and supplements. Based in part on a New York Times article on doping, the discussion ranges from USADA behavior to coercion, to the meaning of natural and more. Several supplements and hormones get discussed. Lastly many thanks to Fred, Daniel, Jacob, and Douglas, all supporting members of the Iron Brotherhood. The show keeps airing because of you and your lifting brothers and sisters. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 425 IronRadio - Guest Dr. David Geier, Topic Injury Treatment and Career Longevity
item.description: After Drs. Lowery and Mike cover news and mail, Lonnie interviews orthopedic surgeon David Geier. Dr. Geier's practice and new book address the recognition and treatment of injuries - including those endured by lifters - and how they relate to one's training career. Specific topics this week run the gamut from deadlift frequency to getting the most out of your blueberries, to anabolic steroids and tendon rupture. Finally, a big thank you goes out to supporting members of the Iron Brotherhood, Wyatt, Jeff, Jon, and Rory. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 424 IronRadio - Guests Walker and Ruffner, Topic Food Tech Convention
item.description: Come onto the floor of a food technology convention to learn how food gets created and what it means for lifters and fitness enthusiasts. The Skype connection is rough at times this week, but for those hungry for info., it's served up as best as possible. Repeat guests Mike Walker and Kayla Ruffner join the conversation. Topics include food trends that will affect us all such as the growing popularity of plant protein, meat grown in vats, the disconnect between food and nutrition, clean labels and much more. Also tune in for news on doping, and new bodybuilding films and podcasts. Stay abreast!

item.title: Episode 423 IronRadio - Topic Recent Achievements in Training
item.description: What have you accomplished or learned this week? After the mail and news, Dr. L and Coach Stevens offer their own recent achievements and thoughts. The news covers coffee's potential effects on longevity, poop doping - yes really - and the lingering mind-body connection after traumatic events. How much do these things affect your health and your training? Find out! Also tune in for iTunes reviews and a friendly reminder to support podcasts and artists you love. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 422 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Questions
item.description: This week the guys cover nutrition and fitness industry news, then move on to listener questions from Facebook and around the Web. Topics include food labels, snacking and health, the effect of vegetarian diets on muscle tissue, topical joint creams, drug use in Crossfit, and how to increase vegetable intake. Questions range from anti-inflammatory nutrients to specificity of training for strength athletes.

item.title: Episode 421 IronRadio - Topic Changes in Training Philosophy
item.description: Over the years we all develop preferences that develop into a training philosophy. This week the guys discuss how theirs have changed - or not changed - across the decades. From heavy to high-rep, from self-application to client goals, and from variety to specificity, plenty gets attention. Also tune in for mail and news covering health issues like acid reflux, why different diets affect us differently, metabolic inflexibility, and tons more. Finally, the following Iron Brothers deserve thanks this week for supporting the show - Joe, Cale, Joseph, Jeff, Jarrett, and Wyatt; you are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 420 IronRadio - Topic Supplements that Work for Sleep
item.description: Which strategies or dietary supplements do you use to sleep as well as you train? There are many out there, so the guys discuss a broad spectrum. From amino acid derivatives to herbs, plenty of opinions and facts get discussed. Also tune in for mail and news on creatine, strongman standings, and the potential downsides of caffeine. Finally, thanks go out this week to supporting members William, Jason, Jon, and Andrew; you know who you are and you are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 419 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Steve Hertzler Topic Junk Science
item.description: The guys invited EAS Chief Science Officer, dietitian, and bodybuilder Dr. Steve Hertzler on the show! Not only is Steve head scientific honcho at one of the world's largest dietary supplement companies, his love of lifting makes him a perfect guest. Join in the conversation as the guys discuss everything from old school bodybuilding legends to over-extrapolated scientific findings. Also tune in for topics like vegetarian versus carnivorous diets, other podcasts, World's Strongest Man, genetically-tailored probiotics, BPA, and tons more. Lastly, let's share gratitude for supporting members like Ryan, David, Holly, Prasan, and other friends that are mentioned in the episode. All of you help keep the show coming out weekly.

item.title: Episode 418 IronRadio - Topic On-site at the Paleo FX Event
item.description: This week Dr. Lowery covers the listener mail and news, then checks in with the oft-traveling Dr. Nelson for insights on the Paleo FX meeting. During the mail and news segment, Dr. L discusses a new discovery in fat burning as well as an implantable device that may help lifters get a better night's sleep. The Topic of the Day addresses news and speculation emerging from the Paleo FX industry event, including muscle cell hyperplasia, sleep quality, useful apps and devices and much more. Finally, a big thank you goes out to supporting members Matthew, Britney, Joe, Michael, Bradley and Nathan, who all help make the show possible. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 417 IronRadio - Topic Foods and Supplements that Work, Anabolics
item.description: Which food strategies and dietary supplements actually have anabolic effects? Find out in the Topic of the Day. First, however, the guys share listener mail and news on everything from other podcasts to special fatty substances that drive metabolic rate, to metabolic flexibility. After the mid-show break, evidence-based nutrients for muscle growth get attention. With the myriad diets and supplements that get touted, find out what works! Finally, fifty thanks to the supporting listeners that keep the show coming out weekly! Christopher, Phillip, Daniel, and Cory - you and Iron Brothers like you are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 416 IronRadio - Guest Dal Gains Topic Gym Talk
item.description: This time Dr. Lowery is working through the weekend, so Phil records some gym talk with fellow powerlifter Dal Gains. First, however, Dr. L pre-recorded some listener mail and news. Topics include post-surgical nutrition, fasted aerobic activity for activating beneficial genes, and a metal recommendation from Fortress himself. After the break, Phil and Dal discuss a recent powerlifting meet and other gym stuff. Note that the post-break chat exhibits some rough audio. It was felt that the content is worthwhile for those who want to get the information, however.

item.title: Episode 415 IronRadio - Guest Jorn Trommelen Topic Protein Research
item.description: With Phil away at a meet, Drs. Nelson and Lowery geek-out with doctoral researcher Jorn Trommelen. His lab's protein research is debunking myths and shedding amazing new light on many protein topics. How much protein can you really absorb at a sitting? What's the best dose per meal? Can you make better gains by targeting protein feedings at night? Which types work best? And what do purportedly anabolic hormones actually do for muscle mass accretion? Find out!

item.title: Episode 414 IronRadio - Topic On-site at the Experimental Biology Conference
item.description: Join Drs. Lowery and Nelson from the floor of the huge Experimental Biology meeting in Chicago, Illinois, where they scour the research posters and the researchers themselves for new findings that could help your training. Knowledge is power!

item.title: Episode 413 IronRadio - Topic Extreme Diets
item.description: Early in the show, listener mail on training types leads to scientific discussion, then whey protein, big dollar powerlifting meets and fish oils get attention. After the mid-show break, the discussion turns toward the cyclical nature - across the decades - of extreme diets. Are you a low-carb proponent? An anti-fat zealot? Or perhaps you're part of the minority, with a more moderate outlook. Tune in for facts and tips that could affect your stance. Also, let's all remember IronRadio.org is made possible by Iron Brotherhood members Cory, Jacob, Daniel, Ruvim, Christopher and Douglas, along with other valued friends. You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 412 IronRadio - Topic Gained and Lost from Strength Sports
item.description: First, the science news is about ways to manipulate your gut bacteria for health and gains. Second, the sports news is about a new youth record in Olympic lifting. Third, product news touches on new types of buffalo meat snacks and the Slingshot bench-assistive device. Finally, after the mid-show break, join the guys in a conversation on what they've gained, and lost, through their involvement in muscle sports. What have YOU gained and lost? It's time for reflection. This show is supported in part by new Iron Brotherhood member Rory, and by longtime supporters Korey, Jennifer, Bo, ASF, Zafer, and other valuable friends. Thank you!

item.title: Episode 411 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Listener Questions
item.description: This week mail leads to science news and the science leads to further listener questions. Join Drs. Lowery and Mike, and Coach Stevens as they address topics such as overhead pressing, hydrolyzed casein, citrulline malate supplements, specialty carbohydrate products, and more. The guys even discuss recent personal achievements in training. After the mid-show break, the guys continue the discussion with talk of upcoming fitness expos, online sports nutrition courses, muscle fiber types, the angle of pennation of muscle fibers and how it relates to strength, and other stuff. Also, thank you Jon, Andrew, Neil and the rest of the supporting members! You are appreciated!

item.title: Episode 410 IronRadio - Topic Periodic Leanness
item.description: The guys cover a listener mail that leads to science news on probiotics. From irritable bowel, to hypertension, to body fatness, recent studies get attention. As always, the focus is on applications to lifters. After the mid-show break, the discussion involves periodic leanness. Is the way bodybuilders and powerlifters fluctuate in size dangerous? How often should you lean down? And what are some risks and benefits? Lastly, thanks to supporting members Jerad, James, Jill, Ryan, and definitely Shannon! You help the show continue weekly.

item.title: Episode 409 IronRadio - Guest Ryan Smith Topic Lifting Injuries, Scope of Practice
item.description: This week the listener mail is about youth resistance training and the science news covers morning versus evening people and their differing nutrient choices. Are you a late-starter? This may really interest you! After the mid-show break, Dr. Ryan Smith, chiropractor, writer and lifter, shares his thoughts on lifting injuries and how they get treated. Which health professional is the best first choice for different lifting injuries? And how do they interact with each other? Find out! Finally, special thanks this week to Jennifer as a long time supporter of the show, and Cory, Jacob, Cale, Christopher, Douglas, and other friends in the Iron Brotherhood and Sisterhood! Future shoutouts are coming. You don't go unnoticed!

item.title: Episode 408 IronRadio - Topic News, Reviews and Goals
item.description: It's an unusual week with the crew traveling, so Dr. Lowery and Coach Stevens divide-up the episode. In the first half of the show, Lonnie covers a special combination of news and reviews by sharing new research on the anti-inflammatory phytochemical curcumin and products on the market that may be better than the raw herb. He takes the opportunity to share behind-the-scenes information on how such things come to market and how they get reviewed. After the mid-show break, Phil shares news on his trip to Jim Wendler's place and the Arnold Fitness Weekend, then moves on to a presentation on goal setting and the kind of people who love it. Get in on this!

item.title: Episode 407 IronRadio - Guest Allison Moyer Topic Fat Loss Lessons
item.description: Many of you know the drill now. The guys cover listener mail and news, then get to the Topic of the Day. This time it involves fat loss tips from professional figure competitor and coach, Allison Moyer. The mail compares IronRadio to a typical fitness podcast, and the news delves into new guidelines to treat back pain, curcumin, and carbohydrate mouth rinses. The topic explores online coaching, working with the general population versus advanced clients, monitoring progress, Allison's personal approach to getting contest-ready and much more. Finally, thanks go out to Neil and the other supporting members; you are appreciated! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 406 IronRadio - Topic The Science of Low-Carb Diets
item.description: This week the guys address mail concerning Iron Radio's format, news on a new chronic pain medication, and upcoming muscle and strength events. After the mid-show break the topic turns to low-carb diets. Have you ever pondered different ways to train in a low-carb state? What do approaches like Atkins, Paleo, and various ketogenic diets do to your metabolism, physique and performance? Find out! Both in-the-trenches realities and science-based facts are the basis. Finally, if you're a long-time listener, please consider becoming a supporting member.

item.title: Episode 405 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Pat Davidson Topic Dopamine and Training
item.description: Join in the conversation as the guys share news and listener mail, then get educated on neurotransmitters and how training is impacted. The science news covers a brand new study from a group, led by Lonnie's old advisor, on the actual protein requirements of young bodybuilders. This is another nail in the coffin for RDA-level recommendations in our population. The mail then asks about setting up in the deadlift. Coach Stevens offers valuable insights. Finally, in the Topic of the Day, professor-turned-training entrepreneur Pat Davidson shares thoughts and facts on the reward neurotransmitter dopamine and what it means to strength athletes. From thrill seeking to stimulant addiction to how to program your training for maximum benefit, there's lots to learn. Come satisfy your weekly addiction!

item.title: Episode 404 IronRadio - Topic News and Listener Mail
item.description: With a backlog of news bits, emails, tweets, and Facebook listener group questions, the guys offer a smorgasbord of topics. In fact, some of these develop into fairly involved discussions. From the static stretching controversy, to garlic's mixed results as a dietary supplement, to dairy products for fat loss - yet another controversy - plenty gets answered. In fact, there's lots more herein. Take a side or simply listen to some evidence from the literature, and from the trenches. Most importantly, simply get in on these though-provoking issues!

item.title: Episode 403 IronRadio - Topic Priciest Lifting Experiences
item.description: This week Phil and Lonnie cover some news, then discuss costly gym experiences. The news is partly an evidence-based follow-up on listener questions regarding nutrition and immunity, and treating muscle soreness with digestive enzymes. Have you ever been frustrated by head colds that kept you from training? Get some facts! After the mid-show break, the guys talk about the most pricey gyms they've been in, and what makes a large expense worth it in our field. Pull up a bench and get in on the conversation!

item.title: Episode 402 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Bryan Mann Topic Velocity-based Training
item.description: How explosive are you? Can you program around it? After the usual listener mail and news, the guys get insights. The episode begins with follow-up answers to last week's whey protein question and some discussion on monitoring ketgenic diets. In fact, ketogenic diets get repeated attention this week. After the mid-show break, Dr. Mike T Nelson leads an interview on velocity-based training and other topics with academic, strength coach, and NSCA enthusiast Dr. Bryan Mann. If you're curious about ideas to steer and motivate your training program, there are some gems in this extra-long episode.

item.title: Episode 401 IronRadio - Topic Nervous System Tweaks
item.description: This week Drs. Lowery and Mike cover the usual news and mail, then talk about the nervous system. The science news is about a new large review on whether curcumin works. There's also a new study developing an objective urine test for detecting healthy diets. Will diet logs become a thing of the past? Then the listener mail asks about protein labeling and whether extra calisthenics help you grow. After the mid-show break, the profs cover nervous system tweaks for maxing-out performance. Specifically, potentiation and the stretch reflex get attention. There's even chat on turning explosiveness up to 11 by adding coffee to the mix! Want to be more explosive? These tips may help you!

item.title: Episode 400 IronRadio - Guests Branch Warren, Chris Bongiovanni Topic Fitness Expos
item.description: It's episode 400! To celebrate, the guys talk with professional bodybuilders and contest promoters Branch Warren and Chris Bongiovanni. After some insightful discussion on their origin stories and training philosophies, everyone turns to the Topic of the Day. How are physique sports evolving? Why are pros like these two getting involved in expanding bodybuilding events into full-blown fitness expos? Is it good for bodybuilding? What other events seem to fit? And why is the upper midwest a target for their next event? Find out! Come on in to hear from these fitness celebrities and to celebrate episode 400!

item.title: Episode 399 IronRadio - Guest Jason Cholewa Topic New Research on Women
item.description: This week the guys discuss new research on heavy lifting for women. First, though, there are some recent iTunes reviews to cover and some sport and science news. Notably, Russians are again implicated in a doping situation and a newly-identified type of casein from a specific type of cow may offer surprising health benefits. Then, after the break it's time for the nitty gritty. What's the deal with terms like toning, especially for women? How do hormones enter the picture when it comes to muscle gain? And what does new research say about heavier loads for women's body composition? Find out! It's a new year, so pull up a bench and participate!

item.title: Episode 398 IronRadio - Topic Whether to Continue Bulking
item.description: Happy New Year! As we start a new year, the guys come together to cover news and mail, and to bring some timely discussion on strength and physique goals for 2017. The listener mail covers news on caffeine and creatine, and the usual science news covers post-biotic treatments for diet rebound as well as the iffy value of collagen in your supplements. After the break, in the Topic of the Day, Phil joins in from the road. Everyone talks about diet and physique time frames and pitfalls. Will you compete in the coming year? Is leanness a goal? Then this one is for you!

item.title: Episode 397 IronRadio - Topic The Community Episode
item.description: On this festive holiday, Drs. Nelson and Lowery turn to the community for news, discussion and input. Topics include goal setting, custom pre-workout supplement formulations, how to manipulate variable resistance training, and lots on protein and health. It's a fun shop talk kind of episode this week while so many of us rest and appreciate those around us. Finally, the seasonal social media contest and the donation drive come to a close; please consider a donation at www.IronRadio.org. Happy Holidays!

item.title: Episode 396 IronRadio - Guest Cesar Torres Topic Best Books for Size and Strength
item.description: This week the guys are joined by lifter, novelist and blogger Cesar Torres to talk about the best lay and academic books for building muscle and strength. Before the post-break discussion, though, mail and news get the usual coverage. The mail concerns older 50-something lifters and the IronRadio social media contest. The reward swag is dwindling! The news touches on new findings regarding blood supply to trained muscle tissue and purported steroid access in high schools. The Topic of the Day addresses Cesar's picks - and recent syndicated blog post - for which books best help new lifters. Everyone adds to his top three with their own favorites. Not all suggestions are strictly for beginners! These could be the thinking man's, or woman's, guide to Christmas gifts! Finally, please consider a donation to the seasonal funds drive at www.IronRadio.org. Join in!

item.title: Episode 395 IronRadio - Guest Justen Straight Topic Working at a Protein Company
item.description: With Phil away at a big meet, Drs. Nelson and Lowery nerd-out with supplement company professional Justen Straight. First, the weekly mail and news... The mail covers combined endurance and strength training and the Fall-Winter contest. The news touches on new fndings regarding the anti-depressant effects of curcumin supplementation. Then, after sharing his origin story, Justen educates us on protein types and quality, and shares what it's like to work at a large protein corportation. He even touches on things to look for as a consumer when buying protein powders. Lastly, please consider a donation to the seasonal funds drive at www.IronRadio.org. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 394 IronRadio - Topic Comfort Foods for Recovery
item.description: Lonnie and Phil cover news and mail before discussing comfort foods and recovery. The news is about leucine for connective tissue repair and the mail announces the most recent Fall-Winter contest winner. Topics of discussion include relevant nutrients in comfort foods, the co-hosts' favorites, how lifters' comfort food choices may differ from the mainstream, and even discomfort foods and alcohol. 'Tis the season and these foods abound. Take advantage of them! Also please remember to consider a donation to the seasonal funds drive at www.IronRadio.org and participate in the Winter contest, where all you need to do is make two tweets about IronRadio and an iTunes review to get sweet swag. Pull up a bench and grab a plate; it's time again for a helping of Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 393 IronRadio - Guest Kelly Lowery Topic You Might Be a Strength Athlete If
item.description: After news and mail, the crew goes mental. Licensed Professional Counselor Kelly Lowery adds to a conversation on common behavioral issues exhibited by some strength and muscle athletes. Have you ever seen a true narcissist in the gym or at an event? When does obsession go too far? And what does the diagnostic tool used by professionals say about body image issues? Time to find out! Also, don't forget the Winter contest, where all you need to do is make two tweets about IronRadio and solicit two iTunes reviews to get sweet swag. The counselor's couch is ready for you, please come in and lay back!

item.title: Episode 392 IronRadio - Topic Worst Supplement and Training Fads
item.description: Ever roll your eyes about a supplement claim or training fad? This week the guys abandon their usual positivity for a more cynical look at such things. First the news and mail cover a gen-pop article of questionable quality. Then in the Topic of the Day, Coach Stevens and Drs. Lowery and Mike discuss fads from tingly pre-workout capsules to misguided unilateral limb workouts. Lastly, don't forget the Winter contest, where all you need to do is make two tweets about IronRadio and solicit two iTunes reviews to get sweet swag! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 391 IronRadio - Topic Grungy or Just Busted
item.description: Phil is back, so he and Lonnie discuss the grungy side of muscle sports. First, though, some listener mail and news get covered. This week it focuses on new research regarding anabolic hormones. Does insulin increase blood flow? Is it truly anabolic? And if not, what does it do for muscle growth? The guys toss around facts and ideas. Then in the Topic of the Day, the dirty duo shine a light on grungy places and behaviors. Some in fact are just busted and nasty - gyms, clothes, foods, fellow lifters, plenty gets discussed. If you have thoughts on what's hardcore versus just gross, this episode is for you. Wipe off that sweaty bench, have a seat and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 390 IronRadio - Topic Lifters Maladies and Self Care
item.description: With Phil away at a powerlifting reunion of sorts, the nerds take the helm and healthcare geekery ensues. After the listener mail and tweets, Drs. Nelson and Lowery run down a list of ailments that affect lifters and discuss what to do about them. Beyond the typical muscle and joint aches and pains, there's plenty to complain about. Have you ever dealt with stomach gurgles, fish oil burps, frequent urination, torn callouses, or recurring head colds? Get tips on these issues and more sensitive stuff! It's an extra long episode and is now live on iTunes, YouTube audio, IronRadio.org and other media outlets. Here's to your health!

item.title: Episode 389 IronRadio - Topic The Next Five Years in Muscle Sports
item.description: Where are strength and muscle sports heading? Coach Stevens and Dr. Lowery talk shop and prognosticate. From popularity trends in recent years to the fracturing of federations to a morphing scene in bodybuilding, plenty gets discussed. Which sports seem to be growing? Stagnating? Shrinking? Find out! Also tune in for mail and news on how various milk proteins may benefit your heart health and may even support a better pump in the gym. Pull up a bench and get in on the gym talk!

item.title: Episode 388 IronRadio - Guests Van Wyk, Casey, Slack Topic Exercise Physiology Conference Roundtable
item.description: In a special episode this week, the guys record on-site from the American Society of Exercise Physiology meeting in Ohio. A big focus this year was exercise, sports nutrition and mental health. How do athletes use self-talk to their advantage? What does resistance training do to your grey matter? Do sports supplements or diets also augment brain power? Get some answers! Podcasting is a great way to provide real-time information from scientific meetings that matter. Time to get studious, for both your muscles AND your brain!

item.title: Episode 387 IronRadio - Topic Listener Question-and-Answer
item.description: This week Coach Stevens and Dr. Nelson cover a variety of news and listener mail, then tackle more questions in the Topic of the Day. The topics include lifting in power meets as a noob, mechanisms of strength gain, staying in your competitive weight class, aesthetics, kratom, Chris Duffin's crazy double in the deadlift with 1000 lb., coming back from injuries, supersets, and plenty more! Got questions? The guys have answers!

item.title: Episode 386 IronRadio - Guest Kaylee Hauschild Topic Starting in Strength Coaching
item.description: Coach Stevens and Drs. Lowery and Mike cover news and listener mail, then chat with Strength and Conditioning intern - and strength athlete - Kaylee Hauschild. The news covers new findings on the glycemic index and the weekly mail addresses simultaneous muscle gain and fat loss. After the break, everyone discusses the positives and negatives of getting into strength and conditioining as a professional. From head coaches to team culture to personal time with the weights, plenty gets attention! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 385 IronRadio - Topic Bench Pressing Across Different Sports
item.description: This week's science news is about the combination of walking with resistance training, and about the appetite-altering and hormonal effects of milk. Iron Radio news covers listener mail on travel tips, the Fall funds drive, and new YouTube listeners. The Topic of the Day addresses variations in the bench press specific to your goals. Grip type and width, tempo, bar path, back and foot placment, incline, decline... there's plenty to discuss! Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 384 IronRadio - Topic Optimal Muscle Soreness
item.description: After some science news and Facebook listener achievements, the guys discuss muscle soreness. How much is too much? How is muscle micro-trauma measured? And if frequently sore, what can you do to improve your training? Find out! Also covered this week - mulberries for nervous system recovery, a new free USDA database to help you track your dietary intake, which organic foods are most popular, and shout-outs to listeners who are already supporting the Fall funds drive. Lastly don't forget: YouTube audio is now published alongside - and sometimes before - the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 383 IronRadio - Topic Alpha Males in Fitness
item.description: Are fitness consumers more vulnerable to alpha male displays? Or are we more sophisticated than that? After the usual news, the guys discuss pros and cons of dominance hierarchies. On one side we evolved from primates that are prone to such things. On the other, there are social - and fitness - benefits to be had. From magazine covers to marketing, and from gurus to gym owners, plenty gets discussed. Also tune in for a kitchen hack to make fish more appealing, Russian hacking and doping scandals, and foods to watch for fillers. And don't forget: YouTube audio is now published alongside - and sometimes before - the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 382 IronRadio - Guest Anthony Roberts Topic Federal Regulation and Kratom
item.description: This week the guys cover news and mail before catching up on recent DEA regulation of the opioid supplement kratom. Some lifters certainly use it and many see its regulation as unfair. First, the news covers obesity rates, federal guidelines limiting added sugar, new rare sugars, energy drinks, sin taxes and more. After the mid-show break, the Topic of the Day dives into all manner of federal regulation and how it affects lifters. Journalist and strength enthusiast Anthony Roberts helps keep us abreast. How do drugs and even some supplements become scheduled? Are there undisclosed powers at work? How do lifters use kratom? And are once again strength athletes an easy target? Tune in to find out! Lastly, don't forget: YouTube audio is now published alongside - and sometimes before - the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 381 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Achievements in Training
item.description: In this holiday weekend episode the guys discuss news and respond to listener mail befor talking shop about recent achievements in and around the gym. The news is about vegans, carbohydrate cravings, ketogenic diets, contest preparation, and various Iron Radio happenings. After the mid-show break, discussion over recent achievements includes maintaining frequency during intense spells at work, reclaiming 500 lb. lifts, getting back to dieting, and more. Finally, remember: YouTube audio is now published alongside - and sometimes before - the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 380 IronRadio - Guest MC Powers Topic Certifications for Self Improvement
item.description: Fitness certifications are typically meant for trainers and coaches but what about one's own training? The guys invite back university strength coach Mary Catherine Powers for insights. From types and requirements, to unhelpful aspects, to the differences between coaching and personal benefit, the conversation covers plenty. Also, the news brings up tough questions on getting started in physique sports and shares nutrition headlines. Finally, remember: YouTube audio is now published alongside - and sometimes before - the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 379 IronRadio - Topic Old Ideas that Work or Do Not
item.description: Have you ever heard a time-honored theory on gaining strength or muscle mass that still holds true? Or remember one that no longer holds up? Sometimes science and progress change our conclusions, sometimes they support the old ones. Join Coach Stevens and Professor Lowery as they examine a few such ideas and principles. Specific concepts like progressive overload, reversibility, specificity, pre-exhaust, negatives, and the toxin theory of anabolism get attention. Also: The YouTube audio is sometimes published a day before the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Just search IronRadio - one word - on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 378 IronRadio - Topic Reddit Questions
item.description: Lonnie and Phil do news and listener mail before getting to Reddit questions in the Topic of the Day with Dr. Mike Nelson. News is about how large Americans are, why diets don't work, funding your wellness business with grants, and more. Mail covers getting enough caffeine through coffee, managing health vs. gains, and rest time between sets. In the Reddit question-and-answer segment, the guys cover inquiries both old and new. What are affordable foods to keep stocked in your pantry? Is sugar more or less equal to other carbs? And at what moment did the hosts decide to take diet seriously? Note that IronRadio is now also being simulcast on YouTube - AUDIO ONLY - for those who might prefer to listen at home via that method. The YouTube audio is sometimes published a day before the usual podcast. If people like it, it will continue. Check out Lonman07 on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 377 IronRadio - Topic Lagging Muscle Groups
item.description: Lonnie, Phil, and Big Jon Mike cover news and discuss lagging muscles this week. The news is about genetics and gene doping as well as caffeine and muscle recovery. In the Topic of the Day, the guys address the causes of weak or lagging muscle groups and how to bring them up. Issues like genetics, rep type, volume, and realistic expectations come up. Note that IronRadio is now also being simulcast on YouTube - AUDIO ONLY. If people like it, it will continue. Check out Lonman07 on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 376 IronRadio - Topic Two-a-Day Programs
item.description: Technical glitches notwithstanding, the guys are like clockwork, bringing news and discussion. The science news covers newly suggested rules for consuming raw eggs and an oft-overlooked way to handle training and life stress. The Topic of the Day covers the considerations of two-per-day training programs. What are the benefits? The demands? And who are they best for? Find out! Tune in for the usual podcast - that's also being simulcast this week on YouTube! Details are on the Facebook IronRadio Listeners Page, Lonman7 on Twitter and Lonman07 on Youtube.

item.title: Episode 375 IronRadio - Topic News, Reviews, Power Meet Talk
item.description: This week is a bit different. After Drs. Nelson and Lowery cover nutrition news and iTunes reviews, Phil goes out onto the floor of a powerlifting meet for brief interviews. News topics include the anabolic effect of plant proteins, huge protein intakes and fat gain, what healthy poop looks like, and cranberries as anti-inflammatory nutraceuticals that also aid gut health. After the mid-show break, Coach Stevens covers some lifter questions and offers audio clips from the floor of the Sunflower State power meet. Topics include leaving weight on the platform, judging squat depth, positive versus negative reinforcement, first time competitors, timing one's energy drink on the big day, and plenty more. Tune in and see why Iron Radio is the favorite podcast of many strength and health enthusiasts!

item.title: Episode 374 IronRadio - Guest Mike Beech Topic Highland Games
item.description: The science-vs-sport pendulum swings back toward athletes this week with with Highland Games national lightweight champion Mike Beech. After Lonnie covers some news and mail, Coach Stevens talks shop with Mike. The news is about working and playing hard, and the injury risks in strength and muscle sports. Which sport is most dangerous? Find out! News also covers crazy 1100-pound deadlifts and controversial Crossfit prizes. Then in the day's topic, the guys cover which events take place in the lightweight and heavyweight classes of Highland games, trends in the sport, the Highlander approach to gym time, and tons more. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 373 IronRadio - Guest Kelly Lowery Topic Fat Loss Behaviors
item.description: Drs. Nelson and Lowery cover news and listener mail, then talk behavior modification with licensed counselor Kelly Lowery. First, coffee science takes center stage and bodybuilding posing tips get covered. What weird applications are coming from used coffee grounds? And how does drawing stick figures help prepare one for physique display on stage? Find out! Then in the day's topic, behavioral therapist - and bodybuilder's wife - Kelly Lowery gets in on a fat loss discussion. What is CBT? How do counselors set up clients for behavior change? Which lifestyle factors help or hinder adherence to a fat loss program? Time to get your learn on.

item.title: Episode 372 IronRadio - Topic What's In Your Supplement Cabinet?
item.description: In this holiday weekend episode, the guys cover lots of news, then discuss dietary supplements. The news is about engineering super broccoli, a huge new whey and casein factory opening in Europe, the mechanism by which gut microbes affect our physiology, coffee - more coffee - and much more. After the break, the talk turns to which dietary supplements each co-host has in his cabinet. From muscle building to dieting, to injury prevention and rehab, and even to nootropics, the bases get covered. Time to turn on Iron Radio while you grill up those steaks!

item.title: Episode 371 IronRadio - Guests Anthony Almada and David Barr Topic Nutrient Timing and Ketotic Diets
item.description: After everyone answers fun questions in the culmination of the Quick Fire contest, two major topics get attention. First, David Barr - long a critic of overstated claims for pre-post-workout timing - makes some serious observations. Anthony Almada concurs, offering his experise and evidence from the literature as well. Then, after the break, the guys talk all things keto. Do fat-adapted athletes struggle with intense workouts? Are very low-carbohydrate diets only for those of a certain genetic disposition? Almada furthers the discussion with more insights from the literature. This is a fun and informative episode that dares to challenge convention.

item.title: Episode 370 IronRadio - Guest Mark Rogers Topic Habits and Exercise Programming
item.description: We are all creatures of habit. But can you manipulate yours to benefit your training? After some news on diabetes and a new handheld spectroscopy-based food scanner, the guys talk behavior change. Trainer, podcaster, and entrepreneur Mark Rogers shares insights on how long it takes to form a new lifestyle habit, what mechanisms underlie it, how to set yourself up for maximum benefit, and more. It's time to reinforce your own weekly practice - of listening to Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 369 IronRadio - Guests Van Wyk and Casey Topic News, ISSN Meeting, Supplement Company Startups
item.description: News and on-site coverage are some of the best things a podcast can share. This week you get five hosts and guests offering both! First, Phil and Jon cover recent deaths as well as doping in the news. After the break, Lonnie catches up with Korey Van Wyk and Sean Casey to get thoughts on the International Society of Sports Nutrition conference, and lessons from Sean's new dietary supplement company start-up. Note that the audio can be a bit rough at times bu the information is good!

item.title: Episode 368 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Iron Radio Goings-On
item.description: This week the crew covers news, listener mail, and then shares upcoming Iron Radio-related events. The news is about science journalism and how much we can trust nuritrion studies. The two mail bits cover herniated disks and under-eating. After the mid-show break, the day's topic is just catching up with the myriad fitness industry events that have the co-hosts running everywhere. Dr. Nelson's speaking engagements and certifications, Coach Stevens' Barbell Open event and behind-the-scenes happenngs, and Dr. Lowery's research presentation on muscle recovery this summer. Also tune in for Iron Radio plans like the Quick Fire contest, upcoming guests, and more. Join in!

item.title: Episode 367 IronRadio - Guest Oliver Harper Topic Undergrad Strength and Conditioning Prep
item.description: Phil and Lonnie cover some news, then sit down with collegiate strength and conditioning lab instructor Oliver Harper. The news is about extremely brief, high-intensity workouts, and the power of nutrition to change physical structures. The Topic of the Day covers academic strength and conditioning preparation. What do undergraduate students bring to the table? What do they lack? And what types of experiences do they need in their education? This holiday edition of Iron Radio offers insights for any lifter curious about getting educated in his pursuits.

item.title: Episode 366 IronRadio - Topic Good Idea, Bad Idea
item.description: Lonnie and Jon cover news and mail before moving to the Topic of the Day. The news involves longer rest periods between sets and a drug side effect warning that may affect lifters. The mail asks about lactose intolerant lifters and protein powders. And the day's topic of discussion is on bad ideas and good ideas. Have you ever screwed up with a nutrition or supplement plan? Do you have any tales of lifting programs that really worked? Drs. Lowery and Mike share some stories of their own. There may be some lessons here that could prevent you from wasting time, money and effort!

item.title: Episode 365 IronRadio - Topic Things We Can't Explain
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Mike talk about Phil's big announcement and other news before discussing the Topic of the Day. In the news, Phil and some other industry names are putting together a video-based powerlifting event. Could be BIG! Also in the news is a video on complete breakfasts, the current higher-protein trend, and pre-workout supplements. After the break, the guys offer discussion on things they can't explain. From high-dose caffeine, to muscle recovery, to insulin, grindig strength, and more, everyone ponders. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 364 IronRadio - Topic News, Muscle Confusion
item.description: Phil, Jon and Mike cover some news and have a relaxed chat about muscle confusion. The news covers a new at-home three-dimensional body scanner, problems with Biggest Loser participants, supposedly-wasted time spent in the gym, and the upcoming Olympic trials in weightlifting. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys discuss misconceptions over the concept of muscle confusion. Is it just a marketing ploy? How does muscle tissue actually respond to training variety? And how might a lifter use real programming principles such as variety and overload, or unilateral lifts and different planes of movement, properly? It's time again for your weekly dose of Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 363 IronRadio - Guest JP Price Topic His Big Squat
item.description: Dr. Lowery does some science news from the road, then Coach Stevens catches up with JP Price about his recent groundbreaking HUGE squat and great meet. First, in the news, Dr. L covers at-risk nutrients among popular diets - vegan, low-carbohydrate, and paleo-diets. There's also information on what a high-fat diet may be doing to your daytime sleepiness and nighttime sleep quality. Then, after the break, the Topic of the Day is a discussion with powerlifter JP Price on his recent 1003-pound squat. Unbelievable!

item.title: Episode 362 IronRadio - Topic Supplements to Ramp-up or Relax
item.description: How do you ramp up for the gym or relax at night? Drs. Lowery and Nelson share the news, then talk dietary supplements. The focus is on pre-workout stimulants and sleep aids. Benefits and pitfalls are both addressed. Ingredients such as niacin, beta-alanine, caffeine, magnesium, theanine, melatonin, and valerian root are among compounds that get attention. Also tune in for news on how caffeine works in the body, the global state of obesity and diabetes, and additional benefits of milk proteins in your protein bars. Lastly, check out the Quick Fire contest on the Iron Radio Listeners Facebook page!

item.title: Episode 361 IronRadio - Topic Training Program Periodization Frameworks
item.description: After the usual news and mail, the guys talk periodization. Which frameworks exist for designing training programs and avoiding staleness? There are basic concepts at work that help educated lifters better understand the myriad commercial programs out there. Linear, reverse-linear, undulating periodization - they are all valid depending on your goals. Also tune in for information on a common painkiller that might be interfering with your mental state and even lifting technique, insurance discounts at the grocer, and a proposal for new food labeling. Finally, don't forget to participate in the April-May Quick Fire contest. Prizes await those posting on the Iron Radio Listeners Facebook page!

item.title: Episode 360 IronRadio - Topic Operational Definitions for Lifters
item.description: Travel, surgery and flu notwithstanding, Phil and Dr. L serve up a brief discussion on some key lifting terms you may not know, or of which you may have definitions of your own. From grinding to hitching, from muscularity to ripped, the persistent pair offer their thoughts. Also tune in for news on what long naps may do to your metabolism, and what implications they may hold for your macronutrient choices. Finally, tune in for an April-May contest in which the guys put out a call for Quick Fire questions. Prizes await those posting on the Iron Radio Listeners Facebook page!

item.title: Episode 359 IronRadio - On Site Report from the Experimental Biology Conference in San Diego
item.description: Note, audio glitch mid-show is now fixed. Come on site with Drs. Lowery and Nelson for a sneak peak into breaking science that may help lifters.

item.title: Episode 358 IronRadio - Guest John Downing Topic Non-profit Lifting Around the World
item.description: This week the guys talk to powerlifter, teacher, and not-for-profit organizer John Downing. John is already coordinating efforts to bring powerlifting to Zimbabwe and has his sights set on other countries as well. How does one go from simply hearing the clanging of iron plates in a foreign weight room to setting up agreements with governments and business donors? What does this mean for the health of the people around the community centers where it takes place? And what positive impact could powerlifting have on the health of the locals? Tune in to find out! Also in this episode, Dr. L talks about biological clocks and nutrient timing and Phil shares insights about his surgical recovery. Note, Phil is dealing with a substitute mic in this episode, which will temporarily affect his audio quality.

item.title: Episode 357 IronRadio - Topic Lifting and Nutrition News, Mail
item.description: The fitness and nutrition news, and the listener mail, have been mounting so Drs. Lowery and Nelson cover it all in a slightly longer episode. Topics include a downturn in the U.S. diet, salt and appetite, changing your taste preferences, the bogus overuse of weight-for-height as a wellness marker, eating second breakfast, fucoxanthin supplementation, slacker fitness standards for the Navy, doping in sport, and tons more. Also tune in for discussion on properly measuring your max lifts, the role of thyroid for physique management, and careful re-feeds after a diet. Come on in and get informed!

item.title: Episode 356 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Andrew Cutler Topic Lifting and the Good Life
item.description: This week Coach Stevens and Dr. Mike are joined by philosopher Dr. Andew Cutler. After the usual listener mail and news, the guys get contemplative. Dr. Cutler offers for your consideration concepts above and beyond physical fitness. Have you considered higher level issues such as lifelong learning and self-actualization, helping others, citizenship, liturgy and reflection on it all? This week you are invited to go a little deeper!

item.title: Episode 355 IronRadio - Topic When to Change Gears
item.description: Join Coach Stevens and Drs. Nelson and Lowery for the usual news, mail, and a discussion on changing your lifting goals. The science news covers an unexpected link between gut bacteria and your immune system, genetically-modified meat, and -wait for it - protein beer. The topical discussion wrestles with those times when a lifter might think about changing his or her goals or programs. Catastrophic injury or life changes, aging, and reassessment of one's potential are examples. Phil also offers a shout out to a listener and an upcoming seminar, and shares his approach to his recent hamstring tear. Get in on the conversation!

item.title: Episode 354 IronRadio - Guest Vince Andrich Topic Behind the Scenes in Bodybuilding and Supplements
item.description: What's your muscle sport identity? Does it affect your consumer behaviors and loyalties? Join Lonnie and Phil as they talk shop with industry veteran Vince Andrich. The guys cover the usual news, then look backward and forward in the bodybuilding, dietary supplement and even publishing industries. Plenty gets covered. Competitive bodybuilding, behind-the-scenes origins of current-day companies and trends, products that get cycled back from marketers as new, and tons more. Also tune in for breaking science on grape juice, eggs, fish oil claims, and even the microbiome of your beard! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 353 IronRadio - Guest Greg Nuckols Topic Rep Ranges, Size and Strength
item.description: This week Dr. Nelson interviews exercise scientist, powerlifter and writer Greg Nuckols. Join in the discussion as the two geek out on topics such as rep ranges for hypertrophy, load-volume considerations, the mathematical relationship between size and strength, blood flow restriction exercise, and plenty more. Also tune in for rants and tangents on -optimal- training, hardcore sets, Tom Cruise, Chipotle, incomprehensible work rates, and even spititual enlightenment!

item.title: Episode 352 IronRadio - Guest Host MC Powers Topic News, Mail, Gym Talk
item.description: So much news and mail building up! Join the guys, and guest host Mary Catherine Powers, as they tackle several topics. Issues covered include gene doping, supplements in your toothpaste, new gym tech for assessing peak power output, heavyweight boxing, saunas, and plenty more. Then in the gym talk segment, the crew covers grip training, 5-3-1, carb cycling, and upper-lower body programming.

item.title: Episode 351 IronRadio - Guest Sean Mohney Topic Building a Big Back
item.description: Coach Stevens and Drs. Lowery and Mike are joined by Sean Mohney for mail, news, a new Iron Radio intern segment, and a talk on building a big back. First, a neophyte question asks about timelines for a first competition, then the news covers online media and protein for dieting. Finally, the Topic of the Day takes a three-sport perspective on training some of the largest muscles on the body - lats, traps and all of their supportive structures.
