Nothing says powerful like a huge back - but there are programming issues for intermediate to advanced lifters! Join in for tips from a powerlifting, strongman, and bodybuilding perspective!

item.title: Episode 350 IronRadio - Topic Behind the Scenes Podcasting
item.description: It's episode 350! That's a lot of Iron Radio. Join in for some lighter fare this week. From news, to silly online listener discussions, to the Topic of the Day, the guys laugh, talk shop, and take listeners behind the scenes. Topics include raw beef, the benefits of exercise, Phil-vs-animal deathmatches, and how Iron Radio gets produced. There have been challenges and format changes across the years that may be instructive for those interested in doing their own show.

item.title: Episode 349 IronRadio - Topic How to Be a Meathead
item.description: This week the news, both in sports and in science, drives the conversation. What is a meathead? A PED user? A web-forum-dominant bodybuilder looking for followers? An anxious or suicidal power athlete? There seems to be no shortage of characteristics and behaviors that collectively apparently define this unique aspect of our sports. You may find yourself agreeing with some descriptors and vehemently opposing others. If you're a bearded, bald, bloated, hard-drinking, vain, big-eating alpha male or female, this episode may be for you!

item.title: Episode 348 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Explosive Lifts
item.description: In another fairly long episode, Jon, Phil, and Lonnie tackle news, listener mail, and then the Topic of the Day. Tons of issues get attention. Training special populations, new dietary guidelines, creatine, caffeine gum, genetically modified foods, overstated natural claims, selecting explosive lifts and types of explosive reps. It's another whirlwind of information and fun talk - so come on in!

item.title: Episode 347 IronRadio - Topic Hormones Revisited
item.description: In an extra-long episode, Drs. Lowery and Nelson cover news, then offer a little lecture of sorts on basic endocrinology. The news covers pros and cons of coffee and energy drinks, along with new products like green coffee flour and even caffeinated peanut butter. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the professors run through a list of major hormones and what they do for lifters. Importantly, practical applications for each of six major glands and their hormones get covered. How does one manipulate adrenaline, thyroid, insulin, testosterone, GH, and cortisol? Tune in and find out! There's something this week for both beginners and more advanced trainers alike.

item.title: Episode 346 IronRadio - Topic Year In Review
item.description: Phil, Jon and Lonnie review 2015, including predictions made one year ago. Did they come true? Topics include gut bacteria and health, coffee, and extreme diets like gluten-free, IIFYM, GOMAD, and detox. Also reviewed are dietary supplement grants, strict anti-doping regulations, and training trends like daily squatting and eccentric reps. Finally, the guys offer a few sneak peeks and predictions for 2016. Start your new year with a look back and a look ahead!

item.title: Episode 345 IronRadio - Guest Adam Glass Topic Grip Training
item.description: Join Drs. Nelson and Lowery for listener mail, news and talk of grip training. Adam Glass joins the guys to share insights from the world of hand strength. Grip competitions, hand size, anatomy, and the surprisingly far-reaching benefits of grip strength get discussed. Pull up a bench and get some handy tips!

item.title: Episode 344 IronRadio - Topic Lightning Round Questions
item.description: After a request for more light-hearted fare, the guys have fun answering this-or-that questions about their lifestyle and preferences. Of course the usual news gets attention as well, including information on protein-oatmeal products, sleep and body fatness, a potential new dark side to saturated fats, and micro-RNAs as part of anabolic sensitivity. It's a fun show for holiday listening. Merry Christmas Iron Brothers and Sisters!

item.title: Episode 343 IronRadio - Topic News and Gym Talk
item.description: During a mid-December lull, the guys just kick back with a little news and gym talk. The news comes from listener mail and a recent review paper. Topics include preserving muscle during immobilization, collagen as a protein supplement, and biceps tears. The Topic of the Day continues the chat with what the hosts are experiencing in the gym. Issues like triceps tenderness, general conditioning, training volume, and the importance of frequency get attention. Pull up a bench and get in on the talk!

item.title: Episode 342 IronRadio - Guest Carrie Hogan Topic Holistic Recovery
item.description: With Phil at a meet, Drs. Lowery and Nelson geek out a bit with guest Carrie Hogan. Playing some catch-up with science news, the crew discusses the pros and cons of getting your vitamin D above the normal range, and the ramifications, if any, of using caffeine as a testosterone booster. Then fellow nerd, masotherapist, trainer and nutrition professional Carrie Hogan shares her origin story. How does one become so broadly educated as a practitioner? Then, in the Topic of the Day, Ms. Hogan runs down the gamut of interconnected factors that affect our athletic and even clinical recovery. How does one balance fuel replenishment, the microbiome, inflammation, antioxidant effects, micronutrient provision, soft tissue maintenance and so much more? Tune in to find out.

item.title: Episode 341 IronRadio - Guest Keith Norris Topic Eccentric Training
item.description: After some listener mail, join a conversation with innovator and eccentric-isokinetic training expert Keith Norris. His expo events and inventions make for interesting discussion. The mail question involves double-dumbbell rows; the Topic of the Day is almost a news-type of segment and addresses many questions. What new machines and tools exist that involve a fresh approach to eccentric and isokinetic lifting? How do they compare, both pro and con, with traditional eccentric methods? And how do isometric contractions and eccentric microtrauma add to one's toolbox? Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 340 IronRadio - Guest Eva T Topic Preventing Overtraining
item.description: The guys cover the usual news and mail segments, then talk with Olympian skier, Strength Coach and and Crossfitter Eva T. From red meat to back pain, to the lessons of lifting maturity, plenty gets discussed. From the beginning, Eva seemed to fit right in with the Iron Radio crew. Tune in for chat about the three types of fitness identity, the value of experience in a coach, the fitness industry obsession with over-the-top behaviors, and tools that can be used to monitor yourself so you don't end up regretting the passions of youth. Are YOU overtraining? Come on in and find out.

item.title: Episode 339 IronRadio - Guest Matt Wenning Topic Strength for the Military
item.description: Phil and Lonnie cover news and mail, then talk shop with powerlifter Matt Wenning. The news is about a new way for lifters to look at coffee. The mail addresses prohormones and leanness. Then, in the Topic of the Day, Matt shares his experiences with military and para-military organizations. Have they had the concept of fitness wrong all these years? What can the military learn from strength athletes? And how does military fitness parallel academic fitness? Join in and get the inside scoop. Note: potty-mouth powerlifters at work.

item.title: Episode 338 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Peter Fitschen Topic Getting Stage Lean
item.description: This week, after a bit of Iron Radio listener mail on entry-level powerlifting, the guys discuss how to get competition-lean with Dr. Peter Fitschen. Peter is a natural pro bodybuilder who also holds graduate degrees in physiology and nutrition. Plenty gets discussed. What principle is most important to know when dieting? How long do these extreme diets take? Should a dieter choose multiple shows to enter? And what does a bodybuilder need to look out for in the final throes of a half-year diet? Tune in to find out!

item.title: Episode 337 IronRadio - Topic News, Listener Appreciation
item.description: Coach Stevens and Drs. Mike and Lowery cover news, mail, and the Topic of the Day. The news and mail are about red meat, creatine, certifications, and fasting cardio for women. The Topic of the Day is the promised segment that involves listener appreciation. The guys turn to the facebook Listeners Page and offer further insight of their own on traveling to events. Grocery lists, equipment, and last-minute water balance plans get attention. It's time again for your weekly dose of Iron!

item.title: Episode 336 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Superfans
item.description: This week Dr. L covers news and listener mail, then asks licensed counselor Kelly Lowery to bring some information on the phenomenon of superfans. The news covers paleo diets and a surprising protein supplement. The Topic of the Day covers the super-fan concept. What is a superfan? How are they identified? And how do bodybuilding and powerlifting fans differ from mainstream superfans? Tune in and find out!

item.title: Episode 335 IronRadio - Topic Strength Guild Games, Attending Events
item.description: Join in for a roundtable discussion with Strength Guild Games competitors. These lifters were feeling rocked but positive about some extreme performances the prior day. In the Topic of the Day, everyone offers insights on event preparation. As the co-hosts gear up for the listener appreciation event, which will ask listeners to offer their own tips, it seemed an opportune time to also ask the coaches and competitors on-hand. This episode was recorded on the road, so again please forgive minor glitches.

item.title: Episode 334 IronRadio - Topic Best Bulking
item.description: After listener mail, the guys talk Autumnal bulking. With the smell of Guinness meat pies and chili in the cool fall air, how can they not? During listener mail, tune in for facts and opinions on using saunas, dietary supplements for older lifters, and more. In the Topic of the Day, everyone offers thoughts on how to take advantage of high calorie foods without simply acquiring a jiggling belly. This week there was a fairly catastrophic tech breakdown, so please forgive the glitches.

item.title: Episode 333 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail, Lifter Jokes
item.description: This week Iron Radio gets increasingly silly. Some serious listener questions give way to lifter jokes! In the mail, speculation on mixed strength-endurance events brings about some thoughts. Then a British listener comments on the vegan article critiqued on-air recently. Afterward, questions involve bulking, periodization, and cold-hot contrast showers for recovery. The Topic of the Day then gets funny. Learn about such important topics as... How Franco Columbu is a metaphor for life, how to identify a novice bodybuilder, why powerlifting is not a sport, when to call 911 after dieting, why runners waste time, which vegan practices are questionable, and tons more! Finally, note that the fall funds drive is kicking off and the guys appreciate your support. Come on in for Iron Radio's first humor-specific topic.

item.title: Episode 332 IronRadio - Topic How to Stall Progress, Bloopers
item.description: Jon, Lonnie and Phil cover the usual mail and news, then get sarcastic. In the mail, a vegetarian lifter speaks up. In the news, learn what a Big Mac does to you within an hour. Then the Topic of the Day turns increasingly tongue-in-cheek. If you've ever wanted to stagnate your strength and size gains, the guys are here to help. Find out how to stall your progress in a variety of ways - program hopping, undereating, getting injured, imitating the pros - the list gets long and humorous. Then, since the discussion was brief, stick around for behind-the-scenes bloopers. These reveal the coffee slurping, tired and blunt ramblings of the co-hosts on all sorts of topics over recent months. Brace yourself, some get a little explicit!

item.title: Episode 331 IronRadio - Topic Support Gear
item.description: News and listener questions get addressed, then the Topic of the Day ensues. News covers curry recipes and vegan bodybuilding, and the listener question is on spinal fusion surgery for young lifters. After the mid-show break, the discussion covers support gear. Questions get answered. When should one use straps? Are belts often used incorrectly? And how do belts get used differently among muscle sports? Why do the co-hosts love sleeves? And what's up with the excessive taping trend? Tune in for facts and opinions. This episode grows into a bit of a variety show, so if you are into sports nutrition, injury treatment, or simple support gear, come on in!

item.title: Episode 330 IronRadio - Guest Host Jerell Barber Topic Mind-in-the-Muscle
item.description: Guest host Jerell Barber joins the guys for news chat and a discussion on the mental side of lifting. In the news, a blog written by Dani Shugart draws listener attention. Then Dr. Lowery offers a random mini-review of modalities that may help with muscle soreness and recovery. There are many and some are better than others, depending on the desired outcome. In the Topic of the Day, everyone looks at the Mnd-in-the-Muscle, or perhaps Mind-in-the-Movement, concept. Is it better to deeply associate with what you are doing or to dissociate? Come on in to get varying perspectives!

item.title: Episode 329 IronRadio - Guest Neil Cushnie Topic Q and A
item.description: Listener Neil Cushnie joins the guys for a discussion on muscle-related news, then has questions for everyone. In the science news and listener mail, expectations of a beefy meal affect fullness, chronic stimulant use gets scrutiny, and seemingly obvious studies are questioned. In the Topic of the Day, Biggest Gainer competitor Neil brings the inquiries. What's the best balance between intrinsic and extrinsic motivation? Why is the overhead press a lost art? And is the deadlift or squat the king of exercises? Sunday is upon us and thus so is Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 328 IronRadio - Guest Gina Tacconi-Moore Topic Soft Tissue Work
item.description: After some news and chat, the guys interview Gina Tacconi-Moore on soft tissue work for lifters. The news touches on intermittent fasting, and on some pretty mind-blowing generational health implications of one's lifestyle. In the Topic of the Day, Gina - a former sprinter and owner of both CrossFit Lowell and the treatment room in that facility - offers insights. Everyone discusses massage, the intensity of soft tissue manipulations, self treatment, licensure qualifications, referrals, and tons more. For those who ache, have clients with soft tissue injury, or are just curious about what grilled cheese sandwiches have to do with all this, come on in.

item.title: Episode 327 IronRadio - Guest Cale Schultz Topic Hypertrophy and Stuntmen
item.description: Stuntman Cale Schultz joins the guys for a discussion on muscle mass and strength in his industry. Are stuntmen just wild-eyed thrill seekers? How much training goes into what they do? And what strength sports are similar? Stuntmen have to be tough as nails on minimal recovery, so there's plenty to learn. Also tune in for news and opinion on alcohol for bodybuilders, cardiac risk assessment for heavy squatters, and new research on the anti-inflammatory supplement curcumin. Come on in, if you're tough enough.

item.title: Episode 326 IronRadio - Topic Dietary Supplement Hysteria
item.description: What's your stance on bodybuilding supplements? Are they a crutch for guys with masculinity and body image problems or can they be used constructively? A psych-related news report brought to the guys by licensed counselor Kelly Lowery sparks discussion. In particular, negative press on mainstream use of whey protein, creatine, and L-carnitine gets dissected. Does one need to be in serious training to justify supplement use? And what are the issues surrounding research reports by potentially biased investigators? Also in this week's episode is a follow-up on the soybean oil-obesity scare and news on a threatening obesity gene that's soon to be targeted by drug companies. Is all this too much to bear? Stay calm and keep on listening.

item.title: Episode 325 IronRadio - Guest Matt Jones Topic Spinal Injury Comeback
item.description: After sharing news and mail, Phil and Lonnie wrap up the summer's comeback-from-injury theme with Matt Jones. If you've wondered how a lifter deals with the blow to his psyche, this episode is for you. Staying constructive and focusing on the immediate task at hand seems key. The guys also discuss the importantance of participating in your own medical treatment and getting social support from other lifters. Other topics include disturbing news on soybean oil and obesity, as well as comfortable versus perfect form in the squat.

item.title: Episode 324 IronRadio - Guest Bob Lemieux Topic Hypertrophy and Strength Coaching
item.description: Come on-site to a Division 1 university athletic training center to learn from Coach Bob Lemieux. Bob is the Director of Strength and Conditioning, has graduate training in nutrition and other fields relevant to athletics, and is himself a self-described meat head - at least in part. Dr. Lowery asks plenty of questions. How does university-level strength coaching differ from Internet and magazine bodybuilding? Is muscle hypertrophy the main focus? Which teams and athletes are toughest to train? What can bodybuilders learn from university-level strength coaching? And is Bob, himself inclined toward the mass gain side of the training spectrum? This week we go behind the scenes to better understand the science and art of strength and conditioning.

item.title: Episode 323 IronRadio - Guest Dal Gains Topic Boxing and Resistance Training
item.description: Phil and Lonnie announce summer contest winners, then answer some mail before sitting down with boxer-lifter Dal Gains. If you've risen from the ashes of serious injury, you'll be inspired by our contest champions. If you've wondered how women undertake a successful bulking phase, listen for the mail segment. Then in the Topic of the Day, you'll hear about boxing myths and traditions, especially regarding resistance training. How might a heavyweight boxer train differently than a middle weight? What's complimentary about explosive lifting for the boxer? And is it possible to stay tight under the bar yet stay loose in the ring? Tune in to fnd out!

item.title: Episode 322 IronRadio - Topic Bodybuilding and Strength Documentaries
item.description: Phil and Lonnie share news and answer listener mail before getting to the Topic of the Day. In the news, powerlifting drama unfolds and a discussion of meets and federations ensues. Listener mail is about small-jointed lifters and the day's discussion covers bodybuilding and strength documentary films. Was a spark ignited in you by Pumping Iron? What was its impact on pop culture? And can movies like The Comeback - aka Total Rebuild - equal its passion and motivation? Nearly a half dozen films get discussed and rated from various perspectives. It's time to enter Venice Gold's Gym and start gaining some muscles!

item.title: Episode 321 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Brad Dieter Topic Carbs, Training, Heart Function
item.description: After some news, Dr. Brad Dieter joins the guys to talk about his research on carbohydrates, diabetes, training, and heart function. How do normal healthy people differ from diabetics or those with metabolic syndrome? If YOUR carb metabolism goes bad, what happens to you? And what can you do? With roughly one in four Americans in these categories, carb metabolism matters. The discussion ranges from training programs, to fat loss, to keeping an aerobic base, to changes in heart function. Also tune in for talk on genetics, family history, muscle recovery, slow-versus-fast cardio, and more.

item.title: Episode 320 IronRadio - Topic The Clean Eating Spectrum
item.description: It's a long holiday episode this week! After news and listener mail, Coach Stevens remotely fields a question, then the guys cover the Topic of the Day. The news segment is about new technology that promises fast, visible fat loss. The mail is about grip strength, and the question clip is about hypermobility. After the break, the topic turns to the Clean Eating Spectrum. From a simple variety of healthy foods, how does one progress toward losing fat or even a strict contest diet? Find out! It's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 319 IronRadio - Topic Gym Etiquette Revisited
item.description: Drs. Lowery and Mike cover nutrition and supplement news, then turn the mic over to Coach Stevens before the Topic of the Day. The news covers avocados, berberine and coffee. The coaching clip covers exercise addiction. Then, the discussion topic in the second portion of the episode revisits gym etiquette. A recent article in the Huffington Post on unacceptable gym behaviors is the basis for comparisons in hardcore gyms. Are you acting inappropriately in the gym? Find out! Or just roll your eyes and have a good laugh about what's considered acceptable.

item.title: Episode 318 IronRadio - Topic News, Summer Mail
item.description: With summer conference season upon us and a backlog of listener mail, the guys offer tons of information. Strength meetings and clinics in Florida, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Kansas are coming up. In the mail section, topics include stem cells, periodization and program design, recovery, DNA testing, real versus bogus nutrition coaching, and more. Also tune in for a review of a pre-workout and recovery product and recent iTunes reviews of Iron Radio. No guests this week. It's time to get back to the usual shop talk format!

item.title: Episode 317 IronRadio - Guests Casey, Hogan, Van Wyk Topic ISSN Meeting
item.description: Guests Sean Casey, Carrie Hogan, and Korey Van Wyk co-host with Drs. Nelson and Lowery, reporting on the ISSN annual meeting in Austin, Texas. The International Society of Sports Nutrition holds a lay-academic crossover meeting that brings practical, applied lectures alongside more basic science talks with a physique and performance focus. Discussion on several lecture topics includes periodization and exercise programming, adhering to diets, creatine, beta alanine, very high-protein diets, new tech for monitoring progress, antioxidants, and tons more. Knowledge is power. Come get your geek on!

item.title: Episode 316 IronRadio - Guest Mike Walker Topic Stem Cells for Olympic Lifters
item.description: Many lifters struggle with back and joint pain. Strongman and Olympic lifter Mike Walker returns with a story that sheds light on what can be done. It involves stem cell injections for his deteriorating back and what happened. With Phil recovering from a major surgery, this case study is timely and hopeful. Are stem cells becoming a replacement for vertebral fusions in lifters with bad backs? Can they help anything else? How has Mike's training been affected? And what might YOU consider if you suspect slipped discs or degenerated joints, yourself? Also tune in for nutrition news on gut bacteria and food additives, as well as listener mail regarding high volume bodybuilding training and a lean lifestyle. Come on in and get yourself back to training!

item.title: Episode 315 IronRadio - Topic To Whom Do You Compare Yourself?
item.description: After some dietary supplement and training talk, Drs. Nelson and Lowery and Coach Stevens discuss comparisons. Do you compare yourself to other people in your local gym? Are you motivated by professional bodybuilders or world class lifters? Are you most likely to compare yourself to your own prior best efforts? And how does competition fit into all of this? Also tune in for discussion on neurology, eating decisions, and more. This week we're serving up meatier fare than the usual fitness talk!

item.title: Episode 314 IronRadio - Topic Gym Talk, Japanese Nutrition Conference
item.description: In this extra long episode the Iron Radio crew offer gym talk, then come to you on-site from Yokohama Japan. On the lifting front the guys share insights on training while traveling, pre-surgical chores, post-surgical rehab, and more. After the break, the Topic of the Day is a report from the hotel room in Yokohama. Drs. Lowery and Nelson cover the whole experience including new nutrition findings from the Asian Congress on Nutrition. How does physique culture differ in Japan? Why is green tea a big deal? What's the deal with gene clocks and how might they affect you? What meal timing practice can you use to decrease muscle breakdown? There's tons of information you can acquire before it hits journals and textbooks. It's time to journey to the Far East - without the jet lag!

item.title: Episode 313 IronRadio - Topic Time Warp Episode News and Gym Talk
item.description: Enjoy this prerecorded episode that includes tech news for listeners who get Iron Radio via our various apps, as well as news and listener questions. This time warp episode covers questions like length of mesocycles to prevent spinning your wheels, changing your long term goals, avoiding career washout, knee pain in the back squat - and how to address it - and tons more. Get in on this!

item.title: Episode 312 IronRadio - Topic Knowledge, Skills, Abilities
item.description: Dr. Lowery, Dr. Nelson, Coach Stevens, and - wait for it - DOCTOR Jon Mike share news and talk about KSAs. A discussion over what goes on behind the scenes in a PhD dissertation defense leads to a discussion on the different qualities that make someone good in his field. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities - KSA - get attention. What goes into acquiring a high level of knowledge? How does knowledge differ from skill? How does a person's ability level relate to these other qualities? And where do YOU rank on each quality? Tune in for insights. Also listen-in for a summer contest, more on Phil's foray into boxing, and new ways to look at vitamin D. Come on in and raise your knowledge level!

item.title: Episode 311 IronRadio - Topic Coaching Mistakes
item.description: After the usual listener mail and news, Phil and Lonnie cover coaching mistakes. What common mistakes do trainers, coaches and nutrition gurus often make? What can you do about it? Tune in for answers. Whether it's the Just-Like-Me mistake or the Muscle-Sport-Judgement mistake or the Body-Part-Split-for-All mistake, these errors mislead fitness clients. Also covered this week are topics like clean mass gain for professional wrestling, whey protein filtration processes, and an apparent cure for prostate cancer! We're in your ears again... hope you enjoy!

item.title: Episode 310 IronRadio - Topic Favorite Things
item.description: What are your favorite memories, gyms, places to ramp up or cool down, foods, etc.? In this episode the intrepid trio share their thoughts. Coach Stevens, Dr. Lowery and almost-Dr. Jon Mike cover specifics like training stories, competition bests, awesome facilities, mass gain foods, and meals for dieting. Also this week, listener mail is about regional body fat loss and crossing over from powerlifting to Strongman. There's a fun learning curve to understand and spouses can certainly join in! If you like good old fashioned gym talk, this episode is for you. Pull up a bench and join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 309 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, JP's Big Meet
item.description: The guys cover listener mail and news, then talk with JP Price about his big upcoming meet. In the mail, discussion on calorie balance and nutrient partitioning takes place. In the news, an apology piece written on behalf of science journalists irks Dr. L. Then as the Topic of the Day, JP price - a guy who squats over 900 pounds - shares his thoughts as he peaks for his approaching meet. From training time frames, to mindset, to calling numbers for each attempt, JP pulls no punches. And speaking of punches, tune in to find out why Phil is about to embark on a pugilistic journey that may shock his fellow powerlifters. It's time to get in the ring!

item.title: Episode 308 IronRadio - Topic Individual Differences in Training Responses
item.description: Fortress returns to talk training. After resurrecting a segment on training achievements, Lonnie, Fortress, Mike and Jon take a look at why people differ in training progress. The principle of Individual Differences is at work and it goes beyond genetics. From hormonal concentrations to joint structure to psychology and social support, plenty of factors add up to make us different. Also tune in to hear about Fortress' near tussle in the gym last week, Lonnie's attempts to work around an iffy surgical repair, and what all the guys are dealing with in the gym of late. Pull up a bench and get in on this gym talk!

item.title: Episode 307 IronRadio - Speical Episode Experimental Biology Conference in Boston
item.description: In this Iron Radio Special, the meat head versus geek pendulum swings toward the academic side. Drs. Nelson and Cotter come to you on-site from the Experimental Biology conference in Boston. There is a TON of new research that can inform your training and eating! Topics include using science as evidence from a lifter's point of view, the difficulties of publishing research, intermittent fasting, protein targeting for fat loss, weight maintenance after a diet, using the widely-accepted 3500 kcal per pound of fat rule, whey protein for dieters, the five percent weight loss standard used in pharmaceutical research, leucine dose and fat loss, unrealistic linear expectations of progress, biological clocks and health, artificial sweeteners and gut bacteria, and plenty more. Much of this information won't see full publication for months. Come along to Boston and feed your inner geek!

item.title: Episode 306 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Mike Roussell Topic Fats, Meats, and Lifters
item.description: Dr. Mike Roussell joins Coach Stevens, Jon Mike, and Dr. Lowery for nutrition news and a talk about dietary fats and meats - as they might apply to lifters like us. In the news, Dr. Roussell shares insider information from a recent NIH feedback session on new dietary recommendations that are underway. Then, after sharing his own roots in bodybuilding and academics, Mike chats with the Iron Radio crew about dietary cholesterol, various lipids, and meats in the diet. Several questions come up. Can you eat too much meat? What, other than carbohydrates, can keep someone out of ketosis? And how do strength athletes differ from the general population regarding nutrition? Pull up a bench and find out!

item.title: Episode 305 IronRadio - Guest Jerell Barber Topic Starting Olympic Lifts
item.description: First the guys answer some listener mail, then they talk with strength coach Jerell Barber. Listener questions include a new mindset certification and how to use lifting belts properly. The Topic of the Day includes discussion on balance drills, getting into position, tempo, the necessity of repetition, and how much weight to add and when. If you're curious about the Olympic lifts, how they differ from powerlifting, when to include them in your sessions, and how to get started, this episode is for you. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 304 IronRadio - Guest Nick Tumminello Topic Core and Functional Fitness
item.description: After some listener mail and news, Nick Tumminello returns to talk shop. In the mail and news, topics range from flavor enhancers to the Arnold Fitness Weekend. When discussing his origins and projects, Nick talks about his early exposure to sweat and iron, as well as recent articles. Then in the Topic of the Day, Nick calls for some definitions and context regarding core training and functional fitness. What do we mean by core? What do we mean by functional? Tune in to get some insights. Also in this episode are issues like education, originality, conference attendance, and tons more. Pull up a bench and join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 303 IronRadio - Topic News, Mail, Strength Camp
item.description: In this special episode, the guys cover listener mail and news, then offer recordings from last week's strength workshop in Topeka, Kansas. The listener mail addresses coworkers and gym trends. The news covers Crossfit controversies, the Arnold Fitness Weekend, and a newly discovered hormone that mimics exercise. Then, as the Topic of the Day, the strength workshop audio samples range from a seminar on the gym floor, to athlete interviews, to an on-site workshop on cafeine. Tune in to go on-site for an exclusive event!

item.title: Episode 302 IronRadio - Topic What Does Your Family Think
item.description: Fortress returns for a meandering conversation about industry news and the perceptions of family and coworkers. What does YOUR family think of your bodybuilding, powerlifting, or other strength sport endeavors? Topics in this episode include an Ironman magazine reboot, yet another supplement line debut, fitness trends, and tales of how families respond to non-mainstream muscle sports. Join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 301 IronRadio - Topic Obsessed with Fat
item.description: First there's some positive listener mail to discuss, then some news, then of course the Topic of the Day. The mail is about a veteran, a comic strip, big gains, and identifying with a variety of muscle sports. The news relates in various ways to dieting and body fat - from ketone bodies to the relative permanency of obesity. The day's topic follows up with a discussion on why we're obsessed with body fat. Should the focus of novice exercisers simply be muscle and strength gain? Why is it a better initial choice? And how does a lifter transition into tackling diet and body fat once his or her lifestyle gets established? Tune in to find out!

item.title: Episode 300 IronRadio - Topic Squat Variations
item.description: Prepare for glory! It's a milestone in the long history of Iron Radio - Episode 300! First, Dr. Lowery and Jon Mike cover a variety of news, then Coach Stevens joins in for the Topic of the Day. The topic, squat variations, covers high- versus low-bar squats, foot placement, bar types, and other variations. The news covers intermittent fasting, the demonization of dietary cholesterol, and the gap between the lay public and scientists on various medical and food issues. Also tune in for a drawing in which Fortress and the guys will give away copies of the 300 DVD. Only the hard and strong may listen to this episode. Only the hard. Only the strong.

item.title: Episode 299 IronRadio - Guest Jason Cholewa Topic Collegiate Nutrition
item.description: After answering a complicated listener question, Drs. Nelson and Lowery talk with Jason Cholewa. As a sports nutrition professor, powerlifter, and former bodybuilder, Dr. Cholewa shares insights on a flexible approach to educating and feeding collegiate athletes. Can a straight-forward balanced diet benefit team athletes and independent lifters alike? Can one eat healthy on campus? And what does Jason's research reveal about the connection between body composition change and performance enhancement? The day's topics range from metabolic damage, to overcoming dietary obstacles, to the simple pleasure of eating, to what constitutes a fitness expert. Come on in, class is in session!

item.title: Episode 298 IronRadio - Guest Kalle Beck Topic Starting Strongman
item.description: How does one get into Strongman competitions? Join Coach Stevens, Dr. Lowery and Jon Mike as they sit down with strongman Kalle Beck to find out. From finding the right contest to choosing a weight class, to how often one should undertake skills practice, there's plenty of good info. to be had. Also, in the news, the World Anti-doping Agency is under fire from the scientific community. Will new attention to their policies blow the lid off the prevalence of drug use? Everyone gets in on this testy topic. It's time to lift your knowledge base to new heights - if you've got the stones!

item.title: Episode 297 IronRadio - Topic Training Oddities
item.description: With Dr. Mike Nelson in the Third Chair, the intrepid trio cover news, then get into the Topic of the Day - training oddities. The news ranges from clueless thieves to blood sugar tattoos. The topic covers all the weirdness that can surround lifting. Oddball gym members and lifting customs, weird equipment, bizarre lifts, strange facilities, and unusual gym policies. What oddities have YOU seen in YOUR lifting career? Finally, check out the Iron Radio Listeners Page to get information on the end-of-February bootcamp that the Iron Radio hosts will be attending. It's time to tune in and swap lifting tales with the Iron Radio crew!

item.title: Episode 296 IronRadio - Topic Doses, Doses, Doses
item.description: After some news, the guys cover all manner of doses regarding common nutrients, supplements and drugs used by strength athletes. The science news involves a potential off-label use for a bladder drug, of all things. Event news covers the recent NSCA Coaches Conference, and Iron Radio-specific news brings an announcement of an upcoming weekend workshop! After the break, the dosing of select compounds gets discussed. There is still some confusion surrounding several substances. From anti-inflammatories to anti-catabolics, from caffeine to creatine, from DHA to Depo-testosterone, plenty gets discussed. Come on in and get your weekly dose of Iron - Radio, that is!

item.title: Episode 295 IronRadio - Guests Ernie Lilliebridge Sr and Jr Topic Q and A
item.description: Join a call to Ernie Lilliebridge Sr. and Ernie Lilliebridge Jr. as they answer Iron Radio listener questions. Coach Stevens has interacted with the strength community and brought quite a few inquiries for these world record holders! Topics range from motivation to injury to genetics to training philosophy and more. If you've ever wondered what high-level frequently competing powerlifters think, this special show will provide some insight. Pull up a bench and learn what you can from these titans of the competitive scene! NOTE - old school phone calls like this do not always result in the best audio quality, so be forgiving and glean what you can.

item.title: Episode 294 IronRadio - Guest Keith Norris Topic Eccentric Update
item.description: In another fairly long episode, the guys tackle news and speak with tech-savvy business owner Keith Norris. In the news, yet another protein supplement scam ripples across the industry and fast food realities get discussed. In the Topic of the Day, Keith shares his observations using a new type of technology that monitors force output, primarily during eccentric movements. How does the use of negative reps equal efficiency? Is biofeedback useful to lifters during a rep? And how does one program his training, given the extended time frames surrounding eccentric lifts? Tune in and find out!

item.title: Episode 293 IronRadio - Topic Realistic Resolutions
item.description: It's an extra long show! After some holiday news and a discussion on high-dose caffeine, the guys discuss New Year's resolutions. First, in the news, several questions crop up. What did the guys get for Christmas? What training-related stuff did YOU get for Christmas? And what's confusing about caffeine? Can it help with recovery in some ways but blunt muscle growth in others? Also, how much arse is being kicked by the Eastern European raw lifters? Then, after the mid-show break, talk turns to the new year. Phil shares thoughts on resolutions versus proper goals, Dr. L computes how long it takes to lose significant amounts of fat or gain noticable muscle, and Dr. Nelson offers data on New Year's resolution success rates. Also discussed are exercise timing windows, muscle biopsies, mTOR and cancer, green tea, curcumin, resveratrol, homemade gym equipment, Phil's new gym, diminishing returns, why people fail, and tons more. Happy New Year to the whole Iron Brotherhood!

item.title: Episode 292 IronRadio - Guest MC Powers Topic Year in Review
item.description: What was most memorable this past year? Join university strength coach Mary Catherine Powers as she reminisces and makes predictions with the guys. Topics of discussion are myriad. How about a big list? Best researcher, best research topic, social media icons, notable supplement companies and trends, powerlifting records and comebacks, gut bacteria, gluten-free diets, detox diets, IIFYM, GOMAD, favorite Iron Radio episodes and notable listeners, Ed Coan, Bill Pearl, James Flex Lewis, Russion translations of strength texts, lifting after work, the International Society of Sports Nutrition, meat pies, authentic tacos, the quantified self, Fit Bits and new tech, worst drug testing scandal, and tons more. Also, think outside the box musically and check out a holiday pop-classical intro from The Piano Guys.

item.title: Episode 291 IronRadio - Topic Sticky Ideas in Fitness
item.description: Dr. Lowery, Coach Stevens and Dr. Nelson cover some news, then discuss the concept of sticky ideas in the fitness field. The news is about cold weather training, minerals that help with carbohydrate metabolism, how bromance reduces cortisol, and how much protein can be consumed before fat-burning cardio. The Topic of the Day covers what features make an idea pervasive and persistent. Some ideas in fitness are bad and just don't go away. Some ideas are good, and we can use the same principles to spread them and make them stick. It's time for your weekly dose of Iron!

item.title: Episode 290 IronRadio - Topic Eating Extra Large
item.description: After the usual news, Dr. Lowery and Jon Mike get hungry. With Holiday Season bulking days upon us, it's time to tell tales of heroic eating. What are some favorite high-calorie yet nutrient-rich foods? And what stories go with them? Further, what if these foods were broken down into high-carb, high-fat, and high-protein categories? It's a fun discussion that's also informational. Come on in, grab some meat pie, and break through your mass gain barrier!

item.title: Episode 289 IronRadio - Topic Gratisode, Fortress Returns
item.description: In an extra long holiday episode, the guys get grateful. The news covers the health benefits of counting one's blessings as well as the nutrition knowledge of sports coaches. Then, in the Topic of the Day, a web search sets the tone for what muscle heads are thankful for. Favorite exercises, supplements, and foods get attention. What are YOU most thankful for? Then, it's time to Enter the Fortress. It's not Thanksgiving up North, so Rob instead shares his thoughts on the anabolic steroid scene in his part of Canada. Brace yourself for Fortress' usual frank talk. Thanks for joining-in!

item.title: Episode 288 IronRadio - Topic News, Listener Mail
item.description: Like news and topical questions from listeners? If so, this show is for you. The mail bag was stuffed and there's the usual news coming aboout, so the guys wade through a good portion of it. Topics seem to congregate around fat loss but range all over. Lonnie, Phil, and Big Jon cover coffee phytochemicals beyond caffeine, bad Internet searches by those seeking fat loss, a controversial new study on fed-versus-fasting cardio, how a big man cuts down to 12 percent fat, and tons more. There's also information in this one on how to earmark a donation to the show if you'd like to fund Lowery's research or Phil's sponsorship of worthy competitors. Got time? We've got talk!

item.title: Episode 287 IronRadio - Topic Politics and Lifting
item.description: Yes, you read the title correctly. Politics. They affect us all, on multiple levels. So, after some news on hidden factors that may be packing fat on your frame, the guys tackle the forbidden. In what ways do politics and government regulations affect us as lifters? Discussion ranges from health and nutrition licensure, which are state regulated, to dietary supplement differences between republicans and democrats, to healthcare. Even in-the-gym politics get attention. Bodybuilders, powerlifters, olympic lifters - on a micro-level, can we manage ourselves better than dysfunctional politicians do? Liberal or conservative, feel free to join the discussion!

item.title: Episode 286 IronRadio - Guest Chad Kerksick Topic Sports Nutrition Research
item.description: This week the guys jump right into an interview with sports nutrition and muscle researcher Dr. Chad Kerksick. Lots of questions get answered. Does a scientist's research change how he lifts, himself? What populations stand to benefit from resistance training most? And where do many resistance trainers make mistakes when they could simplify and make progress? Then, after a bit of listener news, everyone moves to the Topic of the Day. The conversation ranges from liquid creatine to protein blends, to the stigma surrounding dietary supplements, and more. Come on in and stay up on the literature!

item.title: Episode 285 IronRadio - Topic News, Reversibility Principle
item.description: In the news, Lonnie and Phil talk about new science on what oats do for the body, about the beta-version of the Iron Radio store, and about current lifting meets. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys cover another textbook training principle - reversibility. How long does it take to lose size and function of various bodily systems? From muscle mass, to cellular energy processes, to bone density, to the nervous system, several important areas get attention. And of course the guys cover the practical and coaching aspects of reversibility, like programming and gaining maturity to reduce the fear of loss. Tune in to prevent gray matter atrophy!

item.title: Episode 284 IronRadio - Guest Rich Colasante Topic Orthopedics for Lifters
item.description: In the news, Lonnie, Mike Nelson, and Jon Mike share info on detox scams, sensory deprivation tanks, and caffeine habituation. Then in the Topic of the Day, guest Rich Colasante shares insider information on the present and future of orthopedic - mostly spinal - treatments for heavy lifters. Do you do anything to keep yourself pain-free, performing optimally and with a long training career ahead of you? Or do you just keep training, pop anti-inflammatories, live on pain killers, and hope for the best? The guys cover prehab, getting serious with compliance, stem cells, PRP therapy, communicating with your surgeon, preventive traction via bar hangs and tons more. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 283 IronRadio - Guest Matt Vincent Topic Explosive Lifts for Highland Games
item.description: After some nutrition and drug-related news, the guys check in with Highland Games world champion Matt Vincent. The news covers colorful foods and recovery, and dimethylsulfoxide - DMSO - as an anti-inflammatory and drug delivery agent. Then, Highland Games world champion Matt Vincent talks about his recent victory, peaking, weight loss, and other late-season factors that helped him win. Then, after the break, Matt drops some knowledge bombs regarding explosive lifts to enhance throwing event performance. Learn what lifts he feels are essential, what he thinks about missing lifts in training, how much throwing practice is necessary, how long he programs strength versus speed cycles, and more. The guys even wax philosophical about balance in the life of a strong dude. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 282 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Bill Campbell Topic Sports Nutrition Research
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Big Jon Mike geek out with professor and sports nutrition researcher Bill Campbell. Dr. Campbell is yet another example of how a love of bodybuilding is not only congruent with, but actually drives academic pursuits. The guys discuss plenty. Topics include meal frequency, arginine products and vasodilation, flexible undulating periodization, and an over-emphasis on sports supplements. Take your seats, muscle class is in session!

item.title: Episode 281 IronRadio - Guest Matt Holmes Topic Military Muscle
item.description: With Phil at a competition, Lonnie and Mike Nelson share news and have a chat with tactical training coach, Matt Holmes. First in the news, listener mail regarding body recompositioning gets attention. Then, binging on sugar at Halloween, and the central nervous system get discussed. In the Topic of the Day, Matt, a coach with a difficult past and a history of overcoming obstacles, shares thoughts on tactical training. What is it? How does he get results? And how does military fitness differ from typical training programs? No time for a warm up, let's get into the discussion!

item.title: Episode 280 IronRadio - Guest Melissa Traynor Topic Macho Muscle
item.description: After a bit of nutrition and industry news, the guys chat with Canadian physique competitor and trainer Melissa Traynor. Topics include the Canadian competitive hierarchy in fitness and bodybuilding, business influences, politics, and subjectivity in judging. And through it all, there remains that love of physique competition. Then, in the Topic of the Day, everyone discusses the trend toward high intensity training, all of the time. Does a camaraderie of self-abuse drive the trend? Is a frantic drive for high heart rates the best approach to quality training? And what are the mature alternatives? Take a breath, settle down, and tune in to find out!

item.title: Episode 279 IronRadio - Topic Favorite Lifting Techniques and Programs
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Phil share science news and industry news, then talk about their favorite lifting techniques of late. In science news, the guys cover vitamins, fish oils, and coffee naps. In industry news, the Mr. Olympia weekend gets discussion. Then, in the Topic of the Day, favorite training techniques and programs are on tap. Eccentric reps, potentiation, avoiding failure, neural plasticity, and frequency overload get attention. Also, do you fight reps or coast through a lockout? Do you condition yourself to fail? Are you optimizing your muscle protein synthesis windows? Tune in and get some insights. Future guests are also offered. Pull up a bench and get in on this!

item.title: Episode 278 IronRadio - Topic What Makes a Guru
item.description: Coach Stevens and Dr. L share industry and science news, then go after some of the slickest conmen in our industry. In the news, super-total events, very-high-protein diets, and a new healthy snack get attention. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys target nutrition and fitness gurus. What defines a guru? What's an advanced guru? What are they studying to take advantage of you? And why else are they a threat? Tune in and find out. Also covered are cults of personality, God complexes, fake universities, and reinventing established educational paths in one's own image. Tune in and defend yourself!

item.title: Episode 277 IronRadio - Topic News and Reviews
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Fortress cover all sorts of news, go off on tangents, and review weight gainers. In industry news, the death of a famous bodybuilder leads to discussion on career longevity. Where do YOU stand on burning out versus fading away? In science news, new fat loss studies shed light on traditional bodybuilding approaches. Are two meals better than six? Does building muscle inadvertently cause fat loss? And if so, when? Then, in the Topic of the Day, the purchase of a weight gainer powder leads to an invesigation and review of what's actually in them. Can the same product vary depending on where it's sold? Are you paying forty bucks for a tub of cheap sugar? And what's good about mass gainers in general? Tune in and wise up!

item.title: Episode 276 IronRadio - Guest Ben Moore Topic Strongman, Powerlifting
item.description: First, Phil talks with large mammal Ben Moore on his success in both strongman and powerlifting. Topics range from the interplay between the sports, to peaking for a meet, to nutrition. Then after the break, join Lonnie and guest host Jon Mike for some gym talk. The guys cover conjugate training, using eccentric contractions for gains, and more. Want advice from both an elite competitor and a scientist-lifter? Join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 275 IronRadio - Guest Spencer Aiken Topic Meathead vs. Mainstream
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Phil share some news and talk with strength coach Spencer Aiken. Topics abound. Mosquitoes, lactate, highland games, statistics, injury rehab, education, competitors, moms, kids, motivation, and more! This episode wraps up Part III in a series of interviews with industry insiders. It's also sure to interest listeners who are trainers and coaches. Ditch the local radio drivel and join your like-minded brothers on Iron Radio. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 274 IronRadio - Guest Jeff McCarrell Topic Behind the Scenes at Supplement Companies
item.description: A guest co-host, an industry insider, and some extra Fortress make for one full episode. First, in the news, a whey protein product and carb dosing get attention by Drs. Lowery and Nelson. Then, come behind the scenes at bodybuilding supplement companies with guest Jeff McCarrell. If you've ever wondered how someone rises in the industry to become a powerhouse, this story is for you. Positives, negatives, and tales of all kinds are offered. Then it's time for the Enter the Fortress segment, in which Fortress shares his own tales of good, bad, and ugly. Pull up a bench and join the conversation!

item.title: Episode 273 IronRadio - Guest Bryan Krahn Topic Working in the Industry
item.description: Join the guys for an insider discussion about the bodybuilding-dietary-supplement-fitness industry. Blogger, editor, marketer Bryan Krahn shares highs, lows, and tales of working behind the scenes. Topics range from dietary supplement sales networks, to ghost writing, to rote formulaic articles, to the mininmal role of science that few realize. Also tune in for history and thoughts on prohormones, ephedrine, DNP, and more. Finally, join the guys in a new membership drive and score a t-shirt while supplies last. Got time? We've got audio! It's time again for your weekly dose of Iron.

item.title: Episode 272 IronRadio - Guest Bill Llewellyn Topic Anabolic Fats, Steroids
item.description: After sharing news on fatty acid supplements and Russian powerlifting, the guys talk with William Llewellyn. Two distinct topics get attention. Llewellyn is well-read on both dietary fats and anabolic steroids, and has a passion for sharing the information. As owner of the patent on arachidonic acid for muscle gain, Bill explains why simply eating lots of precursor vegetable oils won't dramatically increase this important fatty acid in your muscle cells. He then speculates on how arachidonic acid interacts with fish oils, inflammation, and muscle growth. As author of the Anabolics Reference Guide, Bill then shares facts and opinions on the effects and side effects of various types of drugs. Finally, in the Enter the Fortress segment, Rob rails against the latest pro bodybuilder-turned-supplement-purveyor. Brace yourself for a little profanity, a lot of blunt opinion, and an extra long episode!

item.title: Episode 271 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Chris Peters Topic Science for Lifters
item.description: This week the pendulum swings toward egghead rather than meathead. Or perhaps how to use your inner egghead to become a better meathead! After recent discussions on self-publishing and changing your game, in the weight room or at the table, the guys turn to an evidence expert. Dr. Chris Peters from Sense About Science and Ask for Evidence shares advice on topics relevant to the thinking man's lifter. What constitutes good evidence? Why is our community particularly vulnerable to being bamboozled? What questions should you ask when presented with a claim? Get answers and even check out the www.SenseAboutScience.org nutrition quiz to see if you can even detect a made-up diet from one that's actually marketed. Topics herein range from CLA to amino acids to genetically modified foods and more. Come on in and become a smarter fitness consumer!

item.title: Episode 270 IronRadio - Topic Gym Talk, Listener Mail
item.description: Grab some coffee and join the gym talk! Phil and Lonnie cover recent happenings in the fitness industry, then answer listener questions from email and Facebook. First, in the news, a USSF super-total event is coming up, Benedikt Magnusson relights the competitive fire, Dr. L shares insights from experimenting with training volume, and American Muscle is coming to Discovery Channel. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys cover varied topics such as personal training certifications, branched chain amino acids, abrupt and intense neural stimulation before a lift, and plenty more. It's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 269 IronRadio - Topic Defying the Mainstream
item.description: How extreme is your pursuit of muscle and strength? After some news on sleep that's especially pertinent to big guys, the testy trio explore the subcultures of bodybuilding and powerlifting. What sets us apart? What in particular is extreme enough to make mainstream folk cringe or scowl? Have you ever had an experience where your values clashed with family or co-worker opinions? Tune in to explore these questions and experience the usual gym talk!

item.title: Episode 268 IronRadio - Topic Self-publishing in Fitness
item.description: The guys take a closer look at self-publishing versus traditional publishing in the fitness world. Web sites, blogs, podcasts, and YouTube have changed the landscape forever - but is the brave new world better? First, Lonnie and Phil discuss the pros and cons of the evolution, then it's time to Enter the Fortress, as Lonnie gives Iron Radio's resident journalist a call for further insights. Tune-in for a slightly modified format, as the intrepid triune juggle schedules and resurrect a brand new version of Rob's old magazine column.

item.title: Episode 267 IronRadio - Guest JL Holdsworth Topic Lifter vs Coach
item.description: Dr. L and Phil have a talk with powerlifter and coach JL Holdsworth. From his origins and education, through injuries, to experiences at West Side, and now as owner of The Spot Athletics, JL shares a great personal tale. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys discuss being a lifter versus being a coach. What are the similarities and differences? How accomplished should a lifter be before coaching others? And is it a natural progression to move from competitor to coach? Find out! It's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 266 IronRadio - Guests Nelson, Casey, Van Wyk Topic ISSN Roundtable
item.description: In this special edition of Iron Radio, join Dr. Lowery, Dr. Nelson, Sean Casey and Korey Van Wyk as they discuss this week's ISSN meeting, on-site from Clearwater, Florida. The International Society of Sports Nutrition is a great place to learn the latest science and practice for those who can make the trip. For those who cannot, or for those who just like Cliff's notes summaries, there's Iron Radio! From ketogenic diets to ursolic acid supplements to phosphatidic acid, creatine and more, plenty gets discussed. Join the nerdy yet valuable discussion!

item.title: Episode 265 IronRadio - Guest Juliet Wendler Topic Training and Pregnancy
item.description: Dr. Lowery opens with some news, then passes the baton to Phil, who interviews Juliet Wendler. After some insights on her origin story and her life with Jim, she shares thoughts on training during and after pregnancy. Plenty of questions get answered. Why is pregnancy sometimes looked upon like a disease diagnosis - from an exercise standpoint? How hard did she push intensity in the gym while pregnant? Which feels better during pregnancy - lifting or cardio? How important are structured lifting and eating during this time of change? And finally, did she enjoy her female version of the power belly? Find out this week on Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 264 IronRadio - Guest Julia Ladewski Topic Loss of Motivation
item.description: Fortress and Lonnie have a chat with bodybuilder-powerlifter-coach-entrepreneur Julia Ladewski. Julia has put up some impressive lifts AND is stepping on stage as a physique competitor as this episode airs. After a bit of nutrition news on gluten and wheat sensitivity, then some chat about Julia's origin story, everyone discusses loss of motivation. What causes it? How can it be avoided? Does everyone feel it? Get answers. It's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 263 IronRadio - Guest Brandon Lilly Topic Cube Method
item.description: Join Phil and Lonnie as they have a straight forward talk with noted powerlifter Brandon Lilly. After a little news on protein, muscle recovery, and the new Iron Radio app, plenty gets answered. What's it like to emotionally deal with devastating injury? What's the Cube Method? And what does Brandon consider a mature, gradual strength progression? From early days in soccer, to times as a troubled youth, to indoctrination into hardcore lifting, to bouncing back from catastrophic injury, Brandon gets real. It's time to pull up a bench and get in on the conversation!

item.title: Episode 262 IronRadio - Topic Training Principles and Eating
item.description: Do classic training principles apply to eating, too? After some industry news and banter, Coach Stevens and Dr. L examine this question. From overload to specificity, from the reversibility principle to diminishing returns, tune in for facts and insights. The guys also cover the concept of individual differences in exercise and diet progress. Interestingly, the same realities that govern exercise progress seem to apply to diet and nutrition. If you've ever needed meaningful ways to view both training and eating, these principles should help. Join the discussion!

item.title: Episode 261 IronRadio - Guest Mike Williams Topic Lifting and Firefighting
item.description: After Iron Radio news, join the guys in a discussion on lifting and firefighting with Mike Williams. From initial fitness testing, to ongoing training, to nutrition and teamwork, there's plenty to talk about. After the mid-episode break, Mike asks questions of the hosts. The guys also cover planned upcoming guests, this summer's ISSN meeting, chronobiology and swing shifts, and plenty more. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 260 IronRadio - Topic Progressive Overload
item.description: It's time to discuss a classic training principle - overload. Any lifter, whether a bodybuilder, a powerlifter, or other, should consider the ways in which he or she will ask the body to do more than before. There are quite a few approaches! Without realistic, individualized, and planned overload, structures and systems just don't change. So, after the usual news, join the talkative trio as they cover both basic and more advanced ways to overload the body. Will you spin your wheels for years, injure yourself, or do it right? Size and strength await! NOTE: The guys have returned to Skype's Pamela recorder in this episode, so comment on our Facebook page with audio-related thoughts if you're so inclined.

item.title: Episode 259 IronRadio - Guests Eric Bernstein, Cory Krupp Topic Wellness Startups
item.description: Have you ever wondered about starting your own wellness business? Come with the guys directly into a working sports facility where entrepreneurs Eric Bernstein and Cory Krupp share frank tips on lean startups. These guys took athletics and bodybuilding interests and forged a business from them. From concept to commercialization, from legal needs to Kickstarter, there's plenty to learn. There's also news on probiotic products and info from blogs on avoiding pitfalls as you start your own wellness or nutrition business. Enjoy the information and honest talk!

item.title: Episode 258 IronRadio - Topic Sources of Inspiration
item.description: What gets you going before you train? After some news, the testy triumvirate delve into sources of inspiration. From music, to ambient sounds, to visuals of all kinds, and quotes, the guys talk motivators. Note - some of this may be loud. Of course, intrinsic motivation is a requirement, but there are also plenty of external things to draw from. Pull up a bench and get in on this inspirational talk. Conan! What is best in life?

item.title: Episode 257 IronRadio - Guest Host Jon Mike Topic Research Roundup
item.description: Guest host Jon Mike joins the guys to discuss recent research. This is not just a perusal of other scientists' work, but rather it's a discussion of direct data collection in the cohosts' labs themselves. Topics include manipulation of eccentric contractions, interval training versus steady state cardio for body composition enhancement, coffee and dehydration, the addition of beta alanine to caffeine before lifting, and gender differences in response to coffee. There's also listener questions and reviews to talk about. Finally, listen to the end of the show for a special message from Fortress!

item.title: Episode 256 IronRadio - Topic News, Speed Work
item.description: After a bunch of news, Dr. L and Phil compare notes regarding speed work. The science news covers the effect of protein versus carbs on fat breakdown prior to exercise, calorie restriction, and growing muscle in a dish. Then in the Topic of the Day, how does an exercise physiologist look at speed work? What does a coach do with it? Tune in to get complimentary perspectives. Whether you are a lifter with long arms, someone who needs an occasional respite from heavy weights, or you just want to learn how to manipulate reflexes to boost contraction strength, this episode is for you!

item.title: Episode 255 IronRadio - Guest Host Dani Shugart Topic After the Diet
item.description: Bodybuilders and physique athletes progressively diet more strictly in order to get on stage. But then what? Magazines and web sites focus so much on the front-end period of getting ripped that almost no one gives attention to the post-contest period. How does one return to normalcy? Join the guys, and gal, to discuss extreme diets, metabolic damage, psychology, re-feeds, and more. There's also cool science news on green tea in this episode. Come on in to travel there and back again.

item.title: Episode 254 IronRadio - Topic Changing Your Game
item.description: What does it take for you to change your training or eating? Do you follow the opinions of an authority figure? Do you wait for a consensus in the scientific literature? Or do you self-experiment? Dr. Lowery, Fortress and Phil talk about evidence-based practice. Even as creatures of habit, each lifter has standards by which he operates and forms conclusions. Also, in the news, get insider information on protein, insulin, and fat loss. There's lots to discuss, so come on in!

item.title: Episode 253 IronRadio - Guest Ed Coan Topic An Hour with the Myth, Himself
item.description: Join the guys in an hour-long conversation with arguably the greatest powerlifter of all time. Ed Coan, The Man, The Myth, shares thoughts on his origins, his numerous records, his favorite accomplishment, and on bodybuilding, on judging, and plenty more. At 50, Ed's methods still focus on simplicity, consistency and dogged determination. Tune in to hear how Ed picks his training loads, his current competitive and other goals, and other gold nuggets. It's time for an hour with Ed Coan!

item.title: Episode 252 IronRadio - Guest Alycia Israel Topic Physique Contest Prep
item.description: Dr. Lowery, Fortress and Phil share some sad news, then talk shop with figure competitor Alycia Israel. In the news, the legendary Larry Scott, our first Mr. Olympia, has passed away. After honoring this forefather of the sport, the guys get a female perspective regarding the crossover powerlifting-bodybuilding lifestyle. Alycia is a well-educated, sincere coach in her own right, who is just two weeks from stepping on stage as a figure competitor. Tune in to learn many tips about how women competently move from the offseason to the posing dais. There's so much to this!

item.title: Episode 251 IronRadio - Guest Mark Bell Topic Strength Magazines
item.description: Coach Stevens and Dr. L cover breaking news and talk with powerlifter-inventor-publisher Mark Bell. The purported risks of animal protein are back in the news, as are creepy new protein sources, and listener mail about old school gyms. Then after the break, Mark tells the guys about the ups and downs of running a strength and muscle magazine. He explains how he solicits articles and photos, how he maintains quality, and why paper mags will not die in a digital age. It's time to look behind the scenes with Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 250 IronRadio - Guest Holly Chapman Topic Listener Q and A
item.description: This week the guys offer news, a contest, and some feedback for listener-competitor Holly Chapman. In the news, testosterone injections, muscle memory, fructose, and current competitions get attention. For the landmark 250th episode, a contest gets put up on the Iron Radio Facebook page. And in the Q-and-A Topic of the Day, answers range from peri-workout nutrition, to spot reduction, to proper lifting form. Finally, who's playing with his mic? Help our beleaguered audio editor yell at the other co-hosts. It's time again to get caught up, win stuff, and join the discussion on Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 249 IronRadio - Guest Donnie Thompson Topics Mobility, Federations, Contests
item.description: Phil and Lonnie get in 30 minutes with world class powerlifter Donnie Thompson. Issues range from his monstrous 3000-pound total, to mobility and performance therapy, to getting -pretty- later in a career. Then Lonnie and Phil change gears and discuss how to choose federations and contests. Whether it's bodybuilding or powerlifting, there are a few things worth considering. From marketing and money for promoters, to inflated titles, to setting yourself up for success, there are plenty of tips. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 248 IronRadio - Guest Joe Schillero Topic Strength Workshop
item.description: Dr. L, Phil and Fortress share news and talk with powerlifter Joe Schillero. In the news, newly publicized side effects of testosterone gel and injections get coverage. Listener successes and new t-shirts from Phil get attention, too. Then the guys talk with Joe Schillero about all sorts of things. Get gold nuggets from the recent strength workshop Joe hosted in Ohio. Then join the conversation on how to become an effective coach, how raw and equipped lifting can be wed for best progress, and tons more. It's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 247 IronRadio - Parody Format Topic News, Mail
item.description: After threatening to do it for weeks, the guys finally move Iron Radio to its new morning show, mainstream format! The usual muscle industry news and listener mail get attention, of course, but now in the style that the mainstream media and fitness industry demand. Tune in as Polar Bear, The Pullmaster and Dr. Strong entertain and inform just like every other radio show does. PLUS, join the Titanic Trio in welcoming new sponsors, Swole-Tech and Forklift Sports. Forget the usual no-nonsense version of Iron Radio; it's time to wake up to the level of professionalism that apparently millions enjoy! Key words - joke, satire, mock, parody.

item.title: Episode 246 IronRadio - Topic Mail, News, Gym Talk, Strength Clinic
item.description: There's so much going on! The Mighty Fortress returns to field listener mail, discuss news, and engage in some gym talk. The show ranges though many topics, from size discrimination to success stories to new records and catastrophic injuries. But wait, there's more! Sunday, Sunday, Sunday! The LA FitExpo just took place, breakthroughs in stem cells are happening, and cheesy mainstream talk shows get attention. There's even a preview of the Akron Strength Seminar and Clinic. It's time again to grab a cup of joe and talk shop on Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 245 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Jose Antonio Topic Muscle Memory
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Coach Stevens field Facebook questions, then learn from Dr. Joey Antonio. In the Facebook world, questions involve favorite books, lifting belts, and protein dosing. Then, in the Topic of the Day, Dr. Antonio offers insights into one of the stem cell types in muscle tissue, and what these cells do for lifters. Is muscle memory real? What role do satellite cells play? What drugs, supplements, and other factors enhance satellite cell activity? Tune in for some permanent muscle gains!

item.title: Episode 244 IronRadio - Topic Flu Season Training
item.description: Phil and Dr. L talk about breaking news on testosterone and flu vaccines. The news then spills into the Topic of the Day, where the guys talk about flu season training in general. What do men have to consider when it comes to immunization and training? Which gyms are most risky when it comes to contracting influenza? And how does one decide when he or she is too sick to lift? There are also tips herein on avoiding overtraining this time of year and what nutritional supplements may actually help us fight viruses. Note: The audio on this episode is also a little sick, but the info. is valuable.

item.title: Episode 243 IronRadio - Guest Kelly Lowery Topic Psych Issues in Muscle Sports
item.description: Do you have to be a bit nutty to be a serious lifter? After promising to interview some psychology experts, the guys start close to home with Counselor Kelly Lowery. She's not only graduate-trained, but has been around (and lived with) bodybuilding for decades. Lots of questions and issues get addressed. Are elite athletes abnormal? Are they protected from mental disorders? What toll does chronic pain take, and why do lifters endure it while pressing on? What about aging and identity loss in long-time lifters? And what about the mania and subsequent depression that can be induced by anabolic steroids? Join in as the discussion turns to what counselors do to treat anxiety, depression, and other issues that many strength athletes face. Also get a list of cognitive errors (stinking thinking) that counselors help clients, including lifters, identify. Do YOU fall prey to any of these in your work with the iron?

item.title: Episode 242 IronRadio - Topic 2013 Review 2014 Predictions
item.description: Rob, Phil, and Lonnie look back and look ahead. What happened in science and in the fitness industry in the recent past? What do the guys think will happen in the near future? From confusing controversies on fish oils and vitamin D, to premature deaths occuring in the upper echelons of body building and strength sports, to stimulant abuse and lifting trends, there's plenty to chew on as usual. Whether you're a powerlifter, a bodybuilder, or a recreational lifter just looking for a recap and look forward, welcome to Iron Radio in 2014!

item.title: Episode 241 IronRadio - Topic Getting Big on the Cheap
item.description: Phil and Lonnie discuss some science news, Rob offers another CD review, then the guys talk about getting built cheaply. With Christmas over, Boxing Day upon us, and everybody feeling broke, economical eating and training sound attractive. The guys cover cheap sources of protein and quality fuels, ways to get OTC meds at a fraction of the cost, free and cheap ways to lift and do cardio, and more. Tune in and save a buck or two!

item.title: Episode 240 IronRadio - Guest Jake Sullivan Topic Highland Games, BONUS X-mas Segment
item.description: After some science news on a muscle mass breakthrough, Phil and Lonnie have a discussion with professional Highland Games competitor Jake Sullivan. Then, to cap it all off, Fortress and Lonnie field thematic Christmas questions from listeners. In the news, a real myostatin inhibitor has been awarded breakthrough recognition by the FDA. In the Topic of the Day, Jake tells the guys how he likes to train to maintain a balance between size and skill. And in the bonus X-mas segment, topics range from egg nog gains to anabolic steroids to gifts for gym employees. Enjoy this 90-minute Christmas mega-episode!

item.title: Episode 239 IronRadio - Guest Dani Shugart Topic Disordered Eating in Bodybuilding
item.description: After some news, Dani Shugart joins the guys for a discussion on dieting gone wrong. Dani is a physique competitor with personal experiences involving disordered eating. She has also published a brand new book on the topic. News topics range from ways to rebuild lost muscle tissue to a new record powerlifting total to huge guys who die young. Questions that get addressed in the Topic of the Day with Dani include... What is it about physique athletes that makes them prone to eating disorders? How do men and women tend to differ in relation to food? What types of eating disorders exist and how do they overlap? And how does one return to normalcy after months of strict target date dieting? If you've dieted hard or have loved ones who struggle with disordered eating, this extra-long show is for you.

item.title: Episode 238 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Dan Ogborn Topic Optimal Eccentric Training
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Coach Stevens share industry news on anabolic steroids, then learn from Dr. Dan Ogborn. First, what kinds of doses of performance enhancing drugs are professional level bodybuilders using nowadays? Then, Dan has a long list of credentials and works in some world famous muscle physiology labs, so the guys get some juicy information. Specifically this week, Dr. Ogborn has plenty to share on eccentric training (negatives). How valuable are supra-maximal lifts? Is extreme muscle soreness requisite for maxing-out protein synthesis? How do aging, inflammation, fish oils, ibuprofen, and antioxidants affect the muscle building process? Come on in and find out!

item.title: Episode 237 IronRadio - Topic Thanksgiving Grub and Gains
item.description: Let's eat! Dr. Lowery and Phil unsurprisingly focus on FOOD. From meat substitutes to perfectly cooking the actin and myosin proteins in your turkey, to cooking tips and favorite dishes, the guys bring plenty to the table. The untimely death of a top strongman is also in the news, as is an FDA issue concerning genetic testing for consumers. The Topic of the Day deals with following natural rhythms to make mass gains during winter months. With harvest time upon us, and food-focused holidays everywhere, it's time to get serious. Bon appetit!

item.title: Episode 236 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Dean Reeves Topic New Types of Soft Tissue Care, Repair
item.description: We all deal with inflammation and soft tissue damage during training. It can hurt progress. Is there a new way out? After some dietary supplement news, Phil and Dr. L learn about new kinds of injection therapy. Dean Reeves, MD, pain expert, and Associate Professor, shares his insights and experiences with prolotherapy and related treatments. With the growing buzz about these novel approaches to nerve, tendon, muscle, and cartilage repair, it's time to get it from the expert himself. Can simple dextrose, injected into a tendon or ligament, really regenerate tissue without scarring? And further, what nearly instantaneous results can reportedly be seen when nerves themselves are targeted? Tune in for your weekly injection of knowledge!
