item.title: Episode 235 IronRadio - Topic Music as a Motivator
item.description: Many changes occur in this episode of Iron Radio, but with your help, the aural goodness is still rocking! Bear with the audio level variations and mic pops as the guys get it down - and let everyone know what you think on the Iron Radio Facebook Page. Rob, occasionally absent nowadays, submits his first ever CD review from the Great White North. There is no escaping the Mighty Fortress! Dr. L covers some actual science about the interaction between musical stimuli and the nervous system, and Phil lays down some ways that he uses music at Strength Guild. Get in on the info., tips and suggestions. Lonnie and Phil also offer some of their own favorite bands and tunes. What's motivating them lately? Find out! Tune in for a discussion of all things music and metal!

item.title: Episode 234 IronRadio - Guest Jon Mike Topic Pre-workouts and Ergogenic Aids
item.description: Do you take supplements or stimulants before training? Which ones work? Doctoral Candidate Jon Mike joins the guys to discuss a large list of pre-workout ingredients, nutrients and drugs. Substances that get attention include caffeine, ephedrine, clenbuterol, synephrine, arginine, creatine, carnosine, bicarbonate, beta-alanine, ammonia smelling salts, and more. The focus is on the scientific evidence and the conversation sticks to products that are specifically used for performance boosts. Time for some sciencey and practical knowledge bombs!

item.title: Episode 233 IronRadio - Topic Peaking for Meets
item.description: This week has the guys swinging the pendulum back to straight up metal talk. Phil just had his big meet, that's been months in the making, and he shares his experiences. The Topic of the Day is a spin off of Coach Stevens' meet, and delves into peaking for events. There's plenty to ponder. What's the best time frame for a final peaking cycle? Are there simple tips and tricks for the final two days before a contest? What does the science say about burning out adrenalin receptors prematurely? There's also discussion on the trade off between feeling good orthopedically versus neurally, last minute goofball mistakes that some guys do to make up for poor preparation, and more. Grab a Monster energy drink and pull up a bench for some shop talk!

item.title: Episode 232 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Jeremy Fransen Topic Chicago Conference
item.description: Join a travel-weary Dr. Lowery as he interviews Professor Jeremy Fransen about the recent ASEP conference, and about research happening at his university. Before getting into too much science, Dr. Fransen shares his background and interests in competitive strongman events and in bodybuilding. Then listen for gold nuggets in the science that ensues. Topics include carb metabolism, inflammation, creatine, testosterone, multiple tips to acutely boost strength, intermittent fasting, and caffeine. This is a longer episode, despite the lack of sleep for both of these gentlemen, so enjoy!

item.title: Episode 231 IronRadio - Topic Mentors
item.description: Who were your mentors? What did they teach you? After some news, Dr. L, Phil, and Fortress talk about influences and guides that affected them. News topics range from controversy over ibuprofen as a strength booster, to high-glycemic carb concerns, to Fortress' public opinions on metal and bodybuilding, to Olympic lifters on the Biggest Loser show. Then, during the Topic of the Day, the guys wax philosophical about their own role models and mentors. The experience of disciplined instruction, the importance of multiple mentors, the power of music, and plenty more get attention. Join the conversation and think about who has influenced YOU!

item.title: Episode 230 IronRadio - Topic Training Talk
item.description: From the IronRadio.org Facebook Listener's Page comes a request for simple training talk. What are the guys up to in the gym? Coming at the topic from different points in the training cycle, Phil, Lonnie and Fortress share thoughts. What is Phil doing in the critical two weeks before a meet? How is Dr. Lowery dealing with the relative boredom of a conditioning phase? And what is Fortress, ever the training connoisseur, doing systematically in the gym? Topics range from last-minute stupid mistakes that all musclesport athletes make, to early morning lifts, to the notion of long-term brewing momentum. Also addressed are issues like redlining, misguided encouragement from muscle magazines, and even a dietary supplement warning. And don't forget the random pizza orders! Pull up a bench and get in on the gym talk!

item.title: Episode 229 IronRadio - Topic The Mr. Olympia
item.description: It's Fortress unleashed! This week IronRadio brings listeners over an hour of pure, unadulterated shop talk, largely thanks to Mr. Fortney. After some science news on the importance of brown adipose tissue for fat loss, the guys talk bodybuilding. Is the Mr. O in an identity crisis? Why? How do professional women's divisions decide what the heck they are looking for? And for that matter, is the newish men's physique category in a similar quandry? Then topics range from misguided multi-gram androgen use, to judging criteria, to the dirt that sometimes goes on behind the scenes. Physique enthusiasts rejoice! It's time again for Iron Radio.

item.title: Episode 228 IronRadio - Guest Dave Tate Topic What's Realistic?
item.description: Caution, potty mouth powerlifters at work. Phil and Lonnie talk to strength icon Dave Tate. From what's new with his business to his personal struggles with injuries and rehab, Dave pulls no punches. There are real lessons to be learned from these stories. Then, after the break, the guys all discuss the question, What's Realistic? The talk ranges all over. From supposedly healthy French fries, to various lifting regimes, to when it's time to change career goals, the discussion waxes philosophical. Come on in for your weekly dose of brains and brawn, with Dave Tate!

item.title: Episode 227 IronRadio - Guests Cotter and Nelson Topic Nutrition Science Meeting Granada Spain
item.description: In this special presentation of geekery, Dr. L has an on-site chat with Dr. Josh Cotter and Doc Candidate Mike Nelson. Get in on this preview of what's coming down the pipeline in nutrition, including insights from a bodybuilding and strength perspective. The International Congress on Nutrition is the world class Olympic Games of nutrition science, held but once every four years. Topics that get attention include how to best squash inflammation before it gets a hold on you, the chronobiology of eating and strength, genetically personalized nutrition, what happens to the body fat of men vs. women as they diet, gene doping, Spanish foods, and more. ...PS - All the audio backgrounds herein are real, on-sight sounds from the Congressos and surrounding local flavor. Bienvenidos!

item.title: Episode 226 IronRadio - Topic The Lost Episode
item.description: The Intrepid Triune is flung to the far reaches of the globe this week but the show must go on! Fortunately, execpt for a handful of regulars on the Iron Radio Facebook page, few have heard of an episode that was created, almost by accident, early this summer. When things looked darkest and the guys were sure the airwaves would go silent, Rob showed up and helped record what you are about to hear. Almost no one heard it, however, because somehow a second, full-lineup show got recorded that same week! But waste not, want not. Join Fortress and Lonnie in discussing a question that's close to all lifters' hearts - How much is too much? Enjoy!

item.title: Episode 225 IronRadio - Guest Jim Wendler Topic Listener Q and A
item.description: Caution, potty mouth powerlifters at work. Phil and Lonnie talk shop with Jim Wendler. From low-protein Chinese diets, to the rise of raw powerlifting and females in the sport, to testosterone replacement for younger guys, Jim lays down some blunt opinions. The conversation also ranges through the necessity of doping, middle-aged lifting, training economy, recovery, and tons more. Even Miley Cyrus and Syria get attention! Come on in and have a chat with Jim Wendler!

item.title: Episode 224 IronRadio - Guest Matt Vincent Topic Travel and Training, Competing
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Lonnie have a fun conversation with Highland Games champion Matt Vincent. Early in the episode, the guys debate and laugh about all kinds of news, then they talk about dealing with travel. As a world class competitor who also has to travel for his job, Matt has learned some great tips and keeps a positive outlook on this sometimes weary endeavor. From holding a real job, to learning from distant top gyms, to reveling in the loophole sports we all enjoy, there is good stuff in this show. Sprinkle-in some science on ergogenic mouth rinses and how broccoli may save your joints, and you've got the latest installation of Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 223 IronRadio - Topic Top Five Desert Island Must-Haves
item.description: Phil and Lonnie offer news on the dangers of tanning spray, how the nervous system adapts at the highest level to training, and the apparent prevalence of Bigorexia. A new 1210 lb squat record - that's not a typo - also gets scrutiny. Facts and opinions fly. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys discuss five things they couldn't live without if transported to a desert island. Bodybuilding stuff, powerlifting equipment, motivational resources and more get brought along. What would YOUR list include? Join in, island girls, for the usual science, sport, and banter!

item.title: Episode 222 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Jeff Stout Topic Preventing Muscle Loss
item.description: Fortress and Lonnie field thematic listener questions and learn from Dr. Jeff Stout. What do survival shows teach us about the importance of dietary protein? How long does a pre-mixed protein drink last in the fridge? Why do some clinicians differ from scientists when it comes to dispensing protein information? Then Dr. Stout shares research and facts on new lab techniques that assess muscle tissue growth, muscle memory, and how to prevent muscle loss at all ages. From youth and aging, to turning genes on and off, to HMB, to milk intake, there's lots to learn. Tune in and enhance your muscle quality!

item.title: Episode 221 IronRadio - Topic Health News, Current Events
item.description: The intrepid triune immediately launches into shop talk regarding health news and current events. There are usable tips to be had! Which longevity therapies work and which don't for lifters? Are you sabotaging your own sleep and thus training recovery? What's the public saying about scary meat heads who lift weights and brandish guns? Get in on the banter. Also, what does surprising new research say about our beloved red meat? Also,can you really swell your biceps girth nine-fold? Would you WANT to?! Finally, what do the guys think about the much-promulgated comeback of Jay Cutler? Time to get an Iron view of recent goings-on.

item.title: Episode 220 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Abbie Smith-Ryan Topic High-Intensity Interval Training
item.description: The Summer of Iron Women continues. Dr. L and Coach Stevens do the usual news reporting, then learn about high-intensity interval training (HIIT) from Dr. Abbie Smith-Ryan. Should you consider a course of vitamin D supplementation before embarking on a period of hard training? Is there a ceiling dose of vitamin D, after which muscular benefits cease? And what are listeners saying and getting out of Iron Radio? Then, after the break, Dr. Smith-Ryan talks about aerobic conditioning, fat loss, and why she's converting from endless cardio to more intense pursuits. Abbie shares programming info for starting and progressing HIIT, what it does so efficiently for physiques, and even her own research on the topic! Join in for the usual shop talk and geekery.

item.title: Episode 219 IronRadio - Topic Supplement Controversies, Jr. Olympics
item.description: Summer colds and jet lag not withstanding, Phil and Lonnie cover dietary supplement controversies in the news, then chat about Phil's trip to the Jr. Olympics. There's also stats on fast food intake, a little education on the shocking thermogenic chemical dinitrophenol, or DNP, and talk about over-the-counter designer steroids. Get in on the shop talk! Where do YOU stand on specialty supplements? How much fast food do you eat weekly? And do you think cup stacking is a productive sport? From consumer education to an open invitation to listeners regarding the Jr. Olympics, your weekly dose of Iron is upon you!

item.title: Episode 218 IronRadio - Guest Christine Bongiovanni Topic Bodybuilding Contest Prep
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil offer news before talking to IFBB pro bodybuilder Christine Bongiovanni. First, cool new science gets attention. What vitamins and minerals have now been shown to offer most benefit from pre-post workout timing? What surprising new method of caffeine and carb administration could make you more powerful within mere seconds? And how is body mass index once again getting confused and abused? Then, during the Topic of the Day with Christine, how does a pro get clients ready for bodybuilding competition? From total weeks in prep to individualized fat loss strategies to final week water balance tweaks, Chris shares juicy info. And at the end, despite trying to table the discussion, posing mistakes get some discussion as well. Prepare for another episode of Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 217 IronRadio - Guest Sean Casey Topic Prolotherapy
item.description: Lonnie and Phil share controversial news before talking to dietitian and strength coach Sean Casey. From free speech to whole grains to creatine foolishness, plenty gets attention. Then, Sean shares personal experience and a brief literature review on prolotherapy. What is it? Is it a legitimate alternative to surgery? Which athletes and even specific joints or tissues might benefit most? And being fair, what about real-deal effectiveness, side effects and cost? The guys take a critical eye; this is not a sales pitch. Tune in for the usual straight talk!

item.title: Episode 216 IronRadio - Topic Technology vs the Essence of Muscle Sports
item.description: Phil and Dr. L share a little news then philosophize about technology and the essence of strength sports. From misleading food marketing trends, to the recipe for anabolic brownies, to the use of dextrose as a post-workout fuel, the usual news and science get attention. Then, what is technology doing to the essence of bodybuilding and powerlifting? Are strength lifestyles irrevocably changed? Have our sports splintered into new entities? And what do you do to stay positive as gear, drugs and other ergogenic aids pervade your training? Time to get deep!

item.title: Episode 215 IronRadio - Guests Dr. Josh Cotter, Mike Nelson Topic Summer Science Conferences
item.description: Lonnie and Phil find out what muscle science has been breaking at summer 2013 science meetings. Dr. Josh Cotter and soon-to-be Dr. Mike Nelson made the rounds at the International Society of Sports Nutrition meeting and the American College of Sports Medicine meeting. There's lots to learn. Can an athlete simply eat ATP to gain energy and performance? What's the verdict on HMB versus leucine as anabolic agents? What brand new supplement compounds are getting attention? Also learn about the role of good and bad bacteria in the body, brutal undulating training protocols, and more. Join in the geekery!

item.title: Episode 214 IronRadio - Guest K Meisel Topic Yoga and Muscle Sports
item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie share news and listener questions before learning from strength athlete and yoga instructor K Meisel. Topics abound. What's the strongest coffee in the world? How do you know if you have a muscle or tendon tear versus something else? How does the blood work of lifters differ from average people? Then, after the break, everyone discusses the relationships between flexibility, muscle control and strength sports. What are the pros and cons of combining yoga with powerlifting or strongman? Mrs. Meisel shares her expertise. From mind-in-the-muscle focus to getting too much of a good thing, plenty gets discussed. Tune in and see if you could use more balance in your lifestyle!

item.title: Episode 213 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Squat Fred Hatfield Topic History, Science, Themes
item.description: Phil, Dr. L and Fortress learn about the history, science and recurring themes in powerlifting and bodybuilding from the legendary Fred Hatfield. After discussing the demise of Musclemag International with the guys, Dr. Squat shares stories, scientific observations and an amazing insider view of the history of muscle sports. And the moniker Dr. Squat is not simply an informal distinction. This guy holds a doctorate in sports science-motor behavior and has worked first hand with the founding fathers of scientific strength training. All this still doesn't scratch the surface... Dr. Hatfield was one of the first guys to squat over 1,000 pounds (that's not a typo), launched major muscle magazines, and kicked butt in bodybuilding as well. What a priveledge to have this master on the program!

item.title: Episode 212 IronRadio - Topic Gym Talk, News, Listener Mail
item.description: Lonnie and Phil offer good old gym talk, then move on to news and listener mail. What training split does Dr. L prefer and why? What is Phil doing with sumo squats? And what's the powerlifting parallel to the classic adage mind-in-the-muscle? Later in the show, your ever-sensitive co-hosts discuss the mental anguish associated with gynocomastia, children's self esteem, and the struggles of self-denial lifestyles. If you like to hear about what the guys are doing under the bar, what the Iron Brotherhood is saying, and what events are being planned, this show is for you. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 211 IronRadio - Guest Host Mike Nelson Topic NorCal Lifting Seminar
item.description: First comes LIVE coverage of Coach Stevens' seminar in Northern California, in which the guys field questions from the audience. From Crossfit, to night shift eating, to which supplements are best for lifters, plenty gets answered. Topics also range from recovery for masters-level lifters to what to do when you're stuck on a progress plateau. It's like being on-site! Then, after the break, guest host Mike Nelson talks shop and recent health news with Dr. L. What mistake does the mainstream media make when it tries to teach us about energy balance and weight gain? What's the deal with beet root juice? And what does recent research on leucine and HMB suggest? Tune in for the usual bevy of experience, experiments, and hopefully some entertainment! ...Dosing correction mentioned in this episode... the research-supported leucine dose to enhance low-dose protein to full effectiveness is just 2.1-2.5g! This is going to make anabolic brownies even more do-able!

item.title: Episode 210 IronRadio - Guest Jaya Dixit Topic Food-Fitness Photo Blogging
item.description: Have you ever salivated over online food pics? Or tried a meal based on one? Or even posted photos yourself? This week Dr. L gets behind-the-scenes facts on food and fitness photo blogging from Master's-prepared sociologist Jaya Dixt. Not only does Jaya have a considerable athletic and lifting background, she also understands the social implications of online photo blogging better than most. What's really behind these photos and how do they affect us? What does a seemingly simple online food or physique pic say about the author or photographer? Get fresh insight! Also in this episode, learn why size matters regarding whey protien, what different overfeeding strategies do to your metabolism, and how to get involved with Dr. L's anabolic brownie beta test. Thanks for listening!

item.title: Episode 209 IronRadio - Guest John Davies Topic The Fitness Industry
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob get an earful from irrepressible fitness veteran John Davies. Theories, facts, and questions fly. When did marketing supplant the best parts of training, namely quality of life and community? Why does fitness culture change so quickly these days? What's wrong with thinking, skepticism, and sobriety in today's market? This episode is not just for you curmudgeons. It's time to reflect and reconnect with your passion for the game - without feeling the need for a Like button!

item.title: Episode 208 IronRadio - Topic Canadian Seminar
item.description: Special event coverage... Coach Stevens covers a wide range of audience comments at yesterday's strength and fitness seminar in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Meanwhile, from Iron Radio Recording Studio Number 1 (i.e. Lonnie's home office), commentary on nutrition topics gets interspersed. From the most practical whole food choices, to specialty supplements, to training strategies, to successful weight gain, tons of questions get answered. Don't miss this episode; it's like being there!

item.title: Episode 207 IronRadio - Topic News, New Guests, Gym Talk
item.description: Lonnie and Phil share lots of news, info. on upcoming guests, and good old fashioned gym talk. From Dr. Fred Hatfield to an IFBB pro to some fascinating experts in other areas of interest, there's plenty in the May-June lineup! Then... Interested in caffeine? Coffee? Creatine? Learn about one of the lingering controversies regarding how these things interact. There's also talk on maximal protein dose in a meal, getting the best results from biceps tendon surgery, and what plain old milk does to your insulin sensitivity. After the break, the discussion turns to what the diverse duo is doing in the gym. Low-volume, high-frequency, fasting, cookie binges - are they really this varied? And why? Tune in to help choose what YOU will be doing in the gym this summer!

item.title: Episode 206 IronRadio - Topic Brands We Like
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Phil talk news and brands. From artificial organs to gene doping to protein spreads for maximal muscle growth, there's plenty of the usual science. Then Phil shares some lifting progress and the guys move to the day's topic. What brands of gym equipment, gear, clothes, supplements and foods do the guys prefer? What apps and web sites are giving away free stuff that's worth it? If you are interested in good free podcast apps, the crowd-funding craze, nutrition science news, national fitness statistics, free meditation audio, or tracking your diet, this is one practical episode for you!

item.title: Episode 205 IronRadio - Topic Meet Talk, News
item.description: Phil tells Rob and Lonnie about last week's power meet and explains behind-the-scenes facts on running competitions. Then everyone talks shop. Afterward, mid-show ads be damned... the guys move right to iTunes reviews, listener mail, and science news. Want details? From meet day mindset, to tips on running them smoothly, to mature strategies for contest day success, the tactical trio pontificates. Also, topics range from assessing your potential to whole-body training to red meat and low-carb diets. Join in this week for all things meet... and MEAT!!

item.title: Episode 204 IronRadio - Guest Host Jon Mike Topic Eccentric Training
item.description: The guys cover reader mail and news, then eccentric training as the day's topic. The conversation ranges all over the place. In bodybuilding, which is better - genetics or effort? What does gifted actually mean? In powerlifting, should lifters include walk-outs with super-heavy weights? And how do the guys feel about adolescent mass training and eating? Then, the talk turns to the brutal but effective nature of eccentric training. What are the pros and cons of incorporating negatives? What do they do to muscle tissue that's so interesting? And ultimately, how can we leverage them properly for massive strength and size? Unless you're too sore to reach for your computer, it's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 203 IronRadio - Guest Chad Waterbury Topic High-frequency Training II
item.description: After the news, Lonnie and Phil spend some more time with Chad Waterbury. Chad, a physiologist who focuses on neurology, is also a strength coach. This time, Chad discusses mechanisms behind HFT and answers devil's advocate questions on the approach. Check out www.hftmuscle.com for more. Also tune in for a spring contest, with new prizes. You will have a blast with this one! Lastly, get new science on body fat reduction and health enhancement from several angles; some of this will surprise you. It's time again for your favorite mix of news, science and all things iron!

item.title: Episode 202 IronRadio - Topic News, Outdoor Spring Lifting
item.description: Phil and Lonnie are all over the science and industry news, then get to the Topic of the Day. How does one overcome anabolic resistance? What do high protein breakfasts do for late-day indulgers? What new drug stance is Crossfit HQ taking that's controversial? Then, with warm weather approaching, it's time to get your arse outdoors! Tune in to hear tips and stories about what's so good about lifting in the sun! Think outside the box, grab some weights, and go claim a local scenic spot for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 201 IronRadio - Topic Vices in Bodybuilding and Strength Sports
item.description: Dr. L and Phil share the usual bevy of news, then talk vices - smoking and drinking in strength sports. First, the news... listeners and Iron Radio friends let the guys know they are competing, needing answers, and reading some science of their own. Also, the passing of two titans, Nasser El Sonbaty and Joe Weider, gets some discussion. Then, Phil and Lonnie give straight facts about what smoking and drinking do to - and for - bodybuilders and strength athletes. Why are competitive bodybuilders walking around smoking? What benefits could a stiff drink have for performance? Going beyond a just-say-no approach, the guys explain what they know from the science world and from training experiences. Don't miss these knowledge bombs and stories!

item.title: Episode 200 IronRadio - Topic Bodybuilding vs. Powerlifting Technique Differences
item.description: Episode 200!! Rob, Phil and Lonnie offer tons of news before getting to the Topic of the Day. From science news on coffee and probiotics, to upcoming power meets, to Jim Wendler's new web site, to some great listener mails, there's plenty to discuss. Then, what specific differences exist in the core lifts, as approached by a bodybuilder vs. a powerlifter? The guys discuss bench, squat, deadlift, and select accessory exercises. Going beyond the muscle-vs-movement focus, what aspects of each exercise are altered? And why? Tune in this week and celebrate four years of better Internet programming for all strength athletes!

item.title: Episode 199 IronRadio - Topic Spring Lifting Camp, Defining Goals
item.description: Phil and Lonnie do their usual thing, but in a unique way - from the floor of the Strength Guild facility. Iron Radio listeners become Iron Radio doers in this episode, joining the guys under the bar and on the podcast too. Find out what can be learned from some intensive coaching, shop talk, and a little lab science. Then, in the Topic of the Day, the guys talk about defining goals. How does one determine what he's good at? What's realistic? What choices and sacrifices must be made? The door to Spring lifting camp is open, all you need to do is come on in!

item.title: Episode 198 IronRadio - Guest Ken O'Neill 2 Topic Soviets, Untapped Potential
item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie rant, brag on listeners, answer listener mails, and chat again with Ken O'Neill. Why is Lonnie railing against science journalists? Who just kicked arse at the Arnold Weekend IPF event? What are the pros and cons of lifting belts? And, after the break, what did the Soviets explore with their athletes and what's lacking in our modern Western approach? Facts and opinions fly. Come listen to Ken's historical and behind-the-scenes commentary. It's time again for your weekly dose of information, discussion, and even a little barbarism. Conan, what is best in life?!

item.title: Episode 197 IronRadio - Topic Judging Subjectivity in Strength Sports
item.description: The guys share science news, popular media news, and industry news, followed by the Topic of the Day. From green coffee extracts to steroid hype to valuing extreme athletes of all kinds, facts and opinions fly. How well does green coffee help one lean out? What's the mechanism? And is the mass media once again dredging for a steroid connection to crime? Further, what does the scrawny look of competitive runners say - and NOT say - about them? Finally, after the mid-show break, the discussion turns to how strength sports are judged. From gray areas to apple-vs-orange comparisons to influencing a judge, observations and opinions are offered. Time to enter the discussion!

item.title: Episode 196 IronRadio - Guest Mike Walker Topic Transitioning to Olympic Lifting
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Fortress cover a wide variety of news, then talk with olympic Games hopeful Mike Walker. First, in Iron Brotherhood news, a listener comments on last week's popular but controversial show. Then, in industry news, the science vs. practice pendulum swings widely, prompting the guys to chime in. Finally, after sharing spanking new science on myostatin inhibitors, your hosts turn to Big Mike. How does Mike feel his background in Strongman has translated to Olympic lifting? How do the traditions and politics differ in his new sport? Further, what advice do Mike and Phil have regarding the learning curve of transitioning into the sport? And finally, what's up with the new documentary film that's chronicling Mike's Olympic quest? Learn the answers in this week's Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 195 IronRadio - Guest Ken ONeill Topic Mental-Spiritual-Social Influences on Physical Culture
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob get historical insights from physical culture insider Ken ONeill. A man close to greats like Frank Zane and Bill Pearl, Ken has a wealth of information and a unique perspective. Historical influences become present-day lessons as one talks to Ken. Many questions get answered. How did steroids affect the scene in the 60s? Were we right or wrong about them? How hybridized were physique athletes? Where did Buddhism come into play? And what social and financial drivers control much of what we think now days? Let's get some answers in this latest edition of Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 194 IronRadio - Topic News and Gym Talk Tangents
item.description: Fortress, Phil and Lonnie discuss science and power sport news before getting carried off in multiple unplanned directions. Indeed, the Topic of the Day gets postponed as the tangential trio talks about weight gain and loss, breakfast, little girls with near-900 pound powerlifting totals, and plenty more. What's the latest on the chronobiology of weight gain? What do the guys consider mature when it comes to exercise programming? And when the heck is the viking-esque weekend in which Lonnie and Phil will eat, lift and talk shop with a select few friends? Listen to find out!

item.title: Episode 193 IronRadio - Topic News, Crowded Gyms, Conditioning
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil share science news, community news, and gym talk before getting to a double Topic of the Day. The guys range from vasodilating drugs to overeating to why they tend to agree on most issues. And, importantly, what is the Iron Radio Weight Gain Challenge? Dare you commit? Finally, what do you do when your gym is overly packed this time of year? And how does one tailor his or her cardio choices? Join in and find out!

item.title: Episode 192 IronRadio - Topic A Call to Paul Carter, Powerlifting Federations
item.description: Caution - Powerlifter potty mouths. Phil fights through a rough phone connection to be our huckleberry. He calls powerlifting competitor Paul Carter and nothing is safe. From bacon to gym talk to the the good and bad in powerlifting federations, these guys give honest opinions. And tune in to hear early insights into their new federation!

item.title: Episode 191 IronRadio - Topic News, Programming for Leanness
item.description: Fortress and Dr. L cover science and industry news, then answer leanness questions. From red wine as an ergogenic aid to the "new" supplement phenibut to the state of modern muscle magazines, the guys rant. Are anti-doping researchers going overboard? What are magazines missing? And in the Topic of the Day, what are your choices when manipulating your leanness phase? Finally, is Lonnie mispronouncing the old Soviet drug, phen-i-byoot? Listen in and decide for yourself. Heck, you can even "whey in" on the Iron Radio Facebook page!

item.title: Episode 190 IronRadio - Guest Chad Waterbury Topic High-Frequency Training
item.description: Lonnie, Rob, and Phil talk training and neuromuscular function with Chad Waterbury. Chad is a guy who is using his neurology background to challenge convention regarding exercise programming for lifters. How much brutality is really necessary to adequately stimulate muscle growth? If less than a 60-minute workout is required, what does that mean for weekly frequency of lifting? Can we really hasten gains by briefly training a muscle group 4, 5 or 6 times per week? And how can this be done without frying yourself? Tune in to find out!

item.title: Episode 189 IronRadio - Topic Internet Fitness Forums
item.description: Phil and Lonnie jump right into gym talk, then follow it up with a discussion on Internet fitness forums. From golden rules on etiquette to the mine field awaiting consumers, there's plenty of brutally honest chat. Are large public forums really communities of individual consumers and experts offering valuable insights? Or are we being manipulated? Get facts and opinions from a couple of guys who have worked behind the scenes in this arena for years. Plus, tune in for topics ranging from Winston Churchill to high-rep sets to vomiting from your car door! Where else can you find such audio gold?

item.title: Episode 188 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Nick Burd Topic Maxing Muscle Protein Synthesis
item.description: Brace yourself for some Christmas knowledge bombs! Behind-the-scenes facts on muscle research are shared by Dr. Nicholas Burd. Dr. L gets first-hand insights from a guy who is responsible, at least in part, for much of our modern knowledge regarding muscular gains. Tune in for super-juicy topics such as the best per-kilogram dose of protein per meal, when time-under-tension goes bad, how to incorporate new research on the oft-misunderstood high-rep-sets approach, and why ibuprofen exerts mild anabolic effects over time. Dr. Burd even explains how to use - and NOT use - leucine! From isotope-enriched, freshly-butchered research cows to first-hand explanantions from the man doing the research himself, this episode could really surprise you! Enjoy the Christmasy science goodness!

item.title: Episode 187 IronRadio - Topic The 2012 Holiday Episode!
item.description: Despite audio gremlins and elves repeatedly messing with the audio, Phil, Lonnie and Rob press on with the show. As always, there's news and gym talk, plus holiday-specific product reviews and gift ideas. What kitchen gadgets does Dr. L find helpful during his preparation of copious amounts of food? What metal music is Fortress buying? What does Coach Stevens suggest for belts, sleeves, shoes and wraps? And - once the audio elves get properly shot down - the tannenbaum trio pontificates on topics from silicon-inflated biceps to pre-workout stimulant stacks. Grab a glass of egg nog and join in the festivities!

item.title: Episode 186 IronRadio - Topic How Fat Is Too Fat?
item.description: New show day and time! Join the guys now on Saturday nights. This extra-long episode has the guys sharing tech and science news, then getting to the always-intriguing Topic of the Day. What is science revealing about brown fat and calorie burning? What's bad about carrying extra body fat, beyond aesthetics? And what nutrients and supplements may be effective at helping out your "good" brown fat, given these new discoveries? Then thematically, the intrepid triune offers thoughts on what level of body fat is acceptable for offseason bodybuilders and powerlifters. Love both brains and brawn? It's high-time you joined the Iron Army! Come on in!

item.title: Episode 185 IronRadio - Topic News and Listener-generated Topics
item.description: The Mighty Fortress returns! Tune in for personal tips on maintaining your eating and training whilst relocating. Also, hear what Phil's up to, and what listeners are asking on our growing Facebook page. There's a menagerie of topics! From youth lifters to Black Friday competition benches to exploding teeth to curling shampoo bottles, the usual information and insanity ensues. Get in on the coaching, the chit-chat, and the good times!

item.title: Episode 184 IronRadio - Topic It's the Little Things You Treasure
item.description: Phil and Dr. L cover science news, both controversial and bogus, before getting to the thematic holiday topic. From unhealthy muscle building behaviors to staring at ta-tas, there's certainly enough here to spark your own Thanksgiving conversations. Also, what are the little things in your lifting lifestyle that you value most? The guys share some of their own thoughts. Plus, tune in for information on the real science behind positive thinking and gratitude, and even updates on the Iron Radio funds drive and Dr. L's Movember beard. Thank you for listening!

item.title: Episode 183 IronRadio - Topic Specificity vs Variety in the Gym
item.description: Dr. L and Phil discuss new science on cortisol and protein, then talk shop, then address the Topic of the Day. This week's Topic is a deeper and different dig into something the guys have alluded to in the past: The balance between specificty and variety in the gym. Which concept is more important? How do the guys balance the two and how does bodybuilding differ from powerlifting in this regard? Find out! Plus, tune-in for an update on Phil's gym expansion, how Dr. Lowery bounced back from a recent eight-pound loss, and why there's a bit of 'muscle monster' in us all.

item.title: Episode 182 IronRadio - Guest Marty Gallagher Topic Coaching the Greats
item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie sit-in with legendary powerlifting coach Marty Gallagher. Marty is author of the Purposeful Primitive and is THE man who has been right there with almost every powerlifting great as history was written. Join the guys for some awesome tales from Valhalla itself, and hear some critiques of the current era... How big were powerlifting crowds in the sport's heyday? How can everyone be a national champion these days? What can the younger guys do, now that human strength has seen its peak in Marty's eyes? Get in on these gold nuggets and some real wisdom on manhood in general.

item.title: Episode 181 IronRadio - Topic News, Freebies, Gym and Lab Talk
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Coach Stevens carry the torch in this one. The science news is about common substances that may protect and prolong testosterone in the body. The freebies are apps and online diet analysis tools that could save you hundreds in your quest to measure your intake. And the Topic of the Day involves good ol' gym talk from the guys, as well as some lab talk from Lonnie. If you want to know about bouncing back from weightroom injuries, or what Jim Wendler is doing in November, or how Dr. L is augmenting explosive muscular performance in the lab, TUNE IN for some Movember goodness!

item.title: Episode 180 IronRadio - Guest Jason Pegg Topic Three Mistakes
item.description: Caution, potty mouth powerlifters at work. Phil, Rob and Lonnie talk shop with popular powerlifting expert Jason Pegg. Jason's no nonsense beard-and-barbell approach is a breath of fresh air in an industry full of over-wrought muscle gurus. Get in on this GOLD - from how much bedroom slippers add to Jason's deadlift to what he's doing in Jim Wendler's garage. And in all seriousness, find out Jason's thoughts on raw vs. equipped lifts, which mistakes beginners and intermediates make, and more. There's fun and informative talk in this one, as well as listener reviews and spanking new science for female lifters.

item.title: Episode 179 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Darryn Willoughby Topic Muscle Discoveries
item.description: Dr. L, Phil, and a recovering Fortress talk science with Dr. Darryn Willoughby, a muscle physiologist, nutritionist, and cellular-molecular researcher. And not to be discounted, he is also a national caliber 250-pound bodybuilder! How's THAT for brains and brawn? Listen-in for some of the biggest - and actually simplest - scientific discoveries regarding muscle hypertrophy in recent years. From anabolic triggers to time under tension to the whey-vs-casein debate, there's good insight to be had! Also learn about the pros and cons of different kinds of research, how simple milk stacks up against engineered protein powders, and - wait for it - our Fall funds drive!

item.title: Episode 178 IronRadio - Topic Paid- vs Self-Programming
item.description: First, the guys bask in the glory of Phil's recent powerlifting success. Nice work, brother! Then, after kicking off the Fall 2012 funds drive, the Iron Brothers get to the Topic of the Day. Is it ever better to simply pay a lifting or dieting coach? Or should you always learn and tweak and gain experience on your own? Also, how have the guys changed their own programs over the years? From meager beginnings reading muscle mags and little booklets, to success in regional competitions, what has changed? And why? Learn from the mistakes! Plus, tune in for banter ranging from truly bizarre vegan gelatin, to how long whey protein drinks last, to Fortress' golden locks. Come on in!

item.title: Episode 177 IronRadio - Topic Environmental Estrogens, Listener Mail
item.description: Fortress and Dr. L share some scary physique-softening science news, and some Mr. Olympia discussion, followed by listener mail. Are we being conned by the governments of North America to be good little consumers and keep buying plastics? What risks do bisphenol-A and other plastics in the food supply bring to lifters? And what can be done? Also, listener mail topics range from softcore boutique gyms to avoiding tendon tears to the pros and cons of milk, and more. Finally, join us in sending aggressive Iron Radio thoughts and wishes to Big Phil as he once again enters the field of battle today!

item.title: Episode 176 IronRadio - Guest-host Mike Nelson Topic Recipes
item.description: Doctoral level researcher Mike Nelson joins the guys for discussions on vitamin D, recipes and food prep. Get in on spanking new research regarding what vitamin D can do for your testosterone concentrations AND your muscles. Types of vitamin D supplements and drugs, specific doses, half-lives and more get attention. Plus, the tips flow like beef stew as everyone talks FOOD. From pre-prep tips to starchy vehicles to ease the intake, the discussion gets interesting. The crew also discusses worst meal experiences - prepare yourself - and favorite recipes. This episode will keep you fed for weeks!

item.title: Episode 175 IronRadio - Topic How to Stay Small
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L cover news from listeners, Phil's seminar, and the world of science. Then in the Topic of the Day, the guys get cheeky with a special topic for very select listeners - How to Stay Small. If you're looking for real facts, great reviews, and some fun, this episode is for you. From turning genes on and off to cutting stress via dietary means, to outlandish reversed tips for getting big, it's time again for Iron Radio!

item.title: Episode 174 IronRadio - Topic Powerlifting to Bodybuilding Transitions
item.description: Fortress and Dr. L share controversial news from the supplement world and emails from listeners before getting to the Topic of the Day. Are stimulant geranium extracts now banned? What is new research suggesting about fish oils that has some authorities crying foul? And how do corporations sometimes fool consumers with science? Also, what can powerlifters expect when they transition to bodybuilding? Time to embrace the pump!

item.title: Episode 173 IronRadio - Guest Jamie Allan Topic Strongwoman-Bikini
item.description: After some listener mail, Phil, Lonnie and Fortress talk shop with Jamie Allan. Jamie is a pro bikini competitor with an unusual proclivity for strongwoman training. What does heavy strength training do for a bikini physique? And how do these ladies peak for contests considering their ripped-but-not-too-ripped physique rules? From Internet training gurus to powerlifting-bodybuilding transitions to painful SI joints, there's plenty of discussion as usual. Join the guys - and a gal!

item.title: Episode 172 IronRadio - Topic The Forgotten Posterior Chain Muscles
item.description: Which muscle group is on the verge of extinction? From cubical jobs to lifters who are always training t-shirt muscles, the world seems poised against the posterior chain. From thick hamstrings to a brutal and intimidating back capable of heroic feats, let's bring these muscles back to the limelight! Listen-in as powerlifters and bodybuilders alike tip their caps to real power. Also tune-in for some horrific powerlifting news, Crossfit squabbles, and new research on the calorie-is-a-calorie debate. Time to turn around and show your quality!

item.title: Episode 171 IronRadio - Guest Host Jon Mike Topic Training Through Life Challenges
item.description: Lonnie, Fortress and doc student Jon Mike review Expendables 2, wrap up the action hero contest, and share tips on training through life's challenges. From maximum body count flicks to GH use in actors to the single best tip for getting through life events, get in on this! New babies, new jobs, and significant others don't have to keep you from the war of the weights! There are also educational bits on the dose of fish oil that blunts cortisol, the truth behind adrenal fatigue and more!

item.title: Episode 170 IronRadio - Topic Questionable Studies, Pregnant Lifting
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L first question some recent studies, then discuss lifting while pregnant. You heard that right. Pregnant. Since Phil's recent and gender-defying pregnancy, the guys have renewed interest. - All kidding aside, this show covers issues from anabolic steroids to jerks on Internet forums to the story of eggs and health. And in the Topic of the Day, there's hard-to-find legitimate info. on lifting and pregnancy. Beware, a regular phone line affects audio quality this time. Fortress will deal harshly with any complaints.

item.title: Episode 169 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail, Olympic Muscle
item.description: Fortress, Phil and Dr. Lowery continue answering a wave of listener mail, then talk Olympic Games. What's the best way to buy and dose your fish oil? What are some pros and cons of ibuprofen at various doses for lifters? Also, how does one incorporate overhead pressing, and how should a bodybuilder transition from bulking to a cutting diet? Finally, in the Topic of the Day, the guys marvel at the specialization and toughness of Olympic lifters and throwers. There's so much education in this episode you'll be a doctor by the end!

item.title: Episode 168 IronRadio - Topic Living Large
item.description: What are the gripes, oddities and experiences of living with excess muscle mass? The guys discuss living large - literally. From broken toilet seats to poorly fitting clothes to chafed thighs, it's likely you'll identify with some of this! Join in for a laugh. Also tune in for listener mail on fascial release, protein types, and regular bowel movements - yes really.

item.title: Episode 167 IronRadio - Guest Adriane Wilson Topic Lift and Throw
item.description: After some news on cortisol and weight loss, the guys share some reader mail and chat with lifter-thrower-awesome-athlete Adriane Wilson. As usual there is a wide range of iron goodness. Is cortisol really the villain we think it is? Is it cocky to be proud of your robust health and functionality as a lifter? And when it comes to lifting for Highland Games, what needs to be done before big gym lifts take place? And how much time should be spent on the sport's skills versus gym lifts? Tune in for these gems and more!

item.title: Episode 166 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail, Training Update
item.description: Rob and Phil dive into a host of listener emails - thanks everybody - and talk about their experiences in the gym of late. What body type are YOU? Is body-typing even real science? Also, how is it possible to lose roughly half of one's strength in just two weeks? Then during training discussion, find out what's getting Phil excited about squatting lately and why the guys have been favoring three-days-per-week regimes. From physiology to psychology to an analysis of classic powerlifting approaches, this episode has plenty going on!

item.title: Episode 165 IronRadio - Topic News, Rants, Recent Training
item.description: Rob, Phil and Lonnie answer a reader question and offer a quick rant before progressing to the Topic of the Day. Are dips good, bad or just ugly? Why do the guys think Americans are broken? And what is the tremendous triune doing in the gym lately? From warm ups in the heat to self-experimentation, hear what's been happening! Plus, stay to the end of the show for random gym music suggestions! Rock on!

item.title: Episode 164 IronRadio - Guest Dan John Topic Coach Responsibilities
item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie once again sit and talk with industry veteran Danny John. After offering a contest announcement, some news on what drives women crazy, and facts on what weird protein may help you recover, the intrepid trio learns from Big Dan. What are the core responsibilities of a teacher? A coach? What does a veteran coach like Dan do to create peer support in his gym? Tune in for the wisdom!

item.title: Episode 163 IronRadio - Guest Mike Nelson Topic ISSN Conference
item.description: In an extra-long episode, Lonnie, Rob and Phil talk with doc student Mike Nelson. The focus is the International Society of Sports Nutrition (ISSN) conference but the usual menagerie of muscle is also here. Tune in to hear about Phil's whopping double-digit bench press, listener mail, insights from soon-to-be Dr. Nelson, and info. on the upcoming summer funds drive. Brief audio teasers from last weekend's ISSN meeting provide the seeds for much sciencey discussion. Geek out with the guys!

item.title: Episode 162 IronRadio - Topic Respect Your Brothers
item.description: Travel and tech glitches will not stop your hosts! Phil and Lonnie discuss breaking news in sports nutrition, then remind each other that everyone in the iron game should respect his brothers.

item.title: Episode 161 IronRadio - Guest Joe Micela Topic Olympics Prep
item.description: Phil and Lonnie interview Olympic lifting coach Joe Micela, then the intrepid triune all share some gym talk. How do Olympic lifters in the U.S. get as far as the Olympic Games? What does a coach do in the final weeks to prepare them? And what are our chances in London? Get in on this behind-the-scenes info.! Also stick around for a rant on ignorance in the U.S. and some regular-guy gym talk on recent training.

item.title: Episode 160 IronRadio - Topic The Protein Episode
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L discuss science and training news before getting to all things protein. From genetic engineering, to stem cells to a new paper refuting high-protein diet risks, there's plenty to learn. The guys also check in on Phil's biceps blow-out and they offer cool learning resources on TV and online. The talk ranges from conspiracy theories to gurus to misguided protein practices on all sides. Join in by offering your own epic protein meal on our Facebook Listeners page! Win one of these sweet 100-dollar 2012 protein textbooks!

item.title: Episode 159 IronRadio - Topic When We Grow Up
item.description: Time for gym talk... and some soul searching. Phil, Rob and Lonnie discuss random topics and news, do a movie review, and get brutally honest in the Topic of the Day. From cannibalism to a new CDC report on the zombie apocalypse to careers involving muscle sports, surely there's something in all this discussion to get your attention. Very real career questions do indeed get answered. How have the guys incorporated their love of muscle into their varied careers? What's a waste of time? What surprisingly isn't? Is it better to be self-employed, go corporate, or be an academic? And how can YOU make choices true to your own path? Tune in for the goods.

item.title: Episode 158 IronRadio - Guest Dawn Anderson Topic Strength Research, Caffeine
item.description: Dr. Lowery, Rob and Phil discuss the new DMAA ban, then get details on other stimulants like caffeine from guest Dr. Dawn Anderson. Dr. A is a role model for female bodybuilders and academic geeks alike. Tune in for her story and learn from her in the Topic of the Day. From differences among "physically active" research subjects to caffeine, to gender issues and more, this conversation is a great one for both male and female listeners. Join in and learn!

item.title: Episode 157 IronRadio - Guest Stan Efferding Topic Being a Strong Bodybuilder
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L share some recent iTunes comments, announce our home gym video contest winner, and then get to talk shop with Stan Efferding! How did the World's Strongest Bodybuilder get his start? What does he think about guys who are all show and no-go? And what does he consider some of his biggest accomplishments? You know you want to find out.

item.title: Episode 156 IronRadio - Guest Nick Tumminello Topic Hybrid Bodybuilding-Powerlifting
item.description: Dr. L, Fortress and Phil discuss the prevalence of powerlifting injuries, movement by movement, then share an amazing new treatment for herniated vertebral discs. Afterwards, super trainer Nick Tumminello shares his ideas on hybridizing bodybuilding and powerlifting. What can bodybuilding bring to powerlifters - and vice versa? How might one go about hybridizing our beloved sports? Tune in for the cross-bred goodies.

item.title: Episode 155 IronRadio - Guest Jordan Feigenbaum Topic Programs, What Matters
item.description: Rob, Phil and Dr. L offer some gym talk and education, then discuss training programs with Strength Coach, Biology and Premed student Justin Feigenbaum. Tune in for details on Phil's three-man deadlift battle, then dodge Skype echos to gleen info. from Justin and the guys on avoiding attachment to rep ranges or even the big three movements. Time to break out of old habits!

item.title: Episode 154 IronRadio - Topic Lexicon of Funny Bodybuilding Terms
item.description: The guys start with new science on leucine and muscle growth, couple that with a new product review (leucine peptides), then move on to reader mail and the Topic of the Day. Find out humorous terms for what each of the guys call various things in our sports... misguided scrawney dudes, imaginary lats, overly-juiced guys, saggy pecs - you name it, they've got a name for it! Join-in for a laugh!

item.title: Episode 153 IronRadio - Guest Adelfo Cerame Topic Overcoming Challenges
item.description: First the guys share nutrition, science, and industry news, then they talk shop with wheelchair bodybuilder Adelfo Cerame. From caffeine to bacon to the passing of a titan to making tough life choices, this episode runs the gamut. What kind of challenges do bodybuilders and powerlifters overcome just to engage in their sports? What's the payoff? And why do people outside these sports sometimes fail to recognize the obstacles we must overcome? Tune in for both fun and serious talk about the many ways we all must rise above ourselves.

item.title: Episode 152 IronRadio - Guests Rich Wallace, Nick Humfeld Topic Bodybuilding Diets: Methods to the Madness
item.description: After some news, Dr. L and Fortress talk to not one but TWO competitive in-the-trenches bodybuilders. These guys know the methods behind the madness of contest dieting. How long does it take to go from 20 percent fat to 3 percent? What's the over-arching strategy? Is a diet coach necessary? And what about weird tricks and secret weapons? (Hint: Chocolate cakes and posters on your walls may play a role.) If you are interested in muscularity, you REALLY want to hear how it's done from guys who are achieving it right now!

item.title: Episode 151 IronRadio - Topic CrossFit, Re-branding Fitness
item.description: Phil and Lonnie share some gym talk, then discuss CrossFit and other proprietary systems that re-brand long-established fitness concepts. Tune-in to hear about the ups and downs of Phil's meet last weekend, Dr. Lowery's new energy drink study, and what the guys think of CrossFit, Cybergenics, P90-X, Insanity, and other proprietary systems. What's good and bad about these companies and gurus re-branding resistance training? Do these protocols translate into better sports performance or bodybuilding or powerlifting PRs? Find out!

item.title: Episode 150 IronRadio - Topic Foods for Loss and Gain
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Fortress start with in-house news and a spring funds drive, then discuss time-honored foods for weight loss and gain. With Phil off at a meet in Cali (go brother!) the remaining not-so-dynamic duo fight through illness and saltiness to deliver the goods. What foods are in our Basic Foods List on Iron Radio.org? What's the latest science on typical bodybuilding foods like whey protein and brown rice? Is it ever advantageous to take-in a grease wheel and quart of pop? Tune in and get up to speed with us!

item.title: Episode 149 IronRadio - Guest Bob Cicherillo Topic Bodybuilding Gym Talk
item.description: Fortress finally lands us bodybuilding legend Bob Cicherillo. Come with the guys on an opus of bodybuilding topics and tales spanning four decades! From national competitions to contest prep to drugs to unapologetic finesse bodybuilding, it's all here! Join in the conversation! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 148 IronRadio - Topic Contest Likes and Dislikes
item.description: This episode is bodged together from the road... but here it is anyway! Lonnie, Phil and Fortress talk about what they like and dislike about bodybuilding and powerlifting competitions. What's good and bad regarding the current state of these events? And what would the guys include in their very own event? Tune in for brainstorming, opinions, AND a request for YOU to offer your input on our Iron Radio Listeners Facebook page! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 147 IronRadio - Topic Science News, BIG EATS
item.description: Lonnie and Fortress turn some training studies into gym talk, then get to reader mail and finally the Topic of the Day. Tune in to hear how maximum strength relates to your ability to do physical work. Also find out how many sets translate into maximum muscle protein synthesis. Then hear what listeners think of our shenanigans and what BIG EATS really are. Don't miss the tales of heroic and bizarre eating! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 146 IronRadio - Guest Vincent Dizenzo Topic Training with Injuries
item.description: Phil, Dr. L and Rob talk to Elite FTS powerlifter Vincent Dizenzo. After a serious back injury, instead of rolling over and giving up, Vincent changed gears to become a bench specialist. And he is now crazy strong at what used to be his worst lift! Tune in to hear how serious lifters should address injuries without worsening them. We also serve up fresh-from-the-oven research on vitamin D -AND- a big discount code for an upcoming book on protein for lifters. Don't miss it! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 145 IronRadio - Guest Randall Strossen Topic Milo Mag, Strength Sports
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L learn about the nearly 25 years of strength sports covered by Milo Magazine. Its originator, Dr. Randall Strossen has seen so much in-the-trenches action and so many behind the scenes developments in strength sports, we are fortunate to learn from him. From Olympic lifting to grip contests to Highland Games to Strongman and more, join us and learn! Also on tap are a couple of cool studies on protein from guest host Mike Nelson. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 144 IronRadio - Guest Bill Piche Topic Grip Strength
item.description: Fortress, Phil and Dr. L do the usual news bits from the worlds of science and the Iron Radio brotherhood, then it's on to the topic of the day. From big eats to genetically engineered meat to monster grip strength, there's plenty in this episode! What are examples of crushing grip strength? What's even in the good category? How should one go about training grip for bodybuilding and powerlifting? Lose the wrist straps and join us! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 143 IronRadio - Topic Extreme Aspects of Muscle Sports
item.description: Lonnie, Fortress and Phil share some listener news and industry news before getting to the topic of the day. What are the extreme aspects of our sport? And why can most guys no longer appreciate what's extreme? What IS extreme, from body parts of the best bodybuilders to stupid-crazy lifts to horrific injuries caught on film? Get in on the conversation! This is one of the longest episodes we've recorded... and there's even bloopers for those who listen until the very end. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 142 IronRadio - Guest Clay Hyght Topic Chiropractic for Lifters
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Rob delve into some fresh iTunes reviews and listener emails, then talk to Chiropractor Clay Hyght. After sharing his unlikely transition from BMX racing to bodybuilding competitions, Clay switches gears and talks shop about legitimate chiropractic. What role does chiropractic play in exercise programming and nutrition prescription? Do chiropractors ever drift into flakey practices? And how do the good, bad and ugly of the field affect lifters like us? Tune in and get the truth! Plus, you don't want to miss the appearance of the Night Rider, OR our new British secretary, who assists us with this episode. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 141 IronRadio - Guest Paul Carter Topic 80-10-10 Training Rule
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk with national-level powerlifter Paul Carter about his athletic background, about his strong-as-hell training partners, and about his blog and writing for Elite FTS. Then it's on to news and the Topic of the Day. During the news, Phil and Dr. L discuss a new sleep monitoring device, and the significant discount on Olympic bars we are offering. (No, we don't profit from this. We're just cool like that.) Then Paul explains his 80-10-10 rule in which - following the law of averages - most workouts are sort of B-quality but are still of great worth. Time to listen, learn, and lift! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 140 IronRadio - Topic Two Paths to Hugeness
item.description: It's bodybuilding vs. powerlifting... or is it? Lonnie, Phil and Fortress cover reader mail and industry news, then Dr. L kicks off the Topic of the Day with a spanking new 2012 study. It covers muscular time under tension with lighter loads and it begs the question... Which is better? To get strong and use that strength to grow large -OR- to annihilate muscle tissue with techniques other than powerlifting? Here's what's in the episode overall - win stuff in our new iTunes voter drive, get facts and opinion on mouthpieces and cortisol, learn how many calories it really costs to build a pound of muscle, and explore a host of intensity techniques as an alternative to straight-up power training. Time to listen, learn, and lift! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 139 IronRadio - Topic Fixing Novice Mistakes
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Fortress first share news and reader mail. What's new from the worlds of science, coaching and Iron Radio proper? More than a few things as usual. From herbal stimulants to last weekend's NSCA Coaches Conference to our frequent juicy give-aways, there's good stuff to be had. Then it's on to the topic of the day. What are common mistakes that beginner or even intermediate lifters make? And perhaps more importantly, how can we address them? The guys cover programming, expectations, specific techniques, and tons more. Time to listen, learn, and lift! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 138 IronRadio - Topic What Motivates You
item.description: Neither illness nor holiday travel can hold back your hosts. After some highway-mobile training talk and contest anouncements, the guys discuss motivation. What motivates YOU? Are you a lone warrior or team lifter? And what is it that underlies your fire to train? Tune and and get introspective! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 137 IronRadio - Topic Training Time of Day
item.description: When do YOU lift? Rob, Phil and Lonnie discuss the pros and cons of training in the morning, afternoon or evening. Could this choice be the reason you're on a progress plateau? What are the pros and cons? And what can you do if you'd like to try lifting early such as before work? Tips lie herein like presents waiting to be opened. Tune in for this mid-holiday-break discussion! And speaking of presents, score yourself a high-end olympic bar - yes, really - by entering our New Year's photo contest! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 136 IronRadio - Topic Defining Your Training Status
item.description: Rob, Lonnie and Phil share tons of news, reader mail and our fall contest winners. Actually, the quotes that were submitted in our contest and the bodybuilding industry news contrast each other to some extent. Manly quotes vs. not-so-manly news. Once the guys have covered the latest bodybuilding mags and industry nonsense, they delve into the Topic of the Day. How does one define whether he's a beginner, intermediate or advanced lifter? Check out these indicators so you can assess your training status. It's time to place yourself on the progress timeline! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 135 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Bill Ebben Topic Strength Science
item.description: Talking with noted strength researcher Dr. Bill Ebben, Lonnie, Rob and Phil learn about recent findings and how to use them to steer your training. How important are concepts like neuromuscular potentiation? Can a mouthpiece or other simple techniques really add a few percent to your lifts? What about periodization - what does science say about that? And in the Topic of the Day, what should we be looking out for regarding bad advice from gurus? How can we filter out the BS and use science to steer our training? Tune in and find out! Lonnie actually takes notes (go figure). ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 134 IronRadio - Topic Busting Plateaus
item.description: Dr. L, Fortress and Phil (Sexy Santa) offer information on how to bust through progress plateaus. It CAN be done! First Lonnie offers a caffeine-fueled sermon on the many variables involved, then everyone talks shop. What causes a training plateau? Are you sure you're even on one? If you are, what can you do when frustrated? Tune in for some friendly reminders and a little education. Awareness is the key. Also listen for some gold nuggets such as a man-food recipe, Beardfest 2012, listener comments and more. Lastly, please DO NOT look at Phil Stevens' Facebook page or risk scarring your retinas with a 280 lb. nude steroidal Santa. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 133 IronRadio - Guest Jim Wendler Topic Raw vs Equipped Lifting
item.description: Warning: Potty-mouth guest. (Yes, YOU, Jim.) Phil, Rob and Lonnie offer some community and science news, then they dig into the mind of Jim Wendler. Questions abound for Mr. No-nonsense. Which of the three powerlifts is most affected by equipment (shirts, wraps, and suits)? How do they feel different? Where should a novice start with suits and shirts? Should you train in equipment to handle bigger weights, thus increasing your raw lifts down the road? What about injuries? When can equipment help them, if ever? And finally, can Jim SWEAR any more? Tune in and find out! (This episode is not approved by Jesus.) ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 132 IronRadio - Topic Recovery Differences
item.description: Neither holidays nor travel can hold back the titanic trio! Lonnie, Phil, and Rob discuss how different strength sports, notably bodybuilding and powerlifting, differ in how they tax an athlete and how recovery takes place. From burnt central drive of the CNS to peripheral depletion, there are ways to bounce back realistically. And yet we all differ. Are YOU a dragster or an Indy car? Find out! Also, join in for some timely talk on big eats! And pay close atention to hear Rob's mellow tone; sounds like he's practicing what he preaches about staying low-key on off days. Tune in while you eat your third helping of turkey and potatoes! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 131 IronRadio - Topic Fear and Courage
item.description: Rob, Phil, and Lonnie share a bunch of Iron Radio listener comments and news, then they tangent-off onto a topic of fear and courage. Indeed, the original topic of the day gets postponed. Is an element of fear necessary when one faces hundreds of pounds of uncaring metal on the bar? And how do competitions, psychology, neurology and endocrinology combine to form the Cycle of Dominance? Can YOU step into this hallowed Cycle? Listen to find out. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 130 IronRadio - Topic The Psych-upisode
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob discuss the sacred... the pre- and mid-workout ritual. From music to garb to nutrition and caffeine, the guys share personal motivators. When does Phil know it's go time? What have Fortress and Lonnie long-eaten as a bizarre super secret pre-session ritual? What music makes Fortress want to gnaw his way through the gym door to reach some heavy weights? Get in on this! The guys also have guest competitors on the show and bribe listeners to get involved with double contest prizes. It's time to call-up your inner Viking or Highlander AND win stuff! Where else can you grow a beard by the end of the show from all the testosterone and adrenaline that's flowing... while you win free stuff? Dare to enter the gates of Valhalla! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 129 IronRadio - Topic Contest Tales, Lifting As Its Own End
item.description: Lonnie and Fortress have a very candid talk about what competing felt like for Rob after years away from the competitive scene. Have you ever wondered what it's like to pit yourself against other men - and more importantly, yourself? Will something awaken within you? Get a perspective! Also tune in for a meat pie recipe that's guaranteed to pack on mass this fall season - and - listen to the discussion on lifting for its own sake. Virtually all sports now employ lifting in various ways, but what about the purity of MASS and RAW STRENGTH as their own ends? Tune in and get back to your roots! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 128 IronRadio - Guest Paul Klinger Topic Doping Control
item.description: Lonnie and Phil talk with Paul Klinger, Director at Informed Choice.org about contaminated dietary supplements. How prevalent is contamination? What are the most common contaminants? Steroids? Stimulants? Should you even care if you're not in the NCAA or Olympics? And during the Topic of the Day, the guys talk with Paul about why bodybuilders and powerlifters get so much doping attention by the media. They also debate whether or not professional sports should even BE tested. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 127 IronRadio - Topic Listener Mail, Unhealthy Strength Sports II
item.description: Phil, Rob, and Lonnie share some very positive listener mail and news before getting to the topic of the day. It's time the full triumvirate weighed-in on the unhealthy side of strength sports. Rather than harp on drug use, the guys range all over the place discussing blood pressure, serum lipids, flexibility myths, inflammation and arthritis, among other stuff. How does one prevent or address these things? Tune in for the goods.***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 126 IronRadio - Topic Gym Talk, Unhealthy Strength Sports
item.description: Dr. Lowery and Fortress talk shop about his rapidly approaching powerlifting meet. If you've wondered what goes through the head of a competitor right before a competition, this will offer you insight. Fortress is friggin' strong for a clean and raw lifter but can he pull it together when under the microscope? Also, Dr. L shares some brand new news that may appear biased to some. It relates to how Strongman athletes are less healthy than runners. Are these size-impaired researchers prejudiced against our heftier ilk? ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 125 IronRadio - Topic Evolution of Strength in Sport
item.description: Phil and Fortress talk shop, Lonnie shares some breaking steroidal science news, and then Rob and Phil are on to the topic of the day. What's on tap... Fortress struggles to avoid getting kicked out of his gym, Phil plays water balloon, and Lonnie launches our fall contest. The day's topic questions how strong humans have REALLY become and what truly equals elite. If you're so big you break toilet seats, you'll be especially interested in this episode. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 124 IronRadio - Guest John Meadows Topic Preserve Muscle on a Diet
item.description: Dr. L, Fortress and Phil share a little athletic and scientific news, then interview top bodybuilder John Meadows. This guy is a real trooper and class act. In fact, John is fresh off the Mr. North America just a few weeks ago. After some initial history and more sharing of his current activities, Big John joins the topic of the day. How does a high-level competitor specifically approach contest dieting? How does one hold onto precious muscle mass as a diet drags on? How long should YOU diet, based on your starting point and physiological state? Tune in and get a competitor's eye view. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 123 IronRadio - Topic Polypharmacy in Muscle Sports
item.description: Dr. L, Fortress and Phil cover news from vikings to sperm banks to cloven skulls to Mr. Olympia results. Yes, they can stretch THAT far. Lonnie even shares some erudite info. on whether growth hormone or IGF-1 is the main mechanism behind modern 'beyond juice' muscle growth. Then the guys move on to the topic of the day - use of multiple drugs, especially growth hormone, in strength sports. Does something magical happen when a bodybuilder stacks androgens plus GH plus insulin and IGF-1? What are the consequences? How are high-tech bodybuilding careers lasting compared to the old juice-only days? Tune in and get both facts and opinions. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 122 IronRadio - Topic Planning Off Days
item.description: Rob, Phil and Lonnie talk about recent bodybuilding and nutrition news, then move on to the day's topic. Who's in the upcoming Mr. Olympia? How is the sport changing, including women's bodybuilding? Is it just about sex and money or is there some competitive purity left? Also, what's the FDA got planned regarding your supplements? And in the day's topic, how many days per week do YOU take off from the gym? And do you ever plan multiple days - even a week - off from training entirely? Could you even MAKE yourself do so? Listen in for some insight. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 121 IronRadio - Topic Misrepresentation in Bodybuilding, Powerlifting
item.description: Dr. L, Rob and Phil talk about recent training, nutrition, news and drugs. Fortress stuns even Phil and Lonnie with the dosages he's seen abused. The discussion then segues into the topic of the day - misrepresentation in bodybuilding and powerlifting. It happens all the time on the covers of magazines and in ads. A huge dude holds up a supplement bottle as he flexes his 24-inch pythons. Is it all greed and lies or just athletes on-contract trying to get ahead while avoiding inconvenient truths? How many times do the young or uninitiated try a product held up by a shredded behemoth, only to wonder why they can't achieve such awesomeness? Tune in for the behind the scenes chat. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 120 IronRadio - Guest Rockman Wylie Topic Raw Lifting
