item.description: Rob Fortress Fortney and Phil the Thrill Stevens interview Phillip Rockman Wylie. It's a veritable cornucopia of nicknames. Tune in and get a competitor's eye view of how raw powerlifing differs from conventional lifting. Are you man (or woman) enough to go RAW? ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 119 IronRadio - Topic Is Overtraining Real
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil lay down fact and opinion on whether or not overtraining in strength sports is a real phenomenon. Some trendy Internet gurus and coaches may have you believing it's not and that you're just a wus - that Olympic style three-a-days should be your ticket to bodybuilding hugeness. Then again, some guys you know may actually be wussies and use supposed overtraining as an excuse to do curls in the squat rack and spend all their time surfing Internet forums. What does it really take to overtrain? What are the symptoms? Can you train and adapt recovery ability itself over time?. Tune in and get the scoop. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 118 IronRadio - Guest Jim Hearon Topic Social Networks in Fitness
item.description: During a first tech-glitchy attempt at an on-site simulcast between podcasting and YouTube, Lonnie, Rob and Phil talk to gym owner Jim Hearon about the ups and downs of owning a real gym in the midst of trends and swinging economies. Is it better to go low-cost and high-volume or vice versa? How important are in-the-gym supplement sales these days? And to the point, how does a gym owner or trainer use modern marketing tools to get ahead of the 24-hour facilities in every corner of America? Should we be Tweeting, Facebooking or surfing forums to get our message out? And what's on the horizon with web 3.0? Tune in for some experienced - yet modernized - thoughts. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 117 IronRadio - Topic News and Gym Talk
item.description: Dr. L is on the road and calling in to Iron Radio Headquarters. The poor audio of his lame little cell phone and laptop are evident. The guys nonetheless share news on what they're up to, what new research says about different proteins' ability to jack metabolism, and whatever else comes to mind. The talk turns to powerlifting and the natural bodybuilders who have been coming out of the woodwork with some hefty claims of 700-plus deads and 400-plus bench presses. Are these relatively little bodybuilder dudes legit? Listen to what the guys have to say. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 116 IronRadio - Guest Rick Collins Topic Steroids and the Law
item.description: Lonnie, Fortress and Phil learn about steroids and the law from specialty lawyer Rick Collins. Brace yourself for some frank discussion on how the law compares and contrasts with true ethical principles, why politicians have special vitriol for anabolic steroid users (when booze and cigarettes are so rampant and destructive), and what documentaries and real surveys have to say about steroid use. Will anabolics make you fly into a rage and slap your grandma within seconds of ingestion? On the flip side, will they make a kid look jacked without effort or risks in a matter of mere weeks? What do Ben Affleck and Captain America have to do with all this? Tune in and find out as the guys get controversial. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 115 IronRadio - Guest Larry Brock Topic Highland Games
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Lonnie learn about Highland Games competitions from champion athlete Larry Brock. How do Highland Games differ from Strongman contests? How important is sheer body weight? Does skill or strength reign supreme? Grab a stout beer, tune in, and find out why kilts are truly man-garb. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 114 IronRadio - Guest Tamara Cohen Topic Female Lifters, Skewed Perceptions
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Lonnie talk to olympic lifter and mom Tamara Cohene. She gives insight and opinion on women in olympic lifting, which goals might serve women better than leanness, and how misguided the fitness industry has become. How does a 30-something mom reclaim her athletic body and sense of satisfaction? Should everyone try running to get back in shape first? What should be your first goal, man or woman, regarding competitions? Tune in and find out! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 113 IronRadio - Guest Tim Ziegenfuss Topic Fat Hormones, Supplements
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Fortress talk to exercise physiologist and sports supplement expert Dr. Tim Ziegenfuss. The chat ranges from new understandings of body fat's active role in metabolism to supplemental concentrates from curry powder, blueberries and more. Surprising pharmaceutical-like effects are being clarified. We learn and go behind the scenes. What does Tim's supplement lab do? What's his role with Biotest Laboratories? What's in HIS supplement cabinet? Tune in and find out! ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 112 IronRadio - Guest Dave Tate Topic Going Mental
item.description: Phil and Lonnie jump right into the topic of the day with kick-arse powerlifter Dave Tate. This guy is as smart as he is huge. What six factors determine training success? How much do the three mental factors matter? Find out! Also get in on the discussion as Dave goes Jedi with some Yoda-like advice to live by! Additional tidbits include how how Dave himself handles the pre-gym psych-up, how to transition between powerlifting and bodybuilding, and using caution with your training progressions. Sweet. Note, some potty mouth language ensues; kids please leave the room. ***PS IronRadio is now jointly airing on PRIMAL FM on Saturday nights; your radio is no longer safe. Rock on!***

item.title: Episode 111 IronRadio - Topic What's in Your Gymbag?
item.description: In the first half of the show, Lonnie, Rob and Phil talk shop on how to deal with injuries, then share athletic and industry news of all sorts. Who's sponsoring whom? Will we be eating bugs in our protein bars soon? Why is Phil going to get ripped? (Yes... Phil... ripped.) What juicy new knowledge got spilled at last weekend's sports nutrition (ISSN) meeting in Las Vegas? Find out! In the second half, the guys talk about what they take to the gym - and wonder what's in the Iron Radio listeners' gym bags as well. (What IS in your gym bag, anyway?) Plus, stick around after the show for brief select quotes and reporting direct from the ISSN event in Vegas. Our science-riddled post-show audio covers why meat rules, new ways to dose creatine, what beta-alanine is all about, what high-protein diets really do to us, and what supplements affect metabolic flexibility. Check out http://www.sportsnutritionsociety.org for so much more!

item.title: Episode 110 IronRadio - Guests Ellmers and Miller Topic Biology for Bodybuilders
item.description: After some brief news from the muscle world and from nutritional geekdom, Fortress and Dr. Lowery interview natural pro bodybuilder Doug Miller and his colleague and coathor Glen Ellmers. How does one go about writing a book on something as broad as biology for the bodybuilding audience? Considering genetic differences, how does a successful bodybuilder share his secrets in any useful way? What are these guys' suggestions for using biology to get huge and lean out? Find out! Plus tons more on choosing a natural league in which to compete, length and severity of contest dieting, and various training splits.

item.title: Episode 109 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Josh Cotter Topic Muscle Research, ACSM Event
item.description: Dr. L and Rob veer all over the place with news blurbs, then get an insider look at muscle research from a lab rat that studies ways to prevent muscle loss. Dr. Josh Cotter is not only a bodybuilder but a post-doctoral researcher in a NASA-related lab that looks at ways to reduce muscle atrophy, among other things we might borrow for our own ends. What's different about the soleus muscle of the calf and how does one best train it? What causes the muscle loss in space and how does it relate to bodybuilding or powerlifting? Find out! Also listen-in for fresh from the oven science updates on protein and vitamin D from the recent American College of Sports Medicine event!

item.title: Episode 108 IronRadio - Guest Karsten Jensen Topic Advanced Periodization
item.description: Fortress, Phil and Rock Solid share news on everything from new government nutrition recommendations to suffocation training to an upcoming Kansas City Highland Games event. Then the guys talk to Karsten Jensen, a Danish exercise physiologist and strength coach. What are the types of training periodization? How can YOU tweak them? What are advanced ways to make one of these systems almost guarantee your progress? Listen-in for both academic and no-BS pragmatic advice. You know you want to learn how to get huge from a Dane!

item.title: Episode 107 IronRadio - Topic Remotivate, Rest or Change Gears
item.description: Fortress, Phil and Dr. L share some news - both scientific and athletic in nature - then wax philosophical about the ebb and flow of training and competition. When do these guys make a pit stop for repairs? Do they drive forward with the initial goal no matter what? What can one do to stay motivated when in a training valley or slump? Tune in for controversial chat on drugs, politics, sexual ambiguity and more!

item.title: Episode 106 IronRadio - Guest Carl Gisler Topic Strength Equipment Scams
item.description: Phil, Fortress and Dr. L get the inside scoop on what salesmen do to sell cheesy strength and fitness equipment to a quick-fix public. What should you ask a sales person? What do they do when they know their product is bunk? We take you behind the scenes with the help of a sales insider! ***Finally, we'd like to continue a new section here in our feed notes - appreciation of deserving listeners. item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie talk to Coach John Davies about true functional training. How much do traditional weight room movements transfer into on-the-field performance? item.title: Episode 95 IronRadio - Guests Layne Norton and Ben Hartman Topic Natural Bodybuilding
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil catch up with natural pro bodybuilders Layne Norton and Ben Hartman, despite Skype's inability to obey our commands. item.title: Episode 94 IronRadio - Guest BILL PEARL Topic Perceptions of Bodybuilders
item.description: Anyone in the iron game should listen closely to this guest for their own sake. Rob, Phil and Lonnie talk with bodybuilding legend Bill Pearl, now 80 years old, about how society perceives bodybuilders, whether or not the opinions are correct, and how bodybuilders should handle themselves. Bill also touches on his master work - a book on strength and muscle building throughout human history. Bill, thank you sir, for being a hero to us all.

item.title: Episode 93 IronRadio - Topic The Iron Radio Sphincter Awards!
item.description: After some breaking news blurbs, Lonnie, Rob and Jon Mike nominate some of the least legitimate and cheesiest things in the fitness industry for Iron Radio Schincter Awards. What's the cheesiest advertisement we've seen or heard? Which dietary supplements or pieces of exercise equipment are laughable? What embarrassing events have happened in bodybuilding that are worthy of tounge-in-cheek derision? Tune in and find out!

item.title: Episode 92 IronRadio - Topic The Get-swole 72 Supplement Breakthrough!
item.description: Phil fills in for us all with a special insider scoop and interview! Jesse Burdick reveals juicy secrets behind the Get-swole 72 supplement breakthrough! Don't be afraid of gaining four inches on your guns in a few days.

item.title: Episode 9 Experiments vs Experience 2.0 What makes one competitive in powerlifting II
item.description: Rob (Fortress) and Lonnie answer a question specific to powerlifting... What exactly is competitive status? From performance classifications (Elite, Masters, Class I, II, III, IV) to drugs, to support gear, a ton of info. gets shared. Can YOU compete and break into one of these powerlifting categories? Can you go to the top of them without drugs OR gear? Time to get an idea. Opinions and science fly everywhere in this episode, as usual. ***THIS IS NOT THE FLAGSHIP IRON RADIO PODCAST, BUT A DIFFERENT SHOW THAT WILL SOMETIMES APPEAR***

item.title: Episode 91 IronRadio - Topic Training: Why do you do it?
item.description: After some breaking news blurbs, Lonnie, Rob and Phil spill the beans about their own origins and motivations. How and why did these salty dogs and veteran competitors become "lifers"? What moves someone from his or her initial exposure to lifting, toward fully embracing the lifestyle? There are some commonalities that you may identify with!

item.title: Episode 90 IronRadio - Topic Intangible Training Skills
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil talk about the hidden intangibles of training in the iron game. Questions abound! What are these skills? Can they help you determine when to push forward versus call it a day in the gym? Will they ever help you decide when to eat big, pick a competition date, or train around an injury? Can YOU develop these skills of bodily and psychological hyper-perception? Get these questions answered in a way that can't be found on the pages of a magazine or textbook. (We do not get hokey but instead try to explain with anecdotes and professional opinions.)

item.title: Episode 89 IronRadio - Guest Powerlifter Chad Aichs Topic Proper Form
item.description: Rob, Phil and Lonnie talk with champion powerlifter Chad Aichs. This dude is outrageously strong - 1000+ lb. squats, 800+ lb. bench presses and other insanity. How does he do it? Partly it's proper form - and he's not kidding when he says this. How do you get form like this giant powerhouse? Who do you turn to and who do you avoid? Listen and learn. Plus, we discuss how this relates to bodybuilding and regular gym goers who just want to be big and strong.

item.title: Episode 88 IronRadio - Guest Physicist John Keifer Topic Energy Balance
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Vegas-Phil talk with physicist-turned-physiologist John Keifer. He discusses his background and his diet books. Can you really get ripped gulping down doughnuts at night? How on earth would THAT happen? Find out if this approach to dieting is beautiful or bupkiss! Also tune in to learn the truth about how energy balance -calories in versus calories out- actually operates in the real world. This could answer why you're not gaining or losing as planned!

item.title: Episode 87 IronRadio - Guest Ian King Topic Ripped versus Fit versus Skinny
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk with Coach Ian King about his background, his thoughts on the fitness industry versus athletics and on the obsession with leanness and how it can be a problem in sports, including bodybuilding itself! How ripped should YOU be? Are the Americans leading the whole bloody world down the primrose path of abs-at-all-costs? Find out! Note: Please forgive the change in audio quality about minute 28; a Skype glitch altered the recording process but with Ian's help we emerged victorious!

item.title: Episode 86 IronRadio - Year-end review and look forward
item.description: Again on the road, we forge onward. Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk about compteting and about past and future guests as they do a year-end funds drive. In a sense we are like Public Radio; please help us stay on the air by going to www.IronRadio.org and clicking the DONATE button. And a big Holiday Thank You for helping us grow so much!

item.title: Episode 85 IronRadio - Guest Jesse Burdick Topic Drop Sets
item.description: We made it! This Holiday episode was patched together RAW and UNCUT on the road with a little netbook. Such is our mania. Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk to power athlete Jesse Burdick about drop sets, among other stuff. Then we do a year-end funds drive. In a sense we are like Public Radio; please help us stay on the air by going to www.IronRadio.org and clicking the DONATE button. And a big Holiday Thank You for helping us grow so much!

item.title: Episode 8 Experiments vs Experience 2.0 What makes one competitive level in strength sports
item.description: Jon Mike and Lonnie answer the question, What exactly equals competitive status in amateur powerlifting and strongman? Textbook science on physical strength norms from the average population get compared to more rigorous rules of thumb for competitors. Are YOU strong enough to compete? Find out! Also check out a new, second part of the show from Phil and Mark Bell on power sport events.***THIS IS NOT THE FLAGSHIP IRON RADIO PODCAST, BUT A DIFFERENT SHOW THAT WILL SOMETIMES APPEAR***

item.title: Episode 84 IronRadio - Guest John Schaeffer Topic Frequency Training
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob hear from Johnny -Pain- Schaeffer. He talks about his background, garage lifting, injuries, etc. Then there's some discussion on how much frequency and volume are really needed for rapid physical change. There's a difference between overtraining and just being a wus. ***NOTE: We are about to start our Winter Iron Radio fund raiser / donation drive. In a sense we are like Public Radio; please help us stay on the air by going to www.IronRadio.org and clicking the DONATE button. Thanks - fifty times!***

item.title: Episode 83 IronRadio - Guest Geoff Starling Topic Surgery Bounce-back
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk with one brave and positive dude - Geoff Starling. He's a trainer and professional coordinator of other trainers but also a man who's bounced back from some major surgeries. Feeling a little sorry for yourself for having been injured or ill? It's natural but you can also rise above it... like Geoff.

item.title: Episode 82 IronRadio - Guest Dan John Topic Gym Talk
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk shop with strength coach Danny John. Find out what prinicples make Dan such a popular - and successful - coach and speaker. For those few who don't know about Dan, now you will. This guy is the kind of authentic mentor and coach to whom we would like our own sons exposed. It's mostly just gym talk this time around but that's the point! Not everyone lives in a place where power sports and bodybuilding are popular enough to supply this kind of thing. Surrounding yourself with positive, informed gym buddies is as easy as downloading the show.

item.title: Episode 81 IronRadio - Guest Mark Bell Topic Starting a Power Mag
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk shop with powerlifter and new magazine editor Mark Bell. First he talks about his background and his new invention. Then we talk journalism in the strength world. How does a magazine begin? How does one get it distributed in big retail stores? Can powerlifting and bodybuilding coexist on its pages? Find out! Also, academically minded listeners should surf to Iron Radio.org and check out a NEW listener commentary by sociology grad student Jaya Dixit.

item.title: Episode 80 IronRadio - Guest Layne Norton Topic Leucine and Bodybuilding
item.description: This time, Lonnie, Phil and Rob talk to newly-minted PhD Layne Norton about his background in bodybuilding and his lab experiences with protein and the amino acid leucine. Listen-in for tips on how to use this protein-synthetic amino acid properly, right from the horse's mouth. Also, academically minded listeners should surf to Iron Radio.org and check out a NEW listener commentary by sociology grad student Jaya Dixit.

item.title: Episode 79 IronRadio - Guest David Whitley Topic Training Principles
item.description: NOTE - Audio quality is low this time but we are MOVING THIS SHOW TO SKYPE IN NOVEMBER. Tune in for far better audio quality as soon as we get Fortress to buy a mic headset. This time, Phil, Rob and Lonnie talk to strongman David Whitley about the history of strongmen and about training principles versus training methods. Also, academically minded listeners should surf to Iron Radio.org and check out a NEW listener commentary by sociology grad student Jaya Dixit.

item.title: Episode 78 IronRadio - Guest Chris Shugart Topic Pulse Fasting
item.description: Lonnie, Phil, and Fortress talk to T-Nation Editor Chris Shugart about his latest - and dramatic - take on near-fasting while preserving muscle mass. Is there a way to actually feel okay while eating almost nothing, all the while torching fat and leaving hard-won muscle alone? Listen to the conversation and you decide! Plus, listen to the announcement at the end of the show about our final week of the Most Intersting Contest in the World. Prizes like Iron Radio mugs and pricey nutrition textbooks could be yours. Finally, academically minded listeners should surf to Iron Radio.org and check out a NEW listener commentary by sociology grad student Jaya Dixit.

item.title: Episode 77 IronRadio - Guest Listener Call-in Topic Addressing Multiple Goals
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Fortress talk to an Iron Radio listener about addressing simultaneous fat loss and strength goals. Which takes precedence? Which comes first? Find out what we think about training, diet, personal approaches to goal setting, etc. There are also news blurbs about exercise and nutrition conferences and other online info.

item.title: Episode 76 IronRadio - Guest Mike Nelson Topic Metabolic Inflexibility
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Fortress talk to researcher and doctoral candidate Mike Nelson about how the body adapts toward carbohydrate versus fat usage. Is it best to metabolize both with equal ease? Diet and exercise methods for teaching the body to lean in one direction or the other get discussed. There are also news blurbs about exercise and nutrition conferences and other online info.

item.title: Episode 75 IronRadio - Topic News and Announcements
item.description: Iron Radio is brief this week but we weren't about to serve up nothing on our 75th episode. Listen in for news and announcements ranging from competitions to business to upcoming meetings to research on caffeine.

item.title: Episode 74b IronRadio - Topic Mr. Olympia Coverage
item.description: Iron Radio this week comes to you on SATURDAY, live from the Mr. Olympia weekend in Las Vegas with special guest and industry scientist, David Barr. The live reporting and conversation range from behind-the-scenes info. from the strongman scene to bodybuilding to supplements to various vendors and after-hours parties. The episode will be published on iTunes and Podcast Alley, as always, following the live show.

item.title: Episode 74a IronRadio - Topic Mr. Olympia Coverage Announcement
item.description: Dr. L simply announces that Iron Radio this week will not be Thursday but SATURDAY, live from the Mr. Olympia weekend in Las Vegas. Tune in via our live call (see our Facebook page for details) Saturday, Sept. 25 at 4:00 PM Eastern Time. Phil will be reporting and should have a few guests as well as updates on the various competitions. The episode will be published on iTunes and Podcast Alley, as always, following the live show.

item.title: Episode 73 IronRadio - Topic The Most Interesting Gym Machines
item.description: We don't often use machines, but when we do we prefer... Rob, Phil and Dr. L talk shop about the most interesting gym machines they've come across in their travels. What weirdness is good and not so good? What does research say about injuries on machines versus free weights? When does Phil use wrist straps? How often does Fortress sleaze around the leg extension machine? Get in on our discussion ***AND WIN STUFF*** by calling us at 206-203-3798 and telling us what YOU prefer. Let other listeners drink from the fountain of your experience. Stay thirsty, my friends.

item.title: Episode 72 IronRadio - Guest Graeme Thomas Topic Calorie Counting
item.description: Lonnie, Rob and Phil talk with exercise physiologist and nutrition professional Graeme Thomas about how nutrition and exercise science get twisted around, somewhere between the original (good) science and the mistaken public message that consumers receive. Frustrated folks who are calorie counters are a good example. What else in the modern world could be making us fat? How do you narrow-down which nutrients help versus harm you or how to train? Find out.

item.title: Episode 71 IronRadio - Topic Eat (Big) with a Plan
item.description: Phil, Lonnie, Rob and Charles talk about eating for strength and size like a bull's (a Fortress analogy). How much does it take? How is Fortress chowing his way to over 290 pounds and how is Lonnie approaching a clean bulk toward 215, knowing he's 41 and the fat will have to come off come January? Why is Phil unafraid of buckets of barbeque? Learn how to eat for size and even pull back on gym time without fear and fret. ***NOTE: Have you noticed? Iron Radio.org now records live on THURSDAYS at 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time. This will not affect those who tune in to the pre-recorded shows via iTunes or Podcast Alley.

item.title: Episode 70 IronRadio - Guest Gray Cook Topic Functional Movement Screens AND Knowing professional limts
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk with Physical Therapist Gray Cook, this time about adding functional movement screens to fitness assessments - and later in the show also about strength professional scope of practice and referrals. ***NOTE: Have you noticed? Iron Radio.org now records live on THURSDAYS at 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time. This will not affect those who tune in to the pre-recorded shows via iTunes or Podcast Alley.

item.title: Episode 69 IronRadio - Guest Jon Mike Topic Weekly training split routines
item.description: Lonnie and Phil talk with doctoral student and strongman athlete Jonathan Mike about the science and application of various weekly training regimes. Surely intermediate and advanced guys cannot exercise their whole body every day. So what comes next? And how much of what we do has a real scientific basis? There's a specific focus on the number of days per week one should lift. We also discuss how to divide up your week - by specific body parts and muscle groups versus splits based on various exercise movements and strongman field events. ***ALSO NOTE: IronRadio.org will has moved to recording live episodes on THURSDAYS. This will not affect those who tune in to the pre-recorded shows via iTunes or Podcast Alley.

item.title: Episode 68 IronRadio - Topic What its like to compete in strength sports
item.description: Lonnie, Rob, Phil and Charles discuss what its like to actually compete in various strength sports. This one can be helpful for listeners intrigued but not experienced at strength and bodybuilding competitions. From the initial trigger to get competitive to jitters the night before to how we look at the competition, to how frequently we think one should compete, there's lots of first hand advice and information here. Listen for a little smart alek Arnold parody when Dr. L gets romantic notions about his competitions. ***ALSO NOTE: IronRadio.org will be moving to recording live episodes on THURSDAYS starting at the end of August. This will not affect those who tune in to the pre-recorded shows via iTunes or Podcast Alley.

item.title: Episode 67 IronRadio - Guest Garrett Smith Topic Nightshade Foods and Joint Pain
item.description: Phil, Lonnie and Rob talk to Naturopath Garrett Smith about a theoretical relationship between nightshade plant foods like tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant or hot pepper and joint pain and inflammation. (Many lifters are familiar with joint pain! Could you be genetically susceptible to this potential dietary influence?) This is a controversial topic that crops up every so often among lay audiences and actual mechanisms behind any problems with these fruits and veg are unknown. Plus, there are good things about these foods like potassium, fiber and even prevention of prostate cancer, so keep an open but critical mind. Lots of speculation and anecdotal evidence in this episode on a possible connection that has little documentation in the scientific literature.

item.title: Episode 7 Experiments vs Experience 2.0 What makes one competitive level in bodybuilding
item.description: Rob and Lonnie answer the question, What exactly equals competitive status in amateur bodybuilding? Hard science on physical size norms from competitors and pragmatic opinions on competitive size and cred are discussed. Are YOU big enough to compete? Find out! THIS IS NOT THE FLAGSHIP IRON RADIO PODCAST, BUT A DIFFERENT SHOW THAT WILL SOMETIMES APPEAR

item.title: Episode 66 IronRadio - Guest Photographer Brian Moss Topic Bodybuilding Culture, Changes, Photography
item.description: Phil, Rob and Lonnie stroll down memory lane with Brian Moss, about the essence of bodybuilding in the 70s, 80s and 90s, the popularity of Better Bodies Gym (remember those shirts?), and tales from backstage and in the photography studio.

item.title: Episode 65 IronRadio - Guest Dr. John Berardi Topic Starting an Exercise-Nutrition Coaching Business
item.description: Lonnie, Phil and Rob chat with exercise-nutrition-lifestyle entrepreneur John Berardi about his background in strength sports and about tips for others wanting to get into the healthy lifestyle business. Mission statements, marketing, education, competitive cred and other important considerations get discussed.

item.title: Episode 64 IronRadio - Topics Gym Achievements, Behind the Scenes of Sports Supplement Industry
item.description: Rob, Lonnie, and Phil get carried away with some gym talk, then get down to the gritty business of discussing first hand tales of the dietary supplement industry. If you're a supplement enthusiast, some of these true tales and consumer tips are must-listens.

item.title: Episode 63 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Mauro DiPasquale Topic Carb Cycling, Powerlifting
item.description: Rob, Lonnie, Phil and Charles talk with Dr. Mauro DiPasquale about carb phases throughout each week and about how powerlifting has progressed - or not - over the years. PLUS, we announce the winner of our June Nutrition Stories contest!

item.title: Episode 62 IronRadio - Guest Dr. Peter Lemon Topic Latest Research, Hosting Health and Nutrition Symposia
item.description: Lonnie, Charles, Phil and Fortress learn from world-famous Dr. Peter Lemon (Lonnie's former mentor) about his recent research on vibration training, high-intensity interval training for fat loss, fish oils, protein and more. Dr. Lemon then offers tips on hosting your own public symposium for nutrition and exercise enthusiasts. PLUS, listen as Lonnie and Fortress discuss details on our Summer Nutrition Stories contest!

item.title: Episode 61 IronRadio - Guest Alwyn Cosgrove Topic Success in the Gym Business
item.description: Charles, Lonnie, Phil and Fortress talk with Alwyn Cosgrove about the gym and personal training business. There is also a bonus segment at the end on what alcohol does to muscle tissue and hormones. PLUS, listen as Lonnie and Fortress discuss details on our Summer Nutrition Stories contest!

item.title: Episode 60 IronRadio - Guest Bryan Kavanagh Topics Alcohol PLUS Breaking Training Rules
item.description: Phil, Charles and Fortress talk with Bryan Kavanagh about everything from fat loss to martial arts to alcohol to breaking training rules on purpose. Also listen as Fortress announces details on our Summer Nutrition Stories contest!

item.title: Episode 59 IronRadio - Guest Rachel Cosgrove Topic Women's Training
item.description: Phil, Charles and Fortress discuss the training of women with Rachel Cosgrove. Also listen as Fortress announces details on our Summer Nutrition Stories contest!

item.title: Episode 58 IronRadio - Guests from Crossfit Centers Topic Small Group Training
item.description: Phil, Charles and Fortress discuss personal training in small groups with their Crossfit guests.

item.title: Episode 57 IronRadio - Guest Andy Slagle Topic Whey Protein for Lifters
item.description: Phil, Fortress, Charles and Lonnie discuss whey protein and big eating using whole foods for muscular gains.

item.title: Episode 56 IronRadio - Topic Fitness and Nutrition Fundamentals PLUS Crazy Gym Stories
item.description: Lonnie, Charles and Fortress discuss a listener email about the "you know" aspects we sometimes take for granted, like the definition of fitness, fundamental exercise prescription, eating to support your training, protecting yourself as a fitness consumer, etc. PLUS, at the end of the episode the guys share crazy gym stories they've seen over the years.

item.title: Episode 55 IronRadio - Topic Beginning Your Fitness Transformation
item.description: Charles, Lonnie, Phil and Fortress discuss a listener email question about overcoming barriers when starting to transform your body and embark on a path to greatness. All kinds of tips here on goal setting, motivation, rewarding yourself and more.

item.title: Episode 6 Experiments vs Experience 2.0 Bonus Episode Complete Thailand-Japan Travelogue
item.description: Finally Dr. L has finished editing the complete presentation logging his travels to Japan and Thailand; plenty of nutrition science here from the ICN International Conference (coffee, leucine, protein, etc.) along with food logs and other stuff. Photos and a full article can be found in the article library at www.ironradio.org. If you've wondered what it is like to undertake science travel check out this 45 min. episode. THIS IS NOT THE FLAGSHIP IRON RADIO PODCAST, BUT A DIFFERENT SHOW THAT WILL SOMETIMES APPEAR

item.description: Charles, Phil, Rob and Lonnie interview Robert Dos Remedios about his background and lifestyle as well as his thoughts on vegetarian strength training.

item.description: Rob interviews Nathan and Scott, the forces behind the new Muscle Insider magazine. Also listen as Fortress nitpicks over the winners of our 50th EPISODE TRIVIA CONTEST!

item.description: Rob, Lonnie, Phil and Charles talk to pro strongman athlete Derek Poundstone about his training, eating, favorite events and more. Also listen at the end for last minute details on our 50th EPISODE TRIVIA CONTEST!

item.description: Lonnie and Rob talk with scientist Nick Burd about the single best lifting intensity and number of sets to max-out protein synthesis (muscle gains).
